loans.name: Marysela

texts.en:
Marysela is a married mother of five children  all in school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.
She has operated a poultry business for the past five years, selling to neighbors and passersby. She mentioned diseases as a major challenge in her business. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase chicken feed and chicks. Marysela decided to join Yehu to access loans and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicken feed and chicks

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is a married woman  with five children, all  attend school. They live at their own house that is without electricity and running water. 

She has operated a home-based fish selling business for  ten years. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

She wants to purchase bundles of fish and dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish..

loans.name: Ines Germania

texts.es:
Inés es casada, tiene 27 años, se casó cuando tenía 20 años. Vive en su casa propia junto a sus dos hijos de 2 y de 7 años respectivamente y su esposo que tiene 34 años, él trabaja actualmente de jornalero. Su hijo actualmente está estudiando en una escuela fiscal.
Vive en la Merced de Cobuendo, que pertenece a la parroquia Chaltura, en la zona las personas se dedican a la crianza de animales, los turistas visitan Chaltura ya que ahí se expende el cuy asado que es un plato típico del lugar.
Igual que sus vecinos, Inés también se dedica a la crianza de animales desde hace 7 años, el negocio lo aprendió de su abuelita, ella compra chanchos pequeños, los cría y luego los vende. Los compradores van a su domicilio para realizar la compra, así que ella no gasta en transporte para llevar a los chanchos a la feria. Además tiene un ingreso extra en su domicilio ya que también corta el cabello a sus vecinos, ella después de la escuela estudio belleza por tres años, así que conoce del este negocio también.
El crédito lo va invertir en la adecuación de la chanchera y compra de más chanchos, ella espera tener mayor seguridad para que no sea víctima de un robo, además con la inversión espera mejorar sus ingresos y ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Inés agradece a Fundación alternativa por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Ines is 27 years old and married. She got married at the age of 20. She lives in her own house with her two sons, who are 2 and 7 years old, as well as her husband, who is 34 years old. Currently, her husband works as a day laborer, and her son studies at a public school. She lives in Merced de Cobuendo, which belongs to the parish of Chaltura. In this place, the people work raising animals. Tourists visit Chaltura because roasted guinea pig is sold there, as it is a typical dish of the area.

Like her neighbors, Ines also makes a living raising animals. She has been performing this work for the past 7 years. She learned this business from her grandmother. She buys small pigs, raises them, and then sells them. The buyers go to her home to make their purchases, so she does not spend on transportation to take her pigs to the fair. Moreover, since she also cuts her neighbors' hair at her home, she earns additional income. After school, she studied beauty for three years, so she knows this business as well.

She is requesting a loan to buy more pigs and to improve the pigpens. She hopes to have greater security so that she is never the victim of a robbery. In addition, with this loan, she hopes to increase her income and to give her children a better quality of life. Ines gives thanks to Fundacion Alternativa for the help that she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and to improve the pigpens. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income.

loans.name: Sokhun's Group

texts.en:
Sokhun is a 45-year-old mother of two children who are both in school. Sokhun is living with her family in a rural area of Kampong Cham province. She sells grocery items, grows rice and cucumber as the main sources of her family’s income. Her husband works as a taxi driver to earn additional income to complement the family’s needs. Her daily income is about 56,400 KHR per day and she is able to save about 23,000 KHR each day. 

Sokhun has been with VisionFund for one cycle already and the loan has helped her to improve her family’s living. Now she decides to lead a small group to take a new Kiva loan via VisionFund again because of her crop has been destroyed by insects since last year, which causes her to have not enough fund to keep running her businesses.  She will use her loan portion to buy more grocery items to sell and take the rest of money to buy seeds and fertilizer. She hopes that her current businesses will be improved through this loan.

loans.use: buy grocery items to sell

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom at their home to improve access to sanitation and water sources.

loans.name: Lai Heang

texts.en:
Lai Heang is a rural villager living in Kampong Cham province. She is ages 27 years old and a mother of two children who are both too young to get in school.  She is a cassava farmer and also works as a paid worker for four years, earning about 43,800 KHR per day. Due to her crop not growing well and the depreciation of cassava’s price in the market, this causes her to lack the fund to start doing farming again for this season, so she decides to take a new Kiva loan via VisionFund.  

For Lai Heang, this is the fourth Kiva loan and the previous loan helped her family to have a better living condition. With this loan, she will spend it on buying one more hectare of farmland to expand her farming area. She hopes to gain more yields than last years.

loans.use: buy land to farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Truth Group

texts.en:
The members that belong to the group called Truth are two women who are into foodstuffs (plantain, coco-yam, cassava), palm oil, snails, beads etc. and live in the same neighborhood. They are seeking their 10th loan with ID-Ghana.

The representative of the group is named Christiana. She is 59, married, and a mother to a 20-year-old boy who is in university. She has been in the foodstuff (plantain, coco-yam, cassava) and palm oil business for more than 10 years. With this loan, she is going to be able to increase the quantity of her products, foodstuffs (plantain, coco-yam, cassava) and palm oil to sell to customers.

Christiana wishes to buy her own house and to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy foodstuff (plantain, coco-yam, cassava) and palm oil to sell to customers.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 25-year-old engaged man. In 2013, he opened his restaurant after he finished his vocational studies in hospitality. Luckily, he has not faced any remarkable difficulties.

In addition to his restaurant, Mohamad acquired a loan from Kiva's field partner to establish an Internet station where he provides Internet service to villagers upon request.

He is working hard to develop both businesses to earn a good income so he can move forward with his marriage plans.

Today, Mohamad is requesting a Youth Loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua, to buy updated Internet equipment to provide his customers with a better connection.

He hopes to continue developing and expanding both businesses in a well managed way.

loans.use: To buy updated Internet equipment to provide his customers with a better connection

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children who all go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She operates a restaurant in the market. She has been in this business for the last four years, working seven days a week. She has requested a loan from MCDT – SACCO to buy green bananas, flour, beans, beef, and sweet potatoes. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a refrigerator for selling cold drinks. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy green bananas,flour beans, beef, and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Assad

texts.en:
Assad is a 33-year-old married man from Rafah city, which is famous for its agricultural lands and good crops. Assad has a small farm where he grows different kinds of fruits and vegetables. Assad took out a USD loan from FATEN to buy seed and seedlings for his farm. This will help him to improve his business and also improve his family's living conditions. 
Assad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy seed and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 29-year-old single man from the city of Qalqilia. Qalqilia is very famous of its agricultural land and good crops. Mohammad would like to start a fruit and vegetable farm. He is experienced from his previous job.

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN to buy seeds and seedlings for his new farm. This will make him more independent and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds and seedlings.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 55 years old and has four children. She is married and has one child who is still in school.

Elizabeth is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs.

Elizabeth has been in pig-fattening for four years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Elizabeth would like to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy electrical supplies

loans.name: La

texts.en:
La is 33 years old and a father of two small children who are too young to attend school.  His family is living in Kampong Cham province and for thirteen years his family’s living has depended on growing rice on two hectares of farmland. La also works as a construction worker as an additional source of income for his family.  He earns about 51,300 KHR per day from both work activities, and saves about 30,000 KHR each day for emergency needs. 

La has a dream to renovate his old house, but he has not enough money to do so because his crop has been destroyed by insects since last year.  Due to this, he has now decided to take this first Kiva loan via VisionFund to fulfill his needs. He hopes that this loan will help him to have a better house for his family to stay in and improve his family’s living.

loans.use: to renovate his old house

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia has been involved in a retail shop since 2013. She started her business with her own working capital of $350. She opened her kiosk because she lives near many people, so many people come to buy in her kiosk every day. She also raises animals, like pigs and chickens. Natalia is married but she has no children, and there are just two members in her family.

Now she is requesting a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy additional items that people like, such as slippers, mirrors, glues, flashlights, frames and other things, to sell in her kiosk. She is happy because, with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she can build her business into a very big one in the future, and thus her income can be increased.

loans.use: to buy slippers, mirrors, glues, flashlights, frames, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Cigit

texts.en:
Cigit is one of Ruma’s agents and lives in Yogyakarta, a city located about one hour by airplane from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Happily married and the mother of two daughters and one son, Cigit is the agent of Mapan, Ruma's e-commerce business for lower communities.

Mapan enables customers to save, little by little, by depositing change at agents like Cigit and as their balance grows, it allows customers to make major purchases such as housewares, appliances, and school supplies.  As a Mapan agent, Cigit is responsible for processing deposits from customers into their Mapan accounts as well as receiving orders from customers who want to buy products listed in Ruma's Mapan catalog. When a customer orders, Cigit will submit the order via SMS and, within 5-10 days, the product will be delivered to the customer. With Mapan, Cigit believes that her community will be able to have access to higher quality products with lower prices. 

By supporting this loan you will be providing extra working capital for Cigit's shop. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to help community members purchase products.

loans.name: Obada

texts.en:
Obada is a single man living in  West Irbid, Jordan. He is 22 years old and a 4th year university student majoring in visual arts. 

The income that comes from his father’s job is needed for his family of five members. They face financial problems that lead Obada to apply for an educational loan to help him cover his semester fees. 

Obada`s future plan is to work in the same field.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a 34-year-old married man from the city of Dier Albalah, which is located in the Gaza Strip. He  has two sons and one daughter. Mohammed works in the public sector and earns a low-income. This income barely covers  the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living. 

Muhammad has a horse and cart to transports stones, sand, and building materials.  This is the main source of income. He cares a lot about his horse.
Muhammad took a USD loan from FATEN to buy a new cart for his horse. Muhammad can improve his business, increase his sale, and income.

loans.use: to buy a new cart for his horse.

loans.name: Saudah

texts.en: Saudah is married with four children, three of whom go to school. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food. She sells fruits and vegetables at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for 15 years. She sells seven days a week. She has applied for a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy passion fruits, eggplants, oranges, onions, cabbages, tomatoes, pineapples, and sweet bananas. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the perishability of fruits. She hopes to grow fruit.

loans.use: to buy passion fruits, oranges, onions, cabbages, tomatoes and pineapples.

loans.name: Ibtissam

texts.en: Ibtissam is a 56 year old married woman living with her husband and two children. She has been working at her house vending clothing and perfumes to help her family meet the needs of life. She is talented and has been working in this business since 2010. She is well-known in her region and enjoys a good reputation. To better develop her business, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l. She will use the loan to buy a new summer clothing collection to improve her business and thus her income.

loans.use: to buy a new summer clothing collection

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 46 years old. She is married and is blessed with five children. She has a maize milling business and has been in this business for more than five years now. She will use this loan to buy more maize for making maize flour to sell and hence to make more profits to support her family.

She will use the anticipated profits to buy more cereals for use in her business. She will also buy a motorcycle and start a motorcycle transport business.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her current business, make more income, and be able to provide health care for her family.

loans.use: to buy more maize for making maize flour to sell and hence to make more profits to support her family.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 50-year-old single woman who lives with her mother. Due to the high cost of living and her deceased father's low pension, she request a loan. She wants to depend on herself and be a productive woman  and decided to use her sewing talents. 

She took a loan three years ago and bought a sewing machine and equipment to cut fabric. She sews clothes and sells to the neighbors. She was contracted to design and make a graduation gown and she needs help to do that.  She decided to apply for a new loan to buy another sewing machine and let her sister help her in her business.  She will use the loan to buy more supplies, fabric, and yarn. She will be able to increase her income and raise the quality of her work.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine, fabric, and yarn.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 50 years old and married and is blessed with four children. She is a poultry farmer and has been selling eggs and chicken to her customers.

She will use the loan to buy poultry feeds such as chick mash and layer mash. She hopes this will enable her to get more eggs and chicken to sell and that she will generate more income to support her family.

Her future hopes and dreams are to be a successful poultry farmer and educate her children and live a comfortable life with her family.

loans.use: to buy poultry feeds such as chick mash and layer mash, and she hopes this will enable her to get more eggs and chicken to sell.

loans.name: Chamangul

texts.en:
Chamangul is a responsible woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1977. She is living in a village with her family. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a taxi driver. 

Chamangul has been a tailor for about 17 years. She serves Tajik women of her area with traditional woman's dresses. She likes her business and has regular clients. 

Because of a low standard of living, she and her husband experience difficulties in ensuring their family's well-being. They decided that her husband will fly to Russia and work, to earn more money to feed their family. 

She appealed to CSC MDO IMON International and Kiva lenders, asking for a loan to buy a ticket to fly her husband to Russia. She hopes to be supported and that her husband could earn money to send to her, so the family can live better. 

Chamangul awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to buy a ticket to fly her husband to Russia, so he can work.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a poultry business for seven years, selling at the market. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital in her business. She decided to join Yehu to access a loan and to boost her business. With the loan, she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feeds for her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feeds for her business

loans.name: Noha

texts.en: Noha is a 52-year-old married woman with four children, two of whom are still studying. Her husband is the main income source for the family, working in the agriculture field for many years.  Noha doesn’t work and only takes care of her home and family. Currently, she is requesting a loan from Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children's educational fees. She is thankful to Kiva for allowing them to continue their education.

loans.use: to pay for her children's educational fees.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a 60-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and six children, some of whom are still attending school. Her husband is the main income provider for the family and works untiringly to satisfy their necessities of life, and till now he earns a fair revenue.

That’s why, today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children’s educational fees. She said that the loan will surely help her to register them for the coming school year, which makes her very satisfied.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.en:
Marhabo is a talented woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1982. She is married and has three children. She is a tailor who sews traditional women's dresses, and she has regular clients each day.

She likes her activity and is ready to work hard on customers' orders. Her dresses are differentiated by high quality and low price. She already has ten years of practice sewing dresses.

Marhabo appealed to IMON and Kiva, asking for a loan to buy a new computerized sewing machine that would help her to sew more easily and quickly. She hopes to be supported and awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to buy a new computerized sewing machine that would help her to sew more easily and quickly.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en: Lanie is 49 years old, married, and has three children, who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a business selling household goods in the Philippines and applied for a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy more goods to sell. Lanie has been in this business for five years. In the future, Lanie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more household goods to sell.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en: Melanie is 32 years old and has two children, who are in school. Melanie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Melanie applied for a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies for her business. Melanie has been raising pigs for two years. She has borrowed twice from NWTF in the past to sustain her business. In the future, Melanie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for her pig fattening business.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia is 52 years old, married, and has four children. She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. Letecia is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Letecia has been fattening pigs for six years, and she also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables. She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pig fattening business.

loans.name: Verlinda

texts.en: Verlinda is 59 years old, married, and has four children. She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Verlinda applied for a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. Verlinda has been in this business for four years, and she has borrowed four times from NWTF in the past to sustain her business. Verlinda would like to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for her pig fattening business.

loans.name: Adoracion

texts.en: Adoracion is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish nets and materials for boat repairs. Adoracion has been in this business for three years. She earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish nets and materials for boat repairs.

loans.name: Amélé

texts.fr: Agée de 38 ans, Amélé est une femme mariée qui demeure à Adidogomé. Mère de quatre enfants, Amélé est une restauratrice qui vend de la pate bandée préparée à base du maïs dans son quartier afin de satisfaire favorablement ses clients. Amélé s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des bols de maïs afin de réaliser sa préparation, Amélé nécessite ce microcrédit pour accomplir ses objectifs et maximiser son profit pour favoriser l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Amélé is 38 years old. She is married, and lives in Adidogomé. She has four children. She works in a restaurant in her district selling pate bandée (flour cooked in water) prepared with corn in order to satisfy her customers. Amélé buys her supplies once a month at the market. To order bowls of corn and prepare her recipe, Amélé needs this micro credit to accomplish her objectives and make a maximum of profit to help educate her children.

loans.use: to buy 67 bowls of corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom at their home to improve access to sanitation and water sources.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.es:
Brenda es una joven dedicada que tiene 20 años y está cursando el primer año de Contabilidad. Ella se propuso como meta ingresar a la facultad para poder ser alguien en la vida.
Está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y mejorar cada día.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Brenda is a dedicated young woman who is 20 year old.  She is in her first year of Accounting. She set a goal to join the faculty to be able to become someone in life.

Se is putting in her best efforts to be able to grow up and improve every day.

She is requesting this loan to pay the fees for her chosen career and thus be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Malakeh

texts.en:
Malakeh is a 37-year-old married woman who is a mother. She has fifteen years of experience in selling clothes. She developed her business from a previously acquired loan, from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, which helped her open her own clothing shop in 2008.

She is well-known in her region and liked by most of her customers because of the special choices she sells. Malakeh is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her merchandise. This will include special Holy Ramadan Eid and a summer collection to address her customers' needs and to increase her income.

Malakeh is a good-standing borrower and a smart businesswoman who works hard to provide her family the best living. In the future, she hopes to continue expanding and developing her business properly.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with special Holy Ramadan Eid and a summer collection.

loans.name: Budiarto

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Budiarto, one of Ruma's agents. Budiarto lives in Lebak, a village located at Banten province. It is about 4-5 hour’s drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his only daughter.

Budiarto owns a stall that sells small snacks, drinks, mobile airtime credits and provides bill payment services (like electricity, water, etc) to his community. Lebak is still in Java Island (near Jakarta), but the infrastructure over there is not as good as Jakarta. That is why Budiarto's community really needs him for access to communication and financial services.

As the business grows, Budiarto needs additional capital and is seeking a loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and provide more bill payment services to his community. Budiarto’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business for his community, a Ruma’s latest product called Mapan, so later, his community can have access to better products with lower prices.

Budiarto is the one who is seen in the photo. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more mobile airtime credits and utility bill payments (like electricity, water, etc) for members of his village community.

loans.name: Ondi

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Ondi, one of Ruma's agents. Ondi lives in Lebak, a village located at Banten province. It is about 4-5 hour’s drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He owns a stall that sells vehicle spare parts and mobile credits for his community. Even though Lebak is still in Java Island, the infrastructure is not as good as Jakarta. That is why Ondi's community really needs him, so they can have access to communication and financial services.

As the business grows, Ondi needs additional capital and is seeking a loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Ondi’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business for his community. This includes a Mapan product, so his community can have access to better products with lower prices.

Ondi is the one who is seen in the photo. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of his local community.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a married woman who has been blessed with six kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that is without electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees.

Kadzo operated a fish selling business, which has been operational for over three years. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in the business. Kadzo dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future.

With the KSHS 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale

loans.name: Kathia Cesilia

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Brillantes se reúne cada 15 días en la Ciudadela Leónidas Proaño en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Kathia, tiene  43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos  hijos de 21 y 18 años  que  estudian en universidad. Su esposo trabaja en un banco. 
Doña Kathia es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para sentirse independiente y con sus ganancias colaborar con los gastos del su hogar, ella se dedica al comercio,  vende joyas de plata y joyas bañadas en oro entre otras cosas que vende, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta pero la mayoría de sus ventas las realiza en su casa, cada vez que ella necesita mercadería viaja a Cuenca ciudad donde consigue joyas de muy buena calidad y a buen precio, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho o quince días. Lleva más de 6 años con este negocio el cual le permite ganar lo suyo por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar joyas en plata y bañadas en oro ya que tiene muchos pedidos. Lleva más de 9 años  en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The communal group "Mujeres Brillantes" meets every fifteen days in the Leónidas Proaño citadel, in the city of Manta. The city is known for its beautiful beaches, which are visited year-round, and for being a city with an unparalleled beauty with many tourist attractions.

This is where Kathia lives. She is a 43-year-old woman who is married and has two children. Her children are 18 and 21 years old and they attend university. Her husband works at a bank.

Kathia is a woman who likes to work in order to feel independent and with her earnings, she contributes to the household expenses. She works in retail, selling silver and gold-plated jewelry, among other things.

She does door-to-door sales, but the majority of the sales she makes are from her home. Each time she needs merchandise she travels to Cuenca, a city where she gets very high quality jewelry for a good price. She leaves her products on credit and then charges every eight to fifteen days. She has been in this business for six years, which has allowed her to make her own money for the sake of her family.

This loan is to buy silver and gold-plated jewelry, as she has many orders. She has been in the communal bank for more than nine years and she likes it because the loans are fast. Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy silver and gold-plated jewelry.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr: Dramane Fassoun est celui qui est au milieu tenant dans sa main la corde attaché aux deux chèvres. Dramane Fassoun est un éleveur non alphabétisé, âge de 30 ans et marié, père d’un enfant  âge  de 2 ans ; sa femme fait la croix rouge à Kati  son rêve est d’acheté un terrain à Bamako et le construire. Il réside au Mali  Dans la mesure de promouvoir  plus de profits dans l’élevage de ses moutons, il a eu quelques soucis en cours de route dans l’exécution de son  métier, donc il a fait une demande de prêt au RMCR en vue d’acheter plus de moutons et de pouvoir développer une autre entreprise, il fait l’élevage depuis 3 ans tout en faisant son approvisionnement dans les foires de la localité en moutons et après avoir  les élevés il les vend au  marché tout en réalisant un bénéfice de 25000fCFA par cycle. Ce bénéfice lui permet d’assurer l’avenir de son enfants est   en revêtement, en santé et dans l’avenir  son éducation.
texts.en: Dramane Fassoun is the man in the middle holding a rope attached to two goats. Dramane Fassoun is an illiterate livestock farmer. He is 30 years old and married with a child of two; his wife works for the Red Cross in Kati. His dream is to buy a plot of land in Bamako and to build on it. He lives in Mali. He has had some problems with making a profit in his sheep farming business,  so he approached RMCR to request a loan to enable him to buy additional sheep and develop a new business. He has been sheep farming for three years, buying his livestock in local trade fairs. After fattening them, he sells them at the market and makes a profit of about  25000fCFA each season. This profit enables him to provide for his children's future, for clothing, and for his future  education.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Agée de 44 ans, Adjo est une femme mariée et vit à Ségbé avec ses quatre enfants. Pour contribuer aux besoins  quotidiens de la famille, Adjo vend des détergents et du  Javel dans son quartier afin de trouver son revenu nécessaire. Adjo s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché local. Adjo demande ce crédit pour commander des boites de Javel afin de disposer d’un stock nécessaire pour satisfaire ses clients et promouvoir l’éducation de ses enfants grâce au bénéfice tiré.
texts.en: Adjo is 44. She is married and lives in Segbe with her four children. To contribute to the daily needs of her family, Adjo sells detergent and bleach in her neighbourhood in order to earn the necessary income. Adjo stocks up three times each month at the local market. Adjo requests this loan to order cans of bleach so that she has sufficient stock to satisfy her customers and provide for her children's education with the profits she makes.

loans.use: to buy 3 cans of bleach.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr: A 39 ans, Ami est une femme mariée et avec ses quatre enfants. Ami est une revendeuse de poissons fumés et s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Ami réalise une très bonne rentabilité avec son activité génératrice de revenu. Ami nécessite ce crédit pour acheter des paniers de poissons afin de gagner plus de bénéfices et venir en aide à l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en: At 39 years of age, Ami is a married woman with four children. Ami resells smoked fish and gets her supplies three times per month at the market. Ami is very profitable in this money-making venture. She needs this loan in order to buy baskets of fish so that she can earn more income and assist in her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 7 baskets of fish

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia Juana  se sigue dedicando al negocio de artesania,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia,la socia le gustaria abrir una tienda mas grande de venta de artesanias. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Juana continues with her artisanal crafts business. Though this business the member wants to get her family by. She would like to open a larger store selling artisanal crafts. The member is requesting the loan to buy fabrics, yarn and looms. 

She is happy because of the loan and promises to make all of her payments.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, yarn and looms

loans.name: Ena

texts.en:
Ena is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking a long time to pay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en:
Cyrus is 34 years old, married to Hyline, and supports two children. He has been in the motorcycle transportation business for the last five years. The business earns him KES 9,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase motorcycle spare parts such as a piston pump, tyres, and boosters to repair and maintain his motorcycle so that he can offer better services to clients. 

He plans to use the business profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and to educate his children. 

His hope is to expand his business by purchasing more motorcycles for transportation services.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Anagelia

texts.en:
Anagelia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Anagelia is 47 years old and all five of her children are in school.

She has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines. Anagelia requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more dried fish to sell to her customers.

Anagelia has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Agus

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Agus, one of Ruma's agents. Agus lives in Lebak, a village located in Banten province, about four to five hours' drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Agus owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits and mobile phone accessories and provides bill payment services (for utilities like electricity and water) to his community. Even though Lebak is still on Java Island and really near Jakarta, its infrastructure is not as good as that in Jakarta. That's why Agus' community members really need him so they can have access to communication and financial services. 

As the business grows, Agus needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and provide more bill payment services to his community. Agus’ goal with Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community, through Ruma’s latest product called Mapan, so later, his community can have access to better products with lower prices. 

Agus is the one who is seen in the photo. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more mobile airtime credits and utility bill payments for members of his village community.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a married woman and has been blessed with eight children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live in their own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish-selling business for over three years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces major challenges of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the 10,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Santos Estela

texts.es:
La señora Santos Estela de 45 años de edad es casada vive con su esposo y sus hijos tres de ellos  trabajan y contribuyen a los gastos del hogar, vive en un barrio de Nacaome en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 12 años a su negocio el cual es una pulpería.
Doña Santos Estela vende todo lo relacionado a la canasta básica y sus clientes son los vecinos y amigos de su colonia, es una mujer muy  trabajadora y agradece a Prisma Por apoyarla siempre. 
Doña Santos Estela solicita el préstamo para la compra de arroz, azúcar, café, pan, harina, huevos, frijoles, condimentos, etc.  Y también quiere comprar cemento y arena para realizar una mejora a su vivienda con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y su vivienda, uno de sus  sueños  es en un futuro seguir  mejorando su casa y su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo  del 2015.
texts.en:
Santos Estela is 45 years-old, married and lives with her husband and children. Three of them work and contribute to home expenses. She lives in a neighborhood in Nacaome in southern Honduras. For 12 years, she has run her own business which is a local grocery store. She sells everything related to basic grocery needs and her customers are neighbors and friends in her community. She is a very hard-working woman and is always thankful to Prisma Por for helping her. 

Santos Estela is requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar, coffee, bread, flour, eggs, beans, condiments, etc. And she also wants to buy sand and cement to improve her house. She intends to improve her income and her house with the help of this loan. One of her dreams is of a future continuing to improve her home and business. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - May 2015.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, coffee, bread, flour, eggs, beans, condiments, and sand and cement to improve her business and her house.

loans.name: Soukna

texts.en:
Soukna is a 44-year-old Lebanese woman who lives with her husband and five children, three of whom are still studying. She cooperates with her husband to help her family meet the needs of life and be able to enhance their way of living. She raises cattle, specifically cows, and her husband also works in  agriculture.

Soukna is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay the last installment of her children’s educational fees. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans to help them continue their education.

loans.use: to pay the last installment of her children’s educational fees

loans.name: Asrori

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Asrori, one of Ruma's agents. Asrori lives in Lebak, a village located in Banten province, about a four-to-five-hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife. Asrori owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits and provides bill payment services (like electricity, water, etc.) to his community. Even though Lebak is still on Java Island and really near Jakarta, the infrastructure is not as good as Jakarta's. That's why Asrori's community really needs him to have access to communication and financial services.

As the business grows, Asrori needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and provide more bill payment services to his community. Asrori’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan, so later, his community can have access to better products with lower prices.

Asrori is the one who is seen in the photo. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more  mobile airtime credits and utility bill payments (like electricity, water, etc.) for members of his village community.

loans.name: Dioscara

texts.en:
Dioscara works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Dioscara requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Dioscara would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en: Robinah is married with three children, all of whom are in school. She has no additional family members. She operates a restaurant at the market. She has applied for a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas, beef, beans, cassava, flour, and cooking oil. She works at the market seven days a week. Her major business challenges include food seasonality. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, beans, beef, green bananas, and cassava.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her university tuition fees.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a 58 year old single woman. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Sylvia has a frozen food business in the Philippines. She requested a 30,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of frozen food to sell.

She has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Sylvia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of frozen food to sell.

loans.name: Yoram

texts.en:
Yoram, born in 1979, is a married father of five children, four of whom attend school. Yoram is a coffee trader in Kitojo, Kakanju in Bushenyi district. Working six days a week and 11 hours a day, he started this business to generate income to support his growing family and develop his big piece of land. His main challenges are pests, diseases, price fluctuations for coffee on the world market plus competition from other traders.  

Yoram also sells cattle to supplement his meager coffee income. He started this business in 2004 and has managed to grow it, hoping to educate his four children and build a bigger house for his growing family.  

Yoram is borrowing ugx5,000,000 to buy more coffee for trade since it’s the coffee season in south western Uganda. He hopes that UGAFODE Microfinance Limited will continue serving the poor in his village to avert poverty in his locality.

loans.use: To buy coffee for trade

loans.name: Bnd Kivulini Grp Group

texts.en: Faustine is 40 years old, married and has two children, both in school. He sells wood of different kinds, in a soft and hard wood business. He really works hard and has been running this business for two years now. Working from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily, Faustine is able to earn a good profit each month. He runs his business with assistance from his wife. He has approached Tujijenge Tanzania, a Kiva partner, to request business loan support. He will invest his loan to purchase more wood, hardwood and softwood. He desires to expand his business by purchasing more hardwood and softwood and to be a successful father. He is so thankful to everyone who will support his business. He will share this loan with his loan group, "Bnd Kivulini Grp", which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to invest his loan to purchase more wood, hardwood and softwood.

loans.name: Hilder

texts.en: Hilder is a resident of Teo Bia PAG in Lira municipality. She is a single lady who lives with her two siblings and takes care of them. Hilder sells bed sheets to generate money for supporting her siblings' education and maintaining her family. Due to the increasing demand for bed sheets in the surrounding area, Hilder has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX to purchase more inventory in order to sastify her customers' needs and support her family. She is grateful for Ugafode Microfinance Ltd and Kiva lenders for the services rendered.

loans.use: to buy inventory of bed sheets

loans.name: Pyi Taw Thar Village Group 2

texts.en:
The fund will help 30 group members. The featured borrower, Tin, is 37 years old and married. She has a son in primary school and Tin is excited for her son to have a big developed future. She sometimes helps her husband on their ten acres of crop farm and Tin as well does tailoring in the village along with household chores. She is purchasing fertilizer and other inputs for crop farming with the help of Proximity's loan.

The family hopes to have improvements in their cropping system this year and also boost the mostly income.

Pyi Taw Thar Group 2 is overseen by five CBO members, named Tin, Hla, Khin, Aye and Chaw (pictured above). The whole group involves 30 village customers and they will be helped to purchase gas and fertilizer for their farms from Proximity's loan.

The village is located in the Ayeyarwaddy Delta Region in Upper Myanmar. They mainly focus on crop farming and also do plantations.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other inputs for crop farming.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Amaranto es un hombre trabajador, organizado y perseverante, dedicado a su familia y apasionado por su labor. 

Desde hace 1 año es comerciante independiente, tiene una tienda ubicada en zona rural del municipio de Chinu, allí trabaja todos los días durante 12 horas cuenta con la ventaja de no tener mucha competencia, por lo que ya es reconocido por los diferentes ciudadanos que se han convertido en sus principales clientes. 

Con el apoyo del crédito fortalecerá sus inventarios comprando mecato, dulces, chocolatinas, galletería, esto le permitirá tener mayor variedad disponible para ofrecer a sus clientes y así aumentar las ventas. 

Amaranto manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir fortaleciendo y acreditando su negocio, para que le garantice mayor rentabilidad y así tener la capacidad económica para adquirir una casa propia en la que pueda disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida en compañía de su familia.
texts.en:
Amaranto is hard-working, organized and determined man. He is dedicated to his family and passionate about the work he does. 

He has been an independent salesperson for a year. He has a store located in a rural area of the municipality of Chinu, where he works every day for 12 hours a day. The advantage is he doesn't have much competition, so he is known by different residents who have become his main customers. 

With the help of the loan he will build up his inventory by buying pastries, sweets, chocolates and cookies. This will allow him to have a greater variety available to offer his clients and thereby increase sales.

Amaranto says his greatest longing is to keep on strengthening and establishing his business to guarantee more profitability and therefore have the financial means to buy his own house where he can enjoy a better quality of life with his family.

loans.use: to buy pastries, sweets, chocolates and cookies, which will allow him to have a greater available variety

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en:
Seraphine is 33 years old and lives in Kakamega town. She and her spouse support three family members.

She operates a motorcycle transport business and has employed someone to do the transportation services. She has been in this business for the last seven years and has been profitable. She will use the loan to purchase a new motorcycle which will help to serve more customers and generate income to support her family. She will use the anticipated profits to buy another motorcycle and also provide for her family's needs.

Her future hopes and dreams are to have a stable business and make more income to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell used clothing business in the Philippines.

She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of used clothing to sell.

Gemma has been in this business for 11 years now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en:
Jumwa is a married woman and has been blessed with three children all of whom attend school. Together with her husband they live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a fish selling business for over ten years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. Jumwa dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a single woman without children. She owns a house that is without electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Annah has operated a business selling fuel from her home to neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other operators in her business. With the KSHS 25,000, she wants to purchase more fuel. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase fuel.

loans.name: Santa

texts.en: Santa is a married woman with eight children, all of whom attend. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. She has operated a poultry business for the past seven years. She mentioned diseases as a major challenge in her business. With the loan, she wants to purchase chicken feed and chicks for her business. She decided to join Yehu to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicken feed and chicks for her business.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a married woman and has been blessed with seven children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a fish selling business for over 10 years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the Kes 10,000, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Precious

texts.en: Precious is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She has operated a farming business for two years. With the loan, Precious wants to purchase seeds and fertilizers to do farming in her business.  She mentioned seasonality as a major challenge in her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers to do farming

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.en:
Luz is 66 years old and lives in the town of Puerto Berrio, located in the north of Antioquia. She makes a living selling snacks and groceries to the local customers. Luz is extremely hard working, never taking a day off and only assisted by her daughter.

Given that she one day aspires to open up her own store, she wishes to take out a loan of 3,000,000 COP to buy tables, chairs, a fryer and extra stock to sell. She hopes that this loan can help improve her sales and attract more customers from her local area.

Luz one day dreams of buying herself a home so that she can live a better quality of life and be proud of what she has achieved with her small business.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, a fryer and extra stock to sell

loans.name: Alejandro De Jesus

texts.en:
Alejandro is 35 years old and lives in the capital of Antioquia, Medellín. Since 2002 he has putting all his effort into running a recycling business and doing his part to care for the environment, thanks in large part to the teaching of his grandfather. 

He would like to take out a loan of 2,000,000 COP in order to buy extra scrap metal, aluminium, copper, wood and cotton. He hopes that these extra materials will help him expand his business by offering new products to his clients, increasing his inventory and creating new positions of work. 

Eventually Alejandro hopes that he will be able to buy a new home for himself and his two young boys, each  aged 12, so that he can provide them with a brighter and better future.

loans.use: to buy extra scrap metal, aluminium, copper, wood, and cotton

loans.name: Rubiela De Jesus

texts.en:
Rubiela is 61 years old and lives in Medellín, the capital of Antioquia. She has been running a small grocery store since 1990, selling her products to the local consumers.

She would like to take out a loan of 1,500,000 COP to buy a freezer, more cold meats, lactose products and vegetables which would improve her stock and provide more options for her clients.

Rubiela is extremely dedicated to providing herself with a better quality of life and wishes to improve her income. It is for this reason that she can be found every day of the week for up to 14 hours a day in her store, attending to her clientele. With your help she can realize her dream!

loans.use: to buy a freezer, more cold meats, lactose products and vegetables

loans.name: Pyi Taw Thar Village Group 1

texts.en:
The fund will help 30 members in the group. The featured borrower, Khin, is 33 years old and married with a daughter who helps Khin on the farm in her free time. Khin and her husband farm on their 10 acres of crop farm that they got as heritage. They also have a small dry food shop in the village. The loan from Proximity will enable her to repair cropping machines as well as pay for the inputs on the farm such as gas for machines and labor.

She aims to expand her farm acres and make her store bigger, so that they will boost the family's monthly income. Khin is very much into education and trying to save for her daughter's school fees as much as she can.

Pictured above are the CBO leaders from Pyi Taw Thar Village Group 1, named (from right to left) Khin, Thandar, Kay, Khine and Nu. They oversee the group of 30 members and the fund will help them purchase fertilizer and other inputs for the crop farms.

This village is located in the Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta Region and consists of 400 households. They mainly focus on crop farming and also raise livestock as savings

loans.use: to repair cropping machines as well as pay for the inputs for the farm.

loans.name: Kha Lout Tayar Village Group 2

texts.en:
The funds will help the group of 30 members. Ohm, the featured borrower, is 55 years old, single and lives with her siblings and nephews. She has a 25-acre family farm and mostly spends her time working there. This loan will help her purchase fertilizer and gas for farming machines. Because of the unstable weather and insects on the farm, villagers are having difficulties while cropping. She wants her nephews to be developed and plans to open grocery stores for them.

Pictured above are the CBO leaders from Kha Lout Tayar Village Group 2 who oversee 30 members altogether. Named, (from right to left) Ohm, San, Thwe, Mar and Aye. The loan from Proximity Designs will help them purchase crop seeds, fertilizers and gas for cropping machines.

Kha Lout Tayar Village is located in the Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy River at Delta Region and they mainly focus on crop farming. They also plant betel leaves and seasonal foods for additional income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, gas for cropping machines and pay for hired labor.

loans.name: Faalagi

texts.en: Faalagi is a 36 year old woman who is unmarried with 2 children. She runs a taxi business to earn an income. She has 3 years with this business. Faalagi needs a loan to buy a brand new taxi worth 15k. She will use her profits to pay for her families weekly expenses. Faalagi joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a brand new taxi worth 15k

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that is without electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a retail shop for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation and seasonality in her place of operation.

With the loan she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Fiapito

texts.en:
Fiapito is 45 years old and a married woman with five children. She runs a small business selling rice, curry, and chicken in her community and has been doing this for three years. 

Fiapito has requested a loan to buy a sack of rice, salt, chicken, curry,  etc. She joined SPBD in June 2015 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Fiapito hopes to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a sack of rice, salt, boxes of chicken, curry, flour, etc

loans.name: Passy

texts.en: Passy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children and all of them go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She operates a pub in a shop that she rents. She has been in this business for the last three years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT–SACCO to buy crates of beer, soda, mineral water and snacks. Her major challenges include seasonality and power shortages. Her goal and aspiration is to own a bigger refrigerator to serve her customers better. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy crates of beer, soda, mineral water and snacks.

loans.name: Javier Alonso

texts.en:
Javier is a 57-year-old native of Medellín who is married and has two children. He makes a living running a grocery store and has done so since 1994. 

He wishes to take out a loan of 3,5000,000 COP to buy more stock for his store. He hopes this new stock will lead to greater sustainability for his business while increasing his sales and making him more competitive in the local market. 

Javier is an incredibly hard-working man who spends 10 hours every day of the week in his store, attending to his clients. He is hopeful that the dedication to his business will soon pay off and allow him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more stock for his store

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is 48 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the municipality of Mariquita, Tolima. His farm was passed on down to her from her father, and since1995 he has been in charge of producing agricultural products in order to help provide for his young family.

He would like to use this loan to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer,for all his crops, and hopes that it can have a hugely positive effect on his production, simultaneously increasing his income and expanding the capacity of the farm. 

Edgar dreams of being able to afford a good education for his 12 year old son and 6 year old daughter; this is why he can be found working tirelessly for 8 hours a day. Your help can have an enormous impact on Edgar’s future!

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer for all his crops

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.en:
Rosa is 48 years old and lives in Puerto Boyaca, Rionegro, with her husband and 11 year old son. She helps provide for the family selling artisanal handbags, which she has been doing for a little of a year.

She is looking to take out a small loan of $600,000 COP so that she can purchase more material to create her handbags with- usually she uses recyclable material as she can produce more of her products, but it can be difficult to find. 

She hopes that this small business venture can be instrumental in paying for her son’s education and paving the way for his future. Your help can make all the difference for Rosa and her family!

loans.use: purchase more material to create her artisanal handbags and pay for her son's education

loans.name: Jose Naval

texts.en:
Jose is 32 years and lives in the rural town of Andes, situated in the municipality of Itagui. There he runs a small coffee plantation, which he has been in charge of since 1998. 

He works extremely hard every day of the week, but this work has unfortunately been undone by the extreme weather. His crop has faced in recent times both long periods of rain and drought affecting his production severely. With the loan he hopes to make up for these difficult times by purchasing products such as coffee seed, soil, sacks and fertilizer.

Jose aspires to run an extremely successful coffee farm. He hopes that with the use of this loan, he can increase his sales and attract more clients whilst constantly expanding the business. His dream is to one day buy his own home so that he can lead a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase products such as coffee seed, sacks of earth, sacks and fertilizer

loans.name: Emperatriz Ester

texts.en:
Emperatriz is 67 years old and lives in the town of Sincelejo with her three children, where she has been running a store since 2007. 

She works for 10 hours a day, seven days a week but has dreams of opening up a larger store and so therefore needs to increase her sales in her current establishment. She would like to add some variety to her stock by purchasing deodorants and colognes, both of which are very popular with her customers. 

Emperatriz dreams of one day being able to pay for the education of her children and hopes to pass them down the business she has tended to for so long to them once they are old enough.

loans.use: purchasing deodorants and colognes for sale in her store

loans.name: Yefri Yorbey

texts.en:
Yefri is 22 years old and lives in the northern-based town of Tarazá, Antioquia, where he has been selling clothing merchandise since 2014.

With this loan he aims to purchase new shoes, with the aim of improving his sales and attracting more clients. 

Yefri works extremely hard for 7 hours a day, every day of the week, but wishes to create a better life for himself, and dreams of using this small business as a means to be able to pay for a university education.

loans.use: to purchase new shoes for selling

loans.name: Gustavo De Jesus

texts.en:
Gustavo is 57 years old and lives in the town of El Santuario, located in the region of Rionegro. Since 2005 he has run a business manufacturing broomsticks and mops. 

Whilst Gustavo works every day of the week except for Sunday, the high cost of products means that he hasn’t been able to sell as many of his goods as he would like. For this reason he wishes to take out a loan of 1,500,000 COP so that he can buy more stock to sell. He hopes this will create greater sustainability for his business and attract more clients. 

He dreams of one day being able to afford a better home in which to live so he can enjoy a greater quality of life. With your help he can make this possible!

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en:
Hajara is a Babban Gona farmer from Dan'asabe Village. She joined Babban Gona so that she could realise better yields on her farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Hajara  no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to increase her farmland. T

Through Babban Gona’s input loan she will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see her increase her income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Hajara now has the opportunity to ensure that all her children get a post secondary education .

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase this farmer’s yields

loans.name: Kha Lout Tayar Village Group 1

texts.en:
The funds will help the group of 30 members from Kha Lout Tayar Village. The featured borrower, Tin, is 47 years old and married with four children. She is very proud that all of her children chose their careers well as teachers and computer engineers. She has thirty acres of crop farm where she and her husband work every day. As a secondary business, the family also plants nipa palms, betel leaves and sells firewood as well. The loan will help her purchase fertilizer and pay for hiring the workers to help on the farm during the harvest season. As cropping covers the family's basic costs, she is very proud of doing this even though it's very tiring sometimes. Tin and her husband plan to open a computer repair shop for the engineering son in the future, so that they would be able to cover most of the expenses.

Pictured above are the CBO leaders, named Tin, Tin M, Than, Khin and San. They oversee 30 members of Kha Lout Tayar Village Group 1. With the funds, the group aims to purchase crop seeds, fertilizers and gas for cropping machines.

Kha Lout Tayar Village is located in the Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy River at Delta Region and they mainly focus on crop farming. They also plant betel leaves and seasonal foods for additional income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, petrol for farming machines and hire workers during harvest time

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen is married with four children. All of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. 

She sells fruits and vegetables at the market and has been in this business for seven years. She works in the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and perishability of fruits and vegetables. 

Allen has applied for a loan from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy cabbages, passion fruits, oranges, mangoes, and green peppers. 

She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, passion fruits, oranges, mangoes, and green peppers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more men and women's wear for resale.

loans.name: Dilbara

texts.ru: Дилбара, 50 лет, замужем, есть 6 детей. У нее среднее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 1990 года занимается сельским хозяйством. В хозяйстве Дилбары есть 6 коров, 27 овец. Ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет 29,700 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Дилбара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса за счет покупки дойных коров и увеличения объемов реализации молока.
texts.en: Dilbara, 50, is married and has six children. She has a high school diploma. Since 1990 farming has been her family’s primary source of income. She owns six cows and twenty-seven sheep. She makes about 29,700 Kyrgyz som (KGS) a month. Dilbara is requesting a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank in order to buy more livestock. She plans to reinvest the profit in her business and buy dairy cows to be able to sell more milk.

loans.use: to purchase some livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for growing organic watermelons

loans.name: Beishenbubu

texts.ru: Бейшенбубу, 59 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. Образование у Бейшенбубу среднее, вместе с супругом они занимаются животноводством уже 15 лет. По характеру она очень приятная и жизнерадостная и трудолюбивая женщина. В хозяйстве есть корова с теленком, 6 овец, лошадь, на участке есть теплица. Бейшенбубу решила развить свою деятельность. Для этого она обратилась в Банк «Бай - Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку лошади для увеличения поголовья скота. На прибыль от кредита Бейшенбубу планирует и дальше развивать ее деятельность, чтобы накопить на приобретение автомобиля.
texts.en: Beishenbubu, 59, is married and has four children. She has a high school diploma and for fifteen years has been breeding livestock together with her husband. She is gentle, cheerful and hardworking by nature. She owns a cow with a calf, six sheep, a horse and a greenhouse. Beishenbubu decided to expand her business and is requesting a loan of 70,000 Kyrgyz som (KGS) from Bai-Tushum bank to buy a horse and increase her herd. She plans to reinvest the profit in her business and save money to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase a horse in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Micalai

texts.en:
Micalai has been involved in business activities since 2013. She started with her own working capital of $500. She is earning a good income from selling her clothes because she is selling in the center of the market, so many people like to buy them. And she is still happy to do her business. 

Micalai is requesting a loan of $1,000. She is taking this loan because she wants to buy more clothes according  to what people like including shirts, batik shirts, gloves, and other clothes to sell. She also has animals like pigs, chickens and dogs.

loans.use: To buy shirts, batik shirts, gloves, and other clothes to sell.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a resident of Odoko, along the main street in the Lira municipality. He is a married man with one school-going child. He operates a photo studio and dry cleaning business.

George applied for a loan of UGX 3,000,000 to buy photo papers and a camera. These will be used to boost his photo studio and serve his clients better. His clients have increased as a result of the stability being realized in the area.

His main challenge in this business is competition and rent costs. With the support from Ugafode Microfinance Ltd and Kiva lenders, for which he is grateful, he hopes to improve his premises and better his competitors.

loans.use: to buy photo paper and a camera.

loans.name: Luz Maira

texts.en:
Luz is 37 years old and lives in the municipality of Itagüí, located just south of the capital of Antioquia, Medellín. She makes a living selling health and beauty products from her home and has been doing so for the past five years. 

She would like to buy more products to add to her stock so she can improve her sales and increase her clientele base. 

Luz dreams of opening up her own store and using the success of her business as a springboard to buy a new home in which to live.

loans.use: to buy more products to add to her stock

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is an old man of 35 years living with his family.

He is a proprietor of a school in his community. He started this to bring services closer to the community. He does agriculture to supplement the meagre income from the school.

According to him, through the above projects, he has been able to buy land and take care of his family and sisters. Alex is acquiring this loan to complete another structure at the school in order to increase his intake and his service delivery. Alex says he serves people around his village and neighboring communities. According to him, his biggest challenge is the lack of enough capital to boost his businesses.

He is described as a hardworking man who has been able to achieve everything with his strength. Finally, he appeals to UGAFODE to loan him money to boost his businesses.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets and cement to finish a classroom.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta live in Ermera, and she is a businesswoman. She is very highly interested in doing business. She has been doing business since 2014 with her own working capital of $500. 

Crisanta is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy additional supplies to keep in her store, including cooking oils, noodles, chips, biscuits, lotion, soap, shampoo, and other things to sell. She is taking this loan to improve her management of her business because she wants to open a big store in the future.

loans.use: To buy cooking oils, noodles, chips, biscuits, lotion, soap, shampoo and other things to sell.

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru: Шухрат уроженец города Худжанд. Ему 43 года. Он женатый человек, и живет вместе с отцом, матерью, женой и детьми. Отцу 72 года. Маме 68 лет. Жене 30 лет. Худжанд большой и красивый город. В Худжанде много транспорта и народа. Шухрат в своем городе занимается таксистом. Он арендует автомашин марки «Sprinter». Ему арендовать машину не очень выгодно, но он вынужден, потому что надо прокормить семью. 4 года Шухрат занимается таксистом. Он хочет купить себе автомашину и зарабатывать на жизнь, потому что на собственном автомобиле ему выгодно работать. Он очень хочет приобрести себе желаемую автомашину, но ему бюджет не позволяет. Ему не хватает денежных средств, и из-за нехватки денег он обратился за кредитом. Шухрат будет очень рад на Вашу поддержку. Ваша поддержка поможет ему зарабатывать и прокормить семью.
texts.en: Shuhrat, 43, was born in Khujand. He is married and lives with his parents, wife and children. His father is 72, mother 68 and wife 30 years old. Khujand is a big and beautiful town. There are a lot of people and cars in its streets. Shuhrat works as a taxi driver. He has been in this business for four years. He rents “Sprinter” cars. Renting cars is not very profitable but he has to do it in order to put bread on the table. He would very much like to buy his own car because driving one's own car is more profitable. Since he does not have the money for it, he is requesting a loan. He is grateful for your help. Your support would help him to earn money and put bread on the table.

loans.use: to buy «Sprinter» cars

loans.name: Frangelina

texts.en:
Frangelina lives in Ermera, and she is a businesswoman. She has been doing business since 2012 with her own working capital of $1,000.

She is requesting a loan of $1,500 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her working capital to buy more additional supplies to keep in her store: rice, cooking oils, candy, hand and body lotion, candles, biscuits, sugar, noodles, slippers, soft drinks, hard drinks, and other things to sell.

She wants to open a big store in the future, so she was striving for business success.

loans.use: to buy rice, cooking oils, candy, hand and body lotion, candles, biscuits, sugar, noodles, slippers, soft drinks, hard drinks, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Juan David

texts.en:
Juan David is 27 years old and lives in the capital city of Antioquia, Medellín. Together with his brother, they work for 12 hours a day in their workshop where they make wooden cabinets.

Juan David is looking to improve on the model that he has built so far, and especially hopes to create greater sustainability for his business whilst becoming more competitive in the market. With this loan, he will buy more wood so he can increase the amount of products in his inventory, which he will then sell.
