The advantage of his home is that it is located near recent water connections, and the disadvantage is the lack of money to finish the potable water connection. His dream is to finish building his house.  He would like to connect the potable water for his house, kitchen and washroom and stop using well water to bring healthy water to his family.

This is the first sequence of loans from the institution in the 5 years that he is building the house. For these reasons Máximo is asking for a loan for the potable water connection in his kitchen, bathroom, and washroom so that his children grow healthy and strong.

loans.use: for the potable water connection in his kitchen, bathroom and washroom so that his children grow up healthy and strong.

loans.name: Lorena Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lorena es una mujer esforzada y trabajadora, proveniente de una familia de ocho hermanos, liderada por una madre soltera. Ella ayudaba a su madre desde los dieciséis años de edad,  vendiendo colas y accesorios para el cabello en su colegio, fue descubriendo su pasión por el comercio, ahora a los 38 años de edad, vende de forma ambulante en su vecindario y visita algunas empresas, ofreciendo colas, prensa pelos, cosméticos, perfumes y otros accesorios. 
En estos momentos, Lorena cree que es hora de hacer crecer su negocio, por eso ha solicitado a Kiva y MiCrédito un préstamo que le permita comprar nuevos productos como ropa y sandalias para mujer. En un futuro desea poder convertirse en una vendedora de productos por mayor a tiendas, además de tener un local propio donde poner una tienda.
texts.en:
Lorena is a hard-working and dedicated woman who comes from a family of 8 siblings led by a single mother. She has helped her mother since she was 16 years old, selling hair ties and hair accessories in her school. She discovered her passion for commerce and now at 38 years old, is a mobile vendor in her neighborhood. She visits businesses, offering hair ties, hair clips, cosmetics, perfumes, and other accessories. 

At this time, Lorena believes it's time to grow her business and therefore is asking Kiva and MiCredito for a loan that will allow her to purchase new products such as clothing and sandals for women. 

In the future she would like to be able to become a wholesale product vendor for stores in addition to having her own space to start a store.

loans.use: to purchase new products such as clothing and sandals for women.

loans.name: San José Group

texts.es:
Cierta comunidad oaxaqueña alberga un paisaje inigualable ya que está rodeada de grandes cerros en cuyas faldas emergen bastos sembradíos de caña de azúcar: principal actividad de la región. 
   De dicha localidad es originario el grupo San José integrado por ocho personas responsables y amables. Con el fin de solventar los gastos de su familia, Guadalupe, Irene, Pascuala y Guillermina se dedican a la cría y venta de cerdos. Por su parte Rutilo vende abarrotes; Eutimio, tacos; Cesaria, dulces y refresco mientras que Felipe siembra y cosecha maíz. 
   Doña Guillermina es una mujer muy apreciada en su comunidad donde es mejor conocida como Guille; ella lleva tres años dedicándose a la cría de cerdos y ha sacado provecho de la actividad ya que comercializa todos los derivados del animal. Guille vende la carne fresca, pero también prepara embutidos y manteca para mayor satisfacción de sus clientes. 
   Uno de los retos más frecuentes que presenta es el cambio de precio en el alimento de los cerdos por lo que siempre trata de tener la dotación suficiente en sus criaderos. El tiempo aproximado para que un cerdo logre su desarrollo óptimo es de seis meses cuando alcanza un peso de hasta noventa kilogramos. 
   Con las ganancias obtenidas, Guille sigue optimizando su actividad además de aportar a los gastos del hogar; otro logro ha sido remodelar los aparatos electrodomésticos para de toda su familia integrada por su esposo Jorge y seis hijos. El préstamo más reciente lo ocupará para comprar un ejemplar hembra pues espera poder vender las crías desde pequeñas. 
“Gracias a los préstamos de VisionFund México he logrado iniciar mi propia actividad y sé que al igual que yo más clientas han fortalecido su negocio” expresa Guille entusiasmada. 

*En la foto se encuentra todo el grupo, Guille es quien viste blusa color beige y falda color rosa.
texts.en:
A certain Oaxacan community has a unique landscape since it is surrounded by large hills on whose slopes emerge several sugar cane fields: the main activity in the region.

The group San Jose is from this area. The group consists of eight responsible and kind people. In order to cover their family expenses, Guadalupe, Irene, Pascuala and Guillermina breed and sell pigs. Rutilo sells groceries, Eutimio sells tacos, Cesaria sells candy and soft drinks and Felipe plants and harvests corn. 

Ms. Guillermina is a highly regarded woman in her community where she is known as "Guille". She has been breeding pigs for three years and has been successful in this business because she sells all the animal parts. Guille sells fresh meat but she also makes sausages and lard to better serve her customers. One of her most common challenges is the price fluctuation in the feed for her pigs which is why she always tries to have enough resources in her breeding center. The approximate amount of time for a pig to reach optimum development is six months, when it reaches a weight of 90 kilograms (about 200 lbs.). 

With her earnings, Guille continues to optimize her business. In addition to contributing to the household expenses, another one of her achievements has been to remodel the appliances for her family which is made up of her husband Jorge and her six children. She needs this latest loan to buy a female specimen since she hopes to sell the offspring when they are small. 

"Thanks to loans from VisionFund Mexico, I have been able to start my own business and I know that just like myself, more clients have strengthened their businesses", says Guille enthusiastically. * The whole group is pictured in the photo, Guille is wearing a beige blouse and pink skirt.

loans.use: to buy a sow for breeding.

location.town: Buena Vista, San Miguel Soyaltepec,  Oaxaca

loans.name: Manuel Ramon

texts.en:
Manuel is 70 years old and runs a poultry farm in the rural town of Chinu, situated in the region of Sucre. He has 5 children (4 daughters and 1 son). Even at his age he works for 8 hours a day, every single day of the week. 

He would like to buy 300 chicks to fatten up, which he can in turn sell to his clients. However, given the cost of animals and the competition he has from other farmers in his region, he needs some help to do so. 

Manuel dreams of not only expanding his business but also of eventually handing it down to his children, once he has finished working.

loans.use: to buy 300 chicks to fatten up.

loans.name: I Wayan

texts.en:
I Wayan back with his new loan. After succeeding with his grass cutting business, now he propose a loan to support his garden. I Wayan has a small land behind his house and he plants it with cacao, coffee and coconut. Beside use his loan to service his grass cutting machine, he also use it to buy fertilizer and farming tools. 

Now I Wayan has a permanent job to cut the grass around his village. Because its a large areas, he works on it with his employee. I Wayan feels very happy, all of his family feels the benefit. Now he hopes the garden will produce the maximum and he will fertilized all the crops in his garden. He will save all the profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farming tools

loans.name: Barno

texts.en:
Barno is a kind woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1969. She is married and has four sons. Her husband is a farmer. She has many years of practice planting agricultural products and selling them in the domestic market. She has also planted cereal for two years. This is a family business and all members of her family are involved. 

She rents land each year. She wants to buy land from a collective farm and use it for planting agricultural products. She appealed to IMON asking for financial support from IMON and Kiva to buy natural minerals, fertilizer, and seeds, and pay for the rental workers. She hopes to be supported and awaits Kiva lenders' compassion.

loans.use: to buy natural minerals, fertilizer, and seeds, and pay for the rental workers

loans.name: Srosvannak

texts.en: Srosvannak, an employee of a company, lives in Chhoung Preal Village with wife and a child. Beside his income, his wife works as a government officer to serve their country and also to earn extra income for their family. Srosvannak is always concerned about his family's safety when he and his wife are not at home, since his family is using a car battery for a power source and it has an acid substance. An accident could be caused if his child was careless. Concerned about his child's safety and environment, Vannak decided to apply for a Kiva loan in order to buy a solar home system. After using a solar home system, he would be relieved because he would not worry about his child's safety. His child could turn on the light by herself without help from an elder. His family could live in convenient conditions with bright light.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system

location.town: Chhoung Preal Village, Toek Hot Commune, Rolea Pe

loans.name: Luz Stella

texts.en:
Luz is 33 years old and lives with her husband and four-year-old son in the town of Sincelejo, Sucre. She sells toiletries and household goods in order to help provide for her young family, but her business lacks the capital to produce the sales she desires.

She would like to use this loan in order to increase her stock dramatically and improve sales, so that she can become more competitive with other local businesses and create more sustainability for the future.

Luz and her family were unfortunately displaced from their original home, which has made it difficult for her small business to succeed. She dreams of paying for her son’s education so that she can provide him with a brighter future, and hopes that with this loan she can combat the difficulties of the past and have a greater quality of life.

loans.use: to increase her stock of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en: A $600.00 loan is offered to Olga to improve her business. Olga lives in Ermera and she is a businesswoman. Most of her daily income is from her store, so she is still happy to do her business. She started to open her business in 2014, with her own working capital of $700.00 . She was going to add money to her principal amount to buy more supplies to keep in her kiosk such as cooking oils, coffee, sugar, noodles, candles, sardines, milk, eggs, biscuits, soft drinks soft, hard drinks and other things to sell. It has become her activity so she is happy to do it every day. She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin so she could have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: To buy cooking oils, coffee, sugar, noodles, candles, sardines, milk, eggs, biscuits, soft drinks soft, hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en: Pheap’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Pheap makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of 10 children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a firewood and charcoal vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of firewood and sacks of charcoal to sell for her firewood and charcoal vending business.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of firewood and sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es:
José, es un productor de café en una comunidad de Jinotega, departamento de Nicaragua. Vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos de 10 y 12 años en su pequeña finca, en la cuenta con  2.1 hectáreas de café certificado por comercio justo, UTZ y C.A.F.E. Practices, a través de la asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC).

Para garantizar las actividades de mantenimiento de su café este ciclo, él está solicitando un financiamiento para comprar los insumos y fertilizantes que se requieren para asegurar una buena cosecha, la cual proyecta sea de unos 35 quintales de café pergamino.

José dice que este rubro es rentable y que la inestabilidad del mercado se puede enfrentar con los precios mínimos que ofrece el mercado comercio justo, por lo que su objetivo es incrementar su producción y con ellos sus ingresos a fin de ir aumentando el área de su pequeña finca, y con ello mejorar las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
José is a coffee producer in a community of Jinotega, an administrative region of Nicaragua. He lives with his wife and his two children ages 10 and 12 in their small farm. He has 2.1 hectares of Fair Trade, UTZ, and C.A.F.E. Practices certified coffee through the Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC) association. 

To ensure the maintenance activities for his coffee this season, he is requesting a loan to buy supplies and fertilizers required to ensure a good harvest which he projects will be about 35 quintals (3,500 pounds) of parchment coffee.

José says that this industry is profitable and the market instability can be dealt with with minimum prices that the fair trade market offers. This is why his goal is to increase his production and along with it his earnings in order to increase the area of his small farm and thereby improve his family's conditions.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers required for his coffee plantation to ensure a good harvest.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en: Sophea is from Banteay Chmar, a village in northwest Cambodia. She is 41 years old. In 2000 she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. Sophea makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for the daily expenses. Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional handwoven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk and pay for fees related to loom preparation

loans.name: Shella

texts.en:
Shella is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling feeds in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feeds to sell for her buy-and-sell feeds business.

Shella has been in this business for 20 years. Shella earns more income from a general store.

Shella has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feeds to sell

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 52 years old and married with 10 children.

She earns a living by selling ornamental plants in the Philippines. Marina is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers, flower pots and other supplies for her business.

Marina has been in this business for five years and also earns additional income from basket weaving.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, flower pots and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 41 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Julieta has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from  buying and selling charcoal.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 38 years old and has a live-in partner with three children. With two children currently in school, Evangeline works very hard to provide for them.

Evangeline runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like coffee, snack foods, soft drinks, candies, biscuits, juice, etc. to sell.

Evangeline has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, snack foods, soft drinks, candies, biscuits, juice, etc. 

In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like coffee, snack foods, soft drinks, candies, biscuits, juice, etc. to sell

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en: Manuela lives in Ermera. She is married and a businesswomen.  She is applying for a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop for the business. Manuela has been involved in business activities since 2014, when she started with her own working capital of $800. She is earning a good income every day so she is still happy to do her business. She is taking this loan because she wants to add more items including milk, sardines, sugar, cooking oils, soaps, eggs, candles, shampoo, noodles, biscuits, aqua, soft drinks, and other things to sell.

loans.use: To buy milk, sardines, sugar, cooking oils, soaps, eggs, candles, shampoo, noodles, biscuits, aqua, soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 62 years old and married with four children.

Faith works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like rice, feeds, eggs, canned goods, etc. to sell.

Faith has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from selling ready-to-wear.

Faith aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like rice, feeds, eggs, canned goods, etc. to sell

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor is 60 years old, married, and works very hard to help her husband to earn additional income.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like soap, shampoo, noodles, chips, eggs, coffee, etc.

Leonor has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Leonor would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like soap, shampoo, noodles, chips, eggs, coffee, etc

loans.name: Noime

texts.en:
Noime is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Noime is 30 years old and has two children who are in school.

Noime has a business selling ice pop juice in the Philippines. Noime requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients and materials for her business.

Noime has been in this business for three years. In the future, Noime would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and materials for her business

loans.name: Juan David

texts.es:
Juan, con 22 años de edad, es soltero. Aprendió las labores del campo con su madre, debido a que es allí donde ha vivido siempre. 

Gracias a esto, se dedica a criar ganado lechero, cuya producción se utiliza para elaborar y vender quesos y el líquido como tal; de esta forma obtiene los ingresos suficientes para apoyar con los gastos del hogar. 

El cliente es un joven luchador, pujante, activo; ni la necesidad económica, ni la falta de oportunidades de empleo la detienen para seguir luchando y progresar. 

Actualmente solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de más ganado (vaca productora de leche), con el fin de aumentar su producción para poder satisfacer la demanda de los productos y así tener mejores ingresos. 

Esto le permitirá seguir ayudando con las obligaciones económicas del hogar y además podrá seguir invirtiendo  en su negocio para obtener más vacas y, poco a poco ir mejorando las condiciones y la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan, 22 years old, is single. He learned farm work with his mother, because that is where he has always lived. Thanks to this, he makes a living raising dairy cattle, whose production is used to make and sell cheese and the liquid itself. This way, he earns enough income to support the household expenses.

The borrower is a young fighter, vibrant, active; neither the economic necessity nor the lack of employment opportunities stop him from continuing to fight and progress. 

He is currently requesting the loan to invest it in the purchase of more cattle (milk-producing cows), in order to increase his production to be able to meet the products' demand and thus have better income. This will allow him to keep helping with the household's financial obligations. Also, he will be able to continue investing in his business to get more cows and, little by little, keep improving the conditions and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more cattle (milk-producing cows).

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 29 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, Elvira works very hard to provide for them.

Elvira runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Elvira has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, beers, canned goods, noodles, coffee, sugar, etc. 

Elvira would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita lives in Ermera and she is a businesswoman. She has been involved in business activities for a few years, starting with her own working capital. She has made the best of it. She has very high interest in doing business. She has a small store, and she hopes to open a bigger store, but her capital is not enough. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business.  She will use this loan to buy more additional items to keep in her store including candy, hand and body lotion, soap, shampoo, biscuits, eggs, cigarettes, candles, gambling cards, and other things to sell.  She is taking this loan because she also wants to improve her management for her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy candy, hand and body lotion, soap, shampoo, biscuits, eggs, cigarettes, candles, gambling cards, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raul tiene 34 años de edad, vive con su madre en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Pomahuaca que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Raul se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 05 años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona.Tambien se dedica al peonaje, adiconalmente cria de animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, chanchos y otros) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar (yuca, platano, viticas, menestras y otros.

El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de café así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Raul espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Raul is 34 years old and lives with his mother in his own home which is made of rustic materials. He lives in the Pomahuaca district which is located in the Jaén province in the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru. Life in this district is quiet, the people mainly work in agriculture, commerce and livestock. 

Raul works in agriculture, specifically coffee cultivation. He has five years of experience in this industry and has very good personal and work references in the area. He also works as a laborer, breeds small animals (chickens, guinea pigs, pigs and others), and grows food crops (cassava, banana, chia seeds, beans and others). 

The loan granted will be used to buy manure and fertilizer for the proper maintenance of his coffee crop as well as for the recruitment of labor for the harvesting season. With this, Raul hopes to offer a better quality coffee to his customers which will have a positive impact on his income level and will improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers for proper maintenance of his coffee crop.

loans.name: Divino

texts.en:
Divino is thankful that he was granted a 40,000 PHP loan, which he used to pay for the registration and maintenance of his vehicle. His earnings were a big help to support his family. Although their life is a struggle, he believes that with his perseverance and faith in God, life will get better for his family.

He is hopeful that he can access a 50,000 PHP loan to pay for the annual registration and maintenance of his jeepney. It is important that his jeepney is always in good running condition to ensure a safe and efficient service. He will be very grateful if he can again avail himself of your financial aid, and is thanking God and you for your good heart. His earnings will surely cover their daily needs and fund his children's education.

Divino aims to buy another jeepney unit to grow his transportation business. He wants his children to get a college education to allow them better opportunities in life. He faithfully meets up every week with his *co-fellowship members to share stories of his work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance and registration renewal for his jeepney.

loans.name: Dionelina

texts.en:
Dionelina is 44 years old and married with two children.  

Dionelina is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Dionelina requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feeds and other supplies for her business.

Dionelina has been in pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed 26 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Dionelina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feeds and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina works hard to support her family. Marcelina is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Marcelina requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Marcelina has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Marcelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sopheak's Group

texts.en: Sopheak’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sopheak makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Jelita

texts.en:
Jelita works hard to support her family. Jelita is married and has a native basketweaving business in the Philippines.

Jelita requested a PHP 14,500 loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her business.

Jelita has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Jelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her business

loans.name: Rokia

texts.en:
Rokia is 50 years old and has 12 children.  Rokia is married and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising ducks in the Philippines. Rokia requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feeds for the ducks.

Rokia has been raising ducks for 10 years now, and has borrowed 23 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rokia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds for the ducks

loans.name: Chann's Group

texts.en: Chann’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Chann makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

texts.en: Pola’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Pola makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sarann's Group

texts.en: Sarann’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sarann makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a village coordinator to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and this man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Saveon's Group

texts.en: Saveon’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Saveon makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Lhang's Group

texts.en: Lhang’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Lhang makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor and seller to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Josue Nahaman

texts.es:
El señor  Josué de 29 años de edad es casado tiene dos hijos que dependen de él,  vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle  al sur de Honduras, no  tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 07 años  al negocio de transporte.
Don Josué tiene un taxi  en su vehículo el transporta  personas a los diferentes lugares del municipio, es un señor emprendedor con deseos de salir adelante en su negocio.
Don Josué está solicitando el préstamo para comprar cuatro llantas nuevas al carro, reparación de dirección  y para pago de mano de obra. Para dejarlo en optimas condiciones y poderle brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, espera que esta inversión le permita salir adelante en su negocio y obtener mejores ingresos. 
Uno de sus sueños es que su vehículo este en buenas condiciones para seguir con su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo del 2015.
texts.en:
29-year-old Josué is married and has two children who depend on him. He lives in a community in San Lorenzo, in the southern valley of Honduras. He does not own his house. For the past 7 years he has made his living in the transportation business.

Josué has a taxi. He transports people in his vehicle to the different places in the community. He is an enterprising man with a drive to succeed in his business.

Josué is requesting the loan to purchase four tires, repair his steering, and pay for labor for his business. This will leave it in optimal condition and enable him to provide better service to his clients. He hopes that this investment will allow him to succeed in his business and obtain a better income.

One of his dreams is that his vehicle be good condition in order to continue with his business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - May 2015

loans.use: to purchase four tires, repair his steering, and pay for labor for his business

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.en:
Luis is 44 years old and lives in the capital of Antioquia, Medellín. He is married and has a son, whom he provides for via the store he has been running since 1980. 

He is looking to take out a loan of 2,000,000 COP in order to buy extra stock for his clients to purchase. He hopes that this will increase his sales and create greater sustainability for the future of his business.

He dreams of providing a better home for his young family to live in, and is constantly motivated by their presence in his life, hence why he will work 10 hours every day of the week, to make sure they are looked after.

loans.use: to buy extra stock

loans.name: Carlos Andres

texts.en:
Carlos is 28 years old and lives north of Medellín in the district of Bello. He makes a living selling toiletries to the local customers, and has been doing so since 2012.

He would like to be able to offer greater economic stability for his family, and hopes that by taking out this loan and increasing his stock, he will be able to do so through improving his sales and building a large clientele base. 

Eventually Carlos would like to open his first store, but needs your help in order to do so!

loans.use: to increase his stock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Jesus Maria

texts.en:
Jesus is a 48-year-old man who has been running a bar in the town of Chigorodó since 2008. 

He would like to use a loan of 4,000,000 COP in order to buy large quantities of stock, and therefore improve his sales, attract more clients, and increase his income.

Jesus dreams of opening up a second bar, and hopes that the success of his current business will propel him on to do so. Furthermore he wishes to improve the quality of his living conditions at home; whilst he works eight hours a day attending to his customers, he needs your help to make these aspirations come to fruition!

loans.use: to buy large quantities of stock

loans.name: Kean's Group

texts.en: Kean’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Kean makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each person in Pov's group to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

texts.en: Neang’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Neang makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

texts.en: Naysim’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Naysim makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en: Edgar lives in Poblacion 1, Oroquieta City. He had sent all of his children to school until they finished college. He has successfully repaid his previous loan, which he used to buy building materials, paints, and to pay his workers. Recently he requested another loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase an additional solar panel to generate energy for household consumption. He subscribes to solar energy generation to reduce their electric bill.

loans.use: to purchase an additional solar panel to generate energy

loans.name: Denesa

texts.en:
Denesa is 37 years old and has five children. She is married, and three of her children are currently in school.

Denesa is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Denesa has been in pig fattening for eight years now.

In the future, Denesa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Adriana Maria

texts.en:
Adriana is 45 years old and lives with her daughter and son in the municipality of Bello, located just north of Medellín. After taking a set of classes, she began her own small clothes manufacturing business, and is assisted by two others.

She would like to use this loan to purchase another machine, more material and take the opportunity to publicize her enterprise. She hopes this will attract more clients and allow her business to become more profitable in the local market. 

Adriana is extremely hardworking and aspires to open her own line of manufacturing stores, with the hope that she can eventually pass them down to her children and provide them with a stable future.

loans.use: to purchase another machine, more material, and take the opportunity to publicize her enterprise

loans.name: Luis Amed

texts.en:
Luis is 51 years old and lives with his 14-year-old daughter in Bello, just north of Medellín, where he has been producing clothes since 1988.

Given the high cost of manufacturing products, he would like to use this loan to buy a new sewing machine. This will help increase production, and consequently improve his sales, making his business a more competitive one in the local market.

Luis was unfortunately a victim of forced displacement, and for this reason it has been difficult to create long-term sustainability for his work. He hopes that with the use of this loan he may change that, and dreams of providing a better home for his daughter to live in.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Jesus Antonio

texts.en:
Jesús is 65 years old and lives in the town of Puerto Berrio, situated in the north of Antioquia. Since 1980, he has run a small business manufacturing pillows and mattresses, aided by two other assistants.

He would like to use this loan to purchase more fabrics, zips, and thread. Jesús is extremely hardworking, and spends up to 12 hours every day of the week in his workshop. He hopes that this investment in his business will increase his rate of production and improve his sales.

Jesús has two sons and hopes that, should his business continue to be successful, he can pass it down, along with his 35 years of experience, to them both to carry on.

loans.use: to purchase more fabric.

loans.name: Bernandita

texts.en: Bernandita makes a good earning from her farming activities in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur. This is how she supports her family and is able to send her children to school. She wants to increase her farm yield, especially since she has a high cost of living now that her children have entered college. Bernandita approached Paglaum for a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase bags of fertilizers and a knapsack sprayer for pesticides. She has high hopes that she will have good produce this cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers and a knapsack sprayer for pesticides

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena works hard to support her family. Lucena is married and has a business buying and selling scrap materials in the Philippines.

Lucena requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more scrap materials to sell.

Lucena has been in this business for four years now.

Lucena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more scrap materials to sell

loans.name: Ma. Jejie

texts.en:
Ma. Jejie is 32 years old and has four children. Ma. Jejie is married and has four children who are in school.

Ma. Jejie is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Ma. Jejie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Ma. Jejie has been in pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Jejie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Grace is 34 years old and has two children who are in school.

Grace has a business buying and selling used clothing in the Philippines. Grace requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional bundle of used clothing to sell.

Grace has been in this business for five years. In the future, Grace would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional bundle of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and blocks and pay for labor to install a sink, water basin, and potable water

loans.name: Chhoeut

texts.en: Chhoeut is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the northwest Cambodia. He is 31 years old. His family owns three hectares of rice fields and two hectares of cassava fields. He joined his wife in Soieries du Mékong, which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women. Chhoeut makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. He uses his weaving income to pay for the family's expenses, to buy diesel and fertilizer for the fields, and to repair his house. Thanks to the loan, he will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support him so he can keep making beautiful traditional handwoven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk and pay for fees related to loom preparation

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Collana Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SANTA ROSA DE COLLANA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Remigia ella es casada y tiene 51 años y tiene 6 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de crianza de animales, la socia cria cuyes , la socia por medio de este negocio quiere poner su tienda de abarrotes ya que es su sueño tener su propio negocio, la socia también quiere tener un lugar más amplio para que pueda vender sus animales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y también alimentos para los animales.


Las socias que estan pegadas a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de servicio de taxi, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de crianza de animales.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The borrowers belong to the communal bank "Santa Rosa de Collana." This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the Cusco province in the department of Cusco.

The featured borrower is 51-year-old Remigia. She is married and has six children. She works in her business raising animals, guinea pigs specifically. Through this business, she wants to start her grocery store because her dream is to have her own business. She also wants to have a larger space where she can sell her animals. She is requesting the loan to purchase guinea pigs and their feed.

The borrowers that are pasted onto the group photo had their picture taken after the meeting. They requested permission because of work commitments.

The other members work in food sales, taxi services, grocery store sales, and raising animals.

The featured borrower thanks those who, through this medium, are part of her dream. She commits to paying back the loan according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and food for them

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma heads up for the next cropping season. She wants to prepare well, especially the much-needed land and seedbed preparations. She wants to have enough supply of corn fertilizer for which she applied for a loan from the Cooperative. Alma hopes to save enough for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy corn fertilizer for more produce

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda works hard to support her family. Yolanda is married and has a business selling used clothing in the Philippines.

Yolanda requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more used clothing to sell to her customers.

Yolanda has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Yolanda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Joelita

texts.en:
Joelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Joelita has been in this business for 10 years. Joelita earns more income from basket weaving.

Joelita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Tomasa vive en una comunidad del departamento de Intibucá en Honduras, se dedica al cultivo y comercialización de maíz y frijol desde hace treinta años, el cual  además le sirve de sustento en su alimentación diaria. Ella vive con dos de sus hijas y una nieta la cual está bajo su tutela. A pesar de tener 58 años ella trabaja muy duro para llevar un ingreso a su casa, sus hijas que trabajan en otra ciudad también le ayudan económicamente a sostener el hogar.
 Donde ella vive no hay servicio de energía eléctrica por lo que ella aspira a un crédito en Soluz Honduras para la compra de un Sistema Solar para el Hogar y poder vivir su vejez en un ambiente más agradable y seguro para ella y su familia y contar con más tiempo para dedicar a su actividad.
texts.en:
Tomasa lives in a community in the department of Intibucá in Honduras. She has been raising and selling corn and beans for thirty years, and this also serves to sustain her daily diet. She lives with two of her daughters and a granddaughter who is in her care. In spite of being 58 years old, she works very hard to bring an income to her house. Her daughters who work in another city also help her economically to support the household.

There is no electrical energy service where she lives, so she is hoping for a loan from Soluz Honduras for the purchase of a solar power system for the house. She hopes to be able to live her old age in a more pleasant and secure environment for her and her family and to have more time for her work.

loans.use: to buy a solar power system, which will be of great benefit to improve the conditions of her home

loans.name: Santos Agustin

texts.es:
El señor Santos  de 47  años de edad, no  tiene  hijos que dependen de él ni tiene esposa, vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 05 años al negocio de compra venta de leña seca para cocinas y restaurantes.
Don Santos el es un hombre trabajador con deseos de salir adelante esta  solicitando el préstamo para compra de leña seca para seguir con su negocio, espera que esta inversión le permita tener los ingresos necesarios para salir adelante, este es su séptimo crédito que solicita.
Uno de sus sueños es mejorar su fuente de ingreso.

 San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo del 2015.
texts.en:
Señor Santos is 47 years old. He has no children who depend on him, nor does he have a wife. He lives in a community of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras. He has been working for five years in the business of buying and selling dry firewood for kitchens and restaurants.

Don Santos is a hard-working man with desires to get ahead. He is applying for the loan in order to purchase dry firewood to continue with his business. He hopes that this investment will allow him to have the necessary income to get ahead. This is his seventh loan that he is applying for.

One of his dreams is to improve his source of income.

 San Lorenzo, Honduras - May 2015.

loans.use: to purchase firewood for his business.

loans.name: Catarina

texts.es:
Catarina tiene 59 años de edad, solo estudió hasta segundo grado de educación básica, ella es madre soltera de cuatro hijos y un nieto que viven con ella.

Catarina se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tamales de gallina, tamales pisques, atoles y tortas de pescado, además realiza oficios domésticos en casas ajenas, todo esto lo aprendió de su abuela desde muy pequeña pues ella fue quien la crió. Catarina realiza las ventas en su casa o en las canchas cuando hay partidos de fútbol.

Ella necesita este crédito para comprar abono, fertilizantes, insecticidas y pagará mano de obra para ayudar  su hijo con la siembra de la milpa.

El sueño de ella es poner una tienda con todos los productos de primera necesidad, seguir vendiendo los productos que ella elaborar y ya no tener que salir a vender a las calles.
texts.en:
Catarina is 59 years old. She only went to school through the second grade of basic education. She is the single mother of four children who, along with a grandson, live with her.

Catarina prepares and sells chicken tamales, bean tamales, atol [a cornflour beverage], and fish cakes. In addition, she does domestic work in other people's houses. She learned all this from her grandmother when she was very small, since her grandmother was the one who raised her. Catarina makes the sales in her house or at the soccer field when there are soccer games.

She needs this loan to buy compost, fertilizer, and insecticides and to pay for labor to help her son with the planting of the parcel of land.

Her dream is to set up a store with all the products of basic necessity, to continue selling the products that she prepares, and not to have to go out to sell on the streets.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizer, and insecticides and pay for labor to help her son plant the parcel of land

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia, de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, es madre soltera, vive con su madre y sus dos hijos.

Patricia, se dedica a la venta de comida rápida y también a la agricultura desde hace mucho tiempo, su madre fue quien le ha enseñado estos trabajos, para que pudiera salir adelante con sus hijos.

Patricia, necesita el crédito para comprar abono e insecticidas para sus cultivos, ya que en este momento necesitan abono, con el crédito lo podrá comprar a tiempo para asegurar una buena cosecha.

Patricia, sueña con obtener una mejor cosecha que años anteriores y también sueña con ver crecer a sus hijos y que se preparen académicamente.
texts.en:
Patricia, 34 years old, studied up to fifth grade, is a single mother, and lives with her mother and two children.

Patricia has dedicated herself to agriculture and the sale of fast food for a long time.  Her mother was the one who taught her these jobs, so that she could get ahead with her children.

Patricia needs a loan to purchase fertilizer and insecticides for her crops as they need to be fertilized at this time.  With the loan she may be able to buy these in time to ensure a good harvest.

Patricia dreams of a bigger harvest than in previous years and also dreams of seeing her children grow and prepare academically.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and insecticides for her crops.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 50 years old and widowed with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell.

Yolanda has been in this business for 10 years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Dilcia Melania

texts.es:
La Joven Dilcia vive en la ciudad de Santa Cruz De Yojoa, al norte de Honduras es soltera y vive con su madre, se dedica al cultivo de malanga y café desde hace varios años, es una joven emprendedora y dedicada a su negocio.

La joven Dilcia solicita el préstamo para la compra de abono  para la malanga, espera que al abonar su cultivo obtenga más del mismo y que este le genere ganancias para poder apoyar a su familia en el hogar.

Con sus ventas y ganancias piensa seguir cultivando, uno de sus sueños es poder tener buenos cultivos y que estos sean prósperos. 






Santa Cruz De Yojoa, Honduras- Mayo del 2015
texts.en:
Young Dilcia lives in the city of Santa Cruz De Yojoa, Northern Honduras, is single and lives with her mother.  She has made a living with the cultivation of taro root and coffee for several years.  She is a young entrepreneur and is dedicated to her business.

Young Dilcia is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer for the taro root.  She expects that as she fertilizes her crops her harvest will be greater and that this will generate income to support her family at home.

With her sales and profits, she plans to continue farming.  One of her dreams is to have good crops and that they are prosperous.

Santa Cruz De Yojoa, Honduras May 2015

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her business.

loans.name: Erika Francisca

texts.es:
Cada vez que abre el taller de Erika, se puede escuchar el ruido de las  máquinas de coser, que se unen casi haciendo música. Esta mujer de treinta y seis años de edad, tiene un taller de confección y costura, en el cual elabora bolsos, disfraces, vestidos, ropa para cama, cojines, entre muchos otros articulos, en uno de los mercados más importantes de su ciudad. Gracias al apoyo de sus hijas ha logrado ir fortaleciendo su negocio. 
La prosperidad ha tocado las puertas del negocio de Erika y tiene que aprovechar eso, por lo cual ella ha solicitado un préstamo de Kiva junto a MiCrédito para poder comprar nuevas telas, hilos, aplicaciones para ropa, tijeras, entre otras cosas que son su materia de trabajo. Su principal meta es mejorar la infraestructura de su taller, luego de eso pretende abrir una tienda donde pueda exhibir alguna de las creaciones en tela que hace.
texts.en:
Whenever you open Erika's studio, you can hear the sound of sewing machines, which come together like music. This woman of thirty-six years has a sewing and dressmaking shop, where she makes handbags, costumes, dresses, pajamas, cushions, and many other items, in one of the most important markets in her city. Thanks to the support of her daughters, she has managed to strengthen her business.

Prosperity has knocked on Erika's door and she must take advantage of it. That's why she is asking for a loan from Kiva through MiCrédito, in order to buy new fabrics, threads, clothing applications, scissors, and other work materials. Her main goal is to improve the infrastructure of her workshop, since she hopes to open up a shop where she can display her fabric creations.

loans.use: to buy new fabrics, threads, applications for clothing, scissors, etc.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
The woman in the picture is Leonila. She is 65 years old now but she is still working like a young woman. In fact, as a way to make a living, she continues to sell various personal products. She has been into this business for almost 10 years now. 

She is married to Reynaldo, who is 56 years old. Throughout their journey as a couple, they had the faith that they would get better lives when the time came. Reynaldo has already retired from his work, but he's still supporting his wife despite that. 

Life may be tough but for them it is something to endure. Leonila wanted to improve her business, and now she found Kiva. She would like you to know that she wants to borrow a loan worth 12,000 PHP. She will utilize this to purchase additional personal products like perfumes, cosmetics, toiletries and other products. If you grant her request, she would be most grateful. 

One day, she aspires for a sudden business expansion. She prays to have more strength and more blessings for her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase personal products like perfumes, cosmetics, toiletries and other products.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Thanks for your unwavering support of Susan. Because of the loan that you granted her recently, she was able to buy more supplies of merchandise products for her sari-sari (variety store). This has indeed aided the household's basic expenses and has helped in attracting more customers as well. 

To continue what she started, she would like to avail another 20,000 PHP to pay for more grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to sell in her business. Your small act of generosity now can be a good head start for Susan's dream of expanding her business and giving a better life to her family. 

She meets every week with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to sell at her business.

loans.name: Rosmarie

texts.en:
Rosmarie is 45 years old and has six children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Rosmarie is in the agricultural business fattening pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 11,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been pig fattening for 16 years now and has borrowed 27 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosmarie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Prisca to improve her business. She is married and she has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as body lotion, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, coffee and biscuits. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2011. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Prisca independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy body lotion, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, coffee and biscuits.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Here is Salvacion and she's asking for a loan that means a lot for her business expansion today.

Taking a small peek at her background, she wasn't able to finish her schooling. But that never became a hindrance to move forward and reach her dreams. She is already 57 years old now and with her self-will and courage, she's making herself quite busy handling her soap business.

As you can see in the picture, she offers liquid soaps. From this, she gets an income that serves as a remedy for her family's (seemingly unending) financial incapacity.

At times, there are cases when her sales never meet her expectations. It's really hard when such moments like these come. There are also circumstances when her capital is not enough. And being one of the breadwinners of the family, she doesn't want this business to just end for an unreasonable cause - insufficiency.

She believes that there is always a provision when there is a vision (a dream). This inspiration comes from the people around her that encourage her, including the people that she interacts with every week on a regular fellowship. (Here, they share, testify and study the word of God.)

Prove to her that what she believes is always true. She's asking now for a loan worth 15,000 PHP that she will use as additional capital for making soaps. It's just one small step to take for you to help Salvacion.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to have additional capital for making soap.

loans.name: Marlis Esperanza

texts.es:
Marlis, de 31 años de edad, está acompañada, vive con su pareja y sus 2 hijos, estudio hasta sexto grado y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura.

Marlis, se dedica a vender mariscos desde hace muchos años, fue su madre quien le enseño a vender este producto, ella sale a vender 3 veces por semana en su comunidad y otras comunidades cercanas solo por la mañana.- Pero además de vender mariscos, también se dedica a vender minutas en un carretón desde hace dos años, fue su pareja quien la indujo a este nuevo negocio; aparte de eso también trabaja por las noches en una empresa y en su tiempo libre le ayuda a su pareja a sembrar granos básicos.

Marlis, necesita el crédito para comprar abono, semilla de maíz e insecticidas, este préstamo le ayudará mucho porque podrá sembrar a tiempo y eso indica que tendrá una buena cosecha.

Marlis, sueña con tener una cosecha muy buena, ya que de esas ganancias mejorara el techo de su casa y otro de sus sueños es ver crecer a sus dos hijos y que sean profesionales.
texts.en: Marlis is 31years old. She has a partner, and she lives with him and their two children. She studied through sixth grade and his partner works in agriculture. Marlis has worked selling seafood for many years. Her mother taught her to sell this product. She goes out to sell 3 times per week in her community and other nearby neighborhoods only in the morning. In addition she sells sweetened shaved ice (minutas)  for the past two years. It was her partner who motivated her to start this new business. She also works for a company at night,  and in her spare time she works with her partner planting basic grains. Marlis needs the loan to buy manure, corn seeds and insecticides. This loan will help her a lot because she will be able to plant onb time and that is conducive to a good harvest. Marlis dreams with having a good harvest, because it will allow her to use the earnings to improve the roof in her house. Another dream is to raise her children to be professionals.

loans.use: To buy manure, corn seeds and insecticides.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Believing, after so many shattered dreams and broken hopes today, it's what only remains for Jenifer. She still believes that it's never impossible to reach her goals.

Jenifer lives in Novaliches, Quezon City, Philippines. Today, she focuses on managing her small fish stall business in the marketplace. At times, it's hard for her to sustain her income, since customers barely come. But she's really hopeful that she'll be successful with this.

Today, she asks for your helping hands for the continuation of her inventory. She would like to avail a loan of PHP 30,000 that she will use to buy greater quantities of fish to sell. If she gains such, it would be an advantage, since people are more attracted when there are more fish displayed than usual.

She really hopes that you can help her with this. She is doing this for her children's education and her remaining hope relies in you.

As of today, she's active in attending a weekly fellowship that enables her to draw strength and inspiration to push towards the goal through the word of God that she studies with her colleagues.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy greater quantities of fish to sell.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco de 54 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y  sus dos hijo de 14 y 5 años de edad, el se dedica desde hace once años al cultivo de caña de azúcar, maíz y frijol y luego comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona de su comunidad por lo que ya es bien reconocido y tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y la ayuda económica de su esposa que trabaja como profesora en una escuela cercana a su comunidad logra solventar los gastos del hogar. Francisco está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para mejorar su casa y con el monto poder invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y grava para poder encementar el piso y repellar las paredes de su vivienda con el propósito de brindar a su familia una  mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Francisco is 54 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife and two children, ages 14 and 5 years old. He has worked for the past 11 years growing sugar cane, corn, and beans, which he then sells his products in the surrounding area in his community. He is well known and has many clients. This has helped him earn income from his sales,  and with the economic support of his wife who works as a teacher in a nearby school, they have been able to cover the household expenses. Francisco is asking for a loan from FUSAI to improve his house, by buying cement, sand and gravel to cement down the floor and finish up the walls of the house. This will bring a better quality of life to his family.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand and gravel to cement down the floor and finish up the walls in his house.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
Rosalina, de 32 años de edad, no estudio, está acompañada, tiene 2 hijos y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, en casa solo viven sus dos hijos de 13 y 10 años de edad. 

Rosalina, conoce muy acerca del cuidado de cerdos, pues ella tiene una granja desde hace 4 años, pero también siembra granos básicos; estas actividad las aprendió de sus padres como también de su pareja, quien le ha apoyado con sus objetivos.
    
Rosalina, necesita el crédito para mejorar la producción de cerdos y para comprar fertilizantes para la producción de granos básicos. 

Ella tiene como visión que sus hijos tengan una estabilidad familiar, como también que cumplan sus objetivos de estudio, para el desarrollo de cada uno de ellos a futuro.
texts.en:
Rosalina is 32 years old.  She did not go to school.  She is in a relationship and she has two children.  Her partner works in agriculture.  The children are 13 and 10 years old and they live at home.

Rosalina knows a lot about caring for pigs. She has had a farm for 4 years.  She also grows basic staple foods. She learned these occupations from her parents and also from her partner, who has supported her in her goals.
    
Rosalina needs the loan to improve the production of pigs and also to buy fertilizers for the cultivation of basic staple foods.

She has as a vision that her children have family stability and also that they achieve their schooling objectives in order for each one of them to build a future.

loans.use: to improve the production of pigs and to buy fertilizers for the growing of basic staple foods.

loans.name: Febe

texts.es:
Febe de 47 años de edad, es madre de cuatro hijos de los cuales 3 estudian, su esposo y el hijo mayor emigraron a EE.UU buscando mejores condiciones de vida.

Febe se dedica a la crianza de especies menores como pollos de engorde y los vende en la comunidad, también se dedica a la venta de antojitos (panes con pollo, enchiladas, papitas fritas y otros), se decidió a trabajar en esto por la necesidad de apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios y comprar los alimentos para el hogar.

Ella está solicitando un crédito para comprar abono y pagar mano de obra para el cultivo de maíz y frijol, además comprará panes, repollos, aceite, papas, etc para la venta de antojitos. 

Ella sueña con construir su vivienda ya que la tiene comenzada y le falta invertir mucho más en el techo, espera seguir apoyando a sus hijos para que puedan terminar sus estudios y superarse académicamente.
texts.en: Febe is 47 years old. She has 4 children, 3 of which are currently studying. Her husband and older son emigrated to the US to look for better life conditions. Febe works growing and selling chickens in the community. She also sells snacks - antojitos (chicken sandwiches, enchiladas, french fries and others.) She decided to do this to support her children studies and to buy food for her household. She is asking for a loan to buy manure and pay for labor to plant corn and beans. She will also buy breads, cabbage, oil, potatoes, etc. to prepare snacks. She dreams of building her house, which she has already started but she needs a lot more to invest in the roof. She hopes to continue helping her children so that they can finish their studies and can improve academically.

loans.use: To buy manure and pay for labor to plant corn and beans. She will also buy breads, cabbage, oil, potaties, etc. to prepare snacks.

loans.name: Aydan Dixon

texts.es: AYDAN: Es un hombre trabajador, originario de Siuna. Desde hace 9 años se traslado a la comunidad de Wakiwas, con el propósito de tener su propia finca y dedicarse a actividades agropecuarias. La comunidad se localiza aproximadamente a 7 horas de la Ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. tiene 34 años de edad, está casado con  6 hijos adolescentes y menores de edad, no asisten al colegio debido a que la escuela más cercana  se localizada en el empalme de Columbus, a 4 horas en trocha caminando.  Esta solicitando su primer financiamiento para sembrar frijoles y engorde de cerdo. Su sueño es mejorar las condiciones y rendimientos de su finca, para incrementar sus ingresos y poco a poco su calidad de vida.
texts.en: AYDAN is a hardworking man, a native of Siuna. Nine years ago he moved to the community of Wakiwas, in order to have his own farm and raise crops and livestock. The community is located approximately 7 hours from Bilwi City, municipality of Puerto Cabezas. He is 34 years old, married with 6 teenagers and minor children, they do not attend school due to the fact that the nearest school is located at the Columbus junction, 4 hours by foot trail.  He is applying for his first loan, to plant beans and fatten pigs. His dream is to improve the conditions and yield of his farm, in order to increase his income and little by little his quality of life.

loans.use: plant beans and fatten pigs

loans.name: Natalina

texts.en: Natalina is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She is married and she is a businesswoman. She is doing this business because she earns a good income and every day many people come to her kiosk so she is still happy to be doing her business. She is taking this loan because she wants to buy some items such as sweets, biscuits, sauces, shampoo, toothpaste, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell. Natalina has been involved in business activities since 2010 when she started with her own working capital of $500. Natalina also cultivate animals in her place like cows, pigs and dogs.

loans.use: to buy sweets, biscuits, sauces, shampoo, toothpaste, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more curtains to sell.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis tiene 53 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus hijos en casa propia de material rústico en el caserío San Gerardo de Churcas que pertenece al distrito de Colasay que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Luis se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 15 años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de café así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Luis espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Luis, 35, lives with his wife and children in their own house in the small village of San Gerardo de Churcas in the district of Colasay, which is located in the province of Jaen, Cajamarca in the northern mountain range of Peru. In this peaceful area, the people work mainly in agriculture, commerce and livestock.

Luis works in agriculture cultivating coffee. He has been doing this for 15 years and has a very good reputation. 

He is asking for a loan to be able to buy compost and fertilizers so he can maintain his crops and also to pay for labor when harvest comes around. 

He hopes that this will allow him to offer a better quality product to his customers, which will have a positive impact on his income and therefore help him to offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers to be able to maintain his coffee crops.

loans.name: Evaristo

texts.es: EVARISTO: Es un señor alegre, originario del municipio de Río Blanco, se traslado hace 12 años a la comunidad de Wakiwas, con el propósito de tener su propia finca y dedicarse a actividades agropecuarias. La comunidad se localiza aproximadamente a 7 horas de la Ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Tiene 46 años de edad, está casado con 5 hijos: 3 son mayores de edad y 2 adolescentes que estudian su primaria. Los pequeños diariamente caminan 8 horas para asistir a la escuela más cercana localizada en el empalme de Columbus Esta solicitando su primer financiamiento para sembrar frijoles y engorde de cerdo. Su sueño es mejorar los rendimientos de su finca.
texts.en:
Evaristo is a cheerful person who comes from Rio Blanco. He moved to Wakiwas 12 years ago with the aim of having his own farm where he could work in agriculture. 

This area is located about seven hours from the city of Bilwi in Puerto Cabezas. 

He is 46 and is married with five children.  Three of his children are now grown-up, while the other two are still at secondary school. These two younger children have an eight-hour daily round trip to go to the nearest school located in Columbus.

He is asking for his first loan to be able to sow some beans and also to fatten his pigs. 

His dream is to improve the productivity of his farm.

loans.use: to grow beans and to fatten pigs.

loans.name: Rosa Elva

texts.es: Rosa de 67 años de edad, es madre soltera y  vive en casa propia con sus hijos de 30, 26 y 18 años de edad quienes trabajan y aportan para solventar los gastos del hogar. Rosa se dedica a hacer oficios varios y también posee dos vacas que le dan leche la cual utiliza para la realización de lácteos como queso y crema que luego distribuye en la zona donde reside, es así como ella con su trabajo y las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante con sus hijos. Rosa quiere mejorar su vivienda repellando y encementando el piso de su casa, pero como no posee de suficiente capital  ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para la compra de materiales y el pago de mano de obra para la elaboración de dichas mejoras, con el monto ella piensa invertir en la compra de arena, cemento y grava.
texts.en:
Rosa, 67, is a single mother who lives in her own home with her children aged 30, 26 and 18. Her children all work and contribute to the household expenses.  

Rosa does various jobs and has two cows which provide her with milk.  She uses this milk to make dairy products such as cheese and cream which she then sells in the area where she lives.  This helps her to generate an income to look after her children.

Rosa would like to improve her home by plastering and cementing the walls and floor of her house.
