loans.use: To buy necessary hair colors, hair treatments, and air conditioning to keep her customers comfortable

loans.name: Jonelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Jonelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Jonelyn is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to  purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish-vending business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Jonelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her businesses to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Kristina

texts.en:
Kristine is 27 years old and she lives with her husband in Stepanavan city of the Lori region. 

Kristine has higher pedagogical education and for seven years she has worked at the school as a teacher of English language and literature. She also gives paid private courses at her house in a separate room for her work and for her group of pupils. She helps these pupils prepare for coming entrance exams. 

She would like to prepare more informative and interesting materials for her pupils so that they will have perfect scores in their exams. This is the reason for her asking this loan, with which she wants to buy a computer and also professional literature.

loans.use: to buy a computer and also professional literature.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is 35 years old and married with one child. With one child currently in school, Ellen works very hard to provide for them.

Ellen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Ellen has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, eggs, bread, soft-drinks, canned goods, noodles, etc. 

Ellen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma lives with her husband, son and daughter in Stepanavan city, Lori region. Emma graduated with the qualification of teaching, and it is already 26 years that she has worked at the school. Now, in the same school where she started her pedagogical activities, she works as a deputy director. 

At her house, Emma also helps some pupils to prepare their home tasks and also explains to them the difficult tasks. As she says, she is always happy and ready to help each of them. 

Emma asks for this loan of 500,000 Armenian drams as she wants to buy a lot of professional literature and also a computer for her private courses at her house.

loans.use: to buy a lot of professional literature and also a computer for her private courses at her house

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 42 years old and married with four children.

Elvira works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Elvira has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from food vending.

Elvira aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Gankhuyag

texts.en:
Gankhuyag, 32 years old, lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

He has been transporting goods between districts since 2012, using his truck. His wife is currently unemployed and stays at home taking care of house chores. 

He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy seeds of potato, carrot and cabbage in order to grow them on his land. In autumn, he will harvest his vegetables, using them mainly for consumption and selling the rest to local people.

loans.use: to grow vegetables on his land.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marilyn is 45 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Marilyn has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. 

Marilyn requested a PHP 28,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Eulilia

texts.en:
Eulilia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Eulilia is 52 years old, and two of her children are still in school.

Eulilia has a business selling dry goods in the Philippines. Eulilia requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of dry goods like curtains, blouses, etc., to sell.

Eulilia has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Eulilia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of dry goods like curtains, blouses, etc., to sell

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Jennifer works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing.  

Jennifer is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, canned goods, eggs, fish, etc. for her restaurant business.

Jennifer has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, canned goods, eggs, fish, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Cristina

texts.en:
Ma. Cristina is 47 years old and widowed with four children. Ma. Cristina works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Cristina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell such as coffee, detergent soap, cereals, rice, feed, eggs, etc.

Ma. Cristina has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, detergent soap, cereals, rice, feed, eggs, etc. 

Ma. Cristina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell such as coffee, detergent soap, cereals, rice, feed, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 42 years old and has four children. Edna is married and two of her children are currently in school.

Edna is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Edna requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Edna has been in pig fattening for one year now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Edna would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Gina is 43 years old, and four of her children are currently in school.

Gina has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Gina requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials and fishing gear for her business.

Gina has been in this business for three years. In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and fishing gear for her business

loans.name: Juarin

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Juarin works hard to support her family.

She has a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Juarin is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers for her selling of ready-to-wear business.

Juarin has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Lesly Yurany

texts.es:
Lesly, con 27 años de edad, se ha dedicado por 5 a vender abarrotes en una tienda en el municipio de Medellín; de esta forma complementa los ingresos con los que ha sacado adelante a sus estudios y ha aportado para la economía de su hogar.

Su tenacidad y perseverancia le han permitido luchar incansablemente, siempre buscando la manera de salir adelante, esto lo impulsa a solicitar el crédito para comprar un refrigerador, esto le permitirá tener sus productos siempre frescos y en óptimas condiciones.

Lesly manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder tener un negocio sostenible.

Ella confía en el apoyo de la Corporación interactuar y en los prestamistas de Kiva para lograr este objetivo.
texts.en:
Lesly, twenty-seven, has spent five years selling groceries in a store in Medellin; this complements the income that has paid for her studies and contributed to supporting her household's expenses. 

Her tenacity and perseverance have allowed her to tirelessly strive to get ahead, compelling her to apply for this loan to buy a refrigerator, which will allow her to keep her products fresh and in top condition. 

Lesly states that her fondest wish is to have a viable business. 

She counts on the support of the Interactuar Corporation and Kiva loans to achieve her goal.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to keep her products fresh and in top condition

loans.name: Prak

texts.en:
Prak, 41, is a married man who lives in a small community of Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He has four children. To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a farming business on a small farmland which is located near his house. On his farmland, he grows rice and sells his agricultural product to the local dealers. On average, he can generate earnings of USD $4 per day.

The current farmland that he owns is small, and it can provide less benefit to him. He wants to enlarge his farmland area, but he can’t afford it. Therefore, now he would like to get Kiva loan to buy a plot of farmland for growing rice. He hopes this additional farmland will help to improve his living conditions. 

He is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland for growing rice

loans.name: Sarim

texts.en:
Sarim is a 36-year-old man from a remote area of Kampong Speu province. He has five children. To make a living, he works as a construction worker and earns an income of USD $7 per day, on average. 

He would like to improve his living standard by having clean energy for household use. Because of the lack of capital, he is asking for a loan to build a biogas digester, under the project of NBP (National Biogas Program) in partnering with HKL. After an initial investment in this system, he hopes that he won’t spend much money on fuel and will lessen the smoke from wood or charcoal. 

He is very happy and thankful, because with this kind of loan product, HKL has offered a more special interest rate than its general loans. He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to build a biogas digester

loans.name: Bebeth

texts.en:
Bebeth is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

Bebeth has been in this business for one year. Bebeth earns more income from food and frozen foods vending.

Bebeth is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable-vending business.

Bebeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Her dream is to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Dalin

texts.en:
Dalin is a 48-year-old mother of four children, two of whom are still dependent on her, living in Kratie province. 

Nowadays, she does sesame farming and works on other farms for a fee. She has been involved in these businesses for 30 years and the work earns her about 43,900 KHR per day. 

Dalin has been with VisionFund for one cycle already and completely paid back the loan. 

Because her crop did not grow well, it caused her to have not enough funds to hire workers to harvest her sesame farm. Because of this, she is now applying for this second Kiva loan via VisionFund to pay for harvesting fees. She hopes that this loan will help her to earn more income and improve her family’s living.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting fees.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is 49 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Marietta has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Marietta requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

Marietta has been in this business for three years. In the future, Marietta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is 65 years old. She is pensioner and lives with her daughter in Batumi district. Her daughter works and gets a monthly salary, but Svetlana is unemployed. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan to renovate a flat and rent it out. Svetlana will receive monthly income and will be able to improve the living conditions of her family.

The unemployment rate is very high, and this Start Up program will help her to generate income.

loans.use: to renovate a flat and rent it out in order to generate stable income

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marilyn is 46 years old, and six of her children are currently in school.

Marilyn has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her bicycle.

Marilyn has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her bicycle

loans.name: Aloice

texts.en:
Aloice is 54 years old and supports four children. He has been a farmer for the last 20 years. The business earns him KES 6,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers for top dressing his crops in order to get a better harvest. He will use the crops for his family's consumption and sell the surplus to clients in the market.

He plans to use the profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and to educate his children. His hopes are to expand his agricultural business and educate his children to higher levels of education.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers

loans.name: Jovie

texts.en:
In the picture above, you can see green fishing gear piled up on a pump boat. These are crab traps commonly known as “panggal” in Iloilo, Philippines. These crab traps are connected to each other with a rope, usually one meter apart. Fishermen leave these traps submerged in the sea for several hours, then they come back to pull it with captured crabs inside. This is the kind of business that Jovie operates. She makes panggal for sale, while her husband, Jabell, catches crabs himself using panggal and a pump boat. Together they work hard to provide the needs of their family with three children. 

This season is favorable for Jovie and her husband, because crabs are very abundant during the months of July to October. Although crabs can be caught all year round, they are more abundant these days. Jovie wants to seize the opportunity to earn higher income, and she plans to make more panggal to sell. She also desires to repair their pump boat so her husband can efficiently use it to catch crabs. She needs PhP 20,000 to buy more nets and ropes to make panggal and pay for the repair of their pump boat. This additional capital will bring her more earnings which she can utilize for her family’s everyday needs. She can also save some money for her children’s education. 

It’s Jovie’s desire to see her children finish their studies and have a brighter future. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more nets and ropes to make crab traps for sale and to pay for pump boat repair

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. Jean has been in this business for eight years. She earns additional income from fishing.

Jean is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Jean has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle, 43, is a married woman with six children, three of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Annabelle has a fishing/fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. 

Annabelle requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business.

In the future, Annabelle would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with eight children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. 

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like raising pigs.

Arlene dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Sokun's Group

texts.en:
Sokun is a 45-year-old widow and mother of four children, but only one of them is in school. 

Sokun has been a cassava farmer and paid worker for twenty-five years living in Kratie Province. Through these businesses, she is able to earn about 40,800 KHR per day and it allows her to save around 25,000 KHR each day. 

Due to a lack of funds to farm, Sokun is now leading a group of two to take this fourth loan via VisionFund to buy farming supplies to support her current business. 

The previous loans helped Sokun to have better living conditions. She believes that this fourth loan will help her crop to grow well and gain greater yields than last year.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to support her cassava business

loans.name: Jaymar

texts.en: Jaymar is 20 years old, single, and lives at Amulung with his parents. He is a college student and wants to finish his education despite poverty. He is now asking for a loan of P7,000 to pay his tuition fees. He will strive hard to finish his education and help his family someday.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees in school

loans.name: Ericson

texts.en:
Ericson is single and a college student taking up Information Technology. He is 20 years old. He wants to finish his education so he can acquire good-paying jobs and help his family someday. 

His parents' income is not sufficient to pay school expenses. So, he is now asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to pay his tuition fees and allowances for school. He hopes to become successful someday.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees and allowances for school.

loans.name: Niña Rica

texts.en: Niña Rica is the eldest child of Ethel. She is now 19 years old and a college student. She wants to become a teacher someday. Her mother's income from selling vegetables is not sufficient to pay her tuition fees; that is why Niña Rica  is now asking for a loan of P7,000 to pay for tuition fees and allowances at school. She will pay back her loan in full with the help of her parents.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and allowances for school.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
This is Agnes. She's a sari-sari (variety) store owner in Barotac Viejo, Iloilo. She's been running her store for 25 years now. Managing a business that long, she has experienced different circumstances that really tested her faith. There were times when her capital was almost drained due to huge collectibles. Some of her neighbors pay weeks or months later for the goods they get from her store. But Agnes remained strong, because this is her way of assisting her carpenter husband, Job, in providing for their children’s needs.

A sari-sari store is comparable to a convenience store, but it’s smaller and has limited products commonly used by an individual everyday. Examples of these products are sachets of toiletries, snack items, canned goods, instants, candies, beverages, and other commodities. It’s quite advantageous for the people in the community to have an accessible variety store to buy one candy, an egg, and so on. This is the reason why sari-sari stores proliferate in communities of the Philippines. This is also the reason why competition becomes stiffer and stiffer. Customers prefer to buy from stores with wide selections and supplies. Agnes is has problems with this because, as you can see in the picture, she has very limited stocks. 

She appeals for your help through a loan worth 10,000 PHP, which she can use to buy more supplies to enhance her store. She aspires to improve her sales to be able to earn more. She dreams that in the near future her business will grow and progress. She’s praying for a better life, not just for herself, but also for her whole family. She wants her children to finish college and obtain good and stable jobs. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more supplies to enhance her variety store

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Emma works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Emma is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy materials like wood, nails, and paints for her fishing business.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials like wood, nails, and paints

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene is a married woman with four children, three of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marlene is 49 years old.

Marlene has a candle-making business in the Philippines. Marlene requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials like wax and wicks for her business.

Marlene has been in this business for six years. In the future, Marlene would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials like wax and wicks for her candle-making business

loans.name: Milaluna

texts.en:
Milaluna is 49 years old and has four children. Milaluna is married, and one of her children is still in school.

Milaluna is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Milaluna requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Milaluna has been in pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Milaluna would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 33 years old and lives in the town of Lyantonde in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past six years, Emmanuel has been working hard to manage his farm, which rears goats. 

To help expand his business, Emmanuel has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy feeds and more goats, and will help Emmanuel to generate greater profits and increase the family income. Emmanuel hopes that in the future, he will be able to expand his business. 

Emmanuel is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Emmanuel who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy feeds and more goats

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is from Dipolog, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 50 years of age. She and her husband have three school-age children. She joined Paglaum MPC in the year 2007 and she appreciates the programs and services of the co-op. From her desire to help the family, she has engaged in snack vending in different districts in the City of Dipolog, Zamboanga del Norte. She only walks in vending different snacks to the different areas. Her source of income has existed for 5 years now.

 In need of additional working capital, she requested financial assistance from Paglaum MPC in the amount of Php 20,000 to purchase ingredients like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, lard, oil, milk, butter, cheese and others. She hopes to expand her business and/or have more income so she is able to provide for the daily needs of her family. Also she is happy she can support the education of her children which is her main priority in working so hard.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, lard, oil, milk, cheese, and butter for her snack vending business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
A widow for several years now, Susan remains strong considering all the trials that she has gone through. She’s also a survivor of Typhoon Haiyan in November 2013 together with her children. 

Susan runs a sari-sari (variety) store in Barotac Viejo, Iloilo, and she continues to work hard in order to maintain and improve it. Aside from her variety store business, she also sells fish in a nearby market. However, the income derived from her two businesses goes up and down. It is usually affected by the weather and competition within the area. When it’s raining and fish are expensive, she focuses on manning her store. But the stability of her store is also shaken by long-term debts by some of her neighbors. She has to make it more secure with additional capital amounting to PHP 19,000 that she can use to buy more grocery items to sell. With an enhanced inventory, she can still earn enough despite many debtors. The additional capital will also increase her buying power when fish are scarce and expensive. She’s praying that you have a kind heart to extend support to her. It will surely go a long way. 

Susan dreams of a bigger store and better living conditions someday. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items to sell in her variety store

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lanie works hard to support her family.

She has a dressmaking business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming seaweed. Lanie is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy materials like needles and thread for her dressmaking business. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Lanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials like needles and thread

loans.name: Nanette

texts.en:
Nanette is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Nanette is 42 years old, and her four children are in school.

Nanette has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Nanette has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Nanette would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Neldina

texts.en:
Neldina is 39 years old and married with two children.

Neldina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buying and selling of wood business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional wood to sell for her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Neldina has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell wood business for five years and also earns an income from a general store and buying and selling fruits.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional wood to sell for her business

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fabric, thread, needles, etc. for her tailoring business.

Rebecca has been in this business for 15 years. She earns more income from pig fattening.

Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fabric, thread, needles, etc. for her business

loans.name: Soniya

texts.ru: Эту скромную и ответственную женщину зовут Сония. Сония 53 года. Она замужем и мать двоих прекрасных детей. Детям 27 и 25 лет. Сония занимается портнихой у себя дома. Она опытная и талантливая швея. Сония берет заказы на шитье национальной женской одежды. Такой деятельностью она занимается более 6лет. Она очень любить свою работу и хочет заняться еще много лет. Ей в работе нравится результаты, которых, она в процессе добивается. Сония нравится смотреть на восторженные лица своих клиентов, после того как они надевают заказанные платья. Ее старший сын женится, у сына свадьба. Сония и дети готовятся к свадьбе. Сония хочет приобрести все свадебные принадлежности, но у нее не хватает денежных средств. Она не смогла копить достаточную сумму денег, и решила обратиться за кредитом. Сония очень нуждается на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
This modest and responsible woman is called Soniya. Soniya is 53 years old. She is married and the mother of two wonderful children. Her children are 27 and 25 years old. Soniya works as a dressmaker from home. She is an experienced and talented seamstress. Soniya takes orders for sewing women's national dress. She has been doing such work for over six years. She really loves her work and wants to continue doing it for many years more. What she likes about her work is the results that she achieves by doing it. Soniya likes to see the delighted faces of her clients when they put on the dresses they have ordered.

Her eldest son is getting married. There will be a wedding. Soniya and her children are preparing for the wedding. Soniya wants to buy all the wedding accessories, but she does not have enough funds. She has not been able to save up enough money, and she has decided to apply for a loan. Soniya really needs your support.

loans.use: to pay for wedding accessories and other wedding expenses for her son.

loans.name: Mukim

texts.ru: Муким житель района Файзабад. Ему 35 лет. Он женат и отец двоих детей. Дети еще маленькие и им 10 и 8 лет. Муким выбрал деятельность таксиста, по причине, что он не смог найти себе подходящую работу. Заниматься таксистом нелегко, Муким днем и ночью сидит за рулем. Он хороший водитель. Муким общительный и честный человек. Он любить свою семью, и хочет, чтобы они жили в хорошем условии. Муким хочет улучшить их жилищные условия и планирует отремонтировать дом. Его доходы хватает только на питание, и он смог копить денег для ремонта. Муким решил взять кредит и отремонтировать свой дом. Он обратился за кредитом, потому что у него нет денежных средств. Муким верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Mukim is a resident of the Fayzabad district of Tajikistan.  He is 35 years old, married, and the father of two young children, ages 8 and 10.  Mukim chose to become a taxi driver because he couldn't find a more suitable job.  Being a taxi driver is not easy, as Mukim has to sit behind the wheel day and night.  He is a good driver though, as well as a sociable and honest man.  He also loves his family and wants them to enjoy good living conditions.  At the moment Mukim wants to improve his family's living conditions by renovating his house.  However, his income is only sufficient to pay for food, and he hasn't been able to gather enough money for home renovations, which is the reason why he is taking a loan. He has requested a loan for lack of financial resources.  Mukim relies on you and on your support.

loans.use: to renovate his house.

loans.name: Jorge Leon

texts.es:
Jorge es una persona muy trabajadora que gracias a su esfuerzo diario ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos brindándoles una educación de buena calidad.

Jorge vive en unión libre con su pareja y desde hace mucho tiempo comenzó a vender productos en cuero, con gran esfuerzo a superado muchos problemas que se le han presentado.

Actualmente Jorge tiene unos muy buenos pedidos por parte de sus clientes y debido a que no cuenta con un gran capital busca un préstamo para comprar productos hechos en cuero como volantes de automóviles y bolsos.
Le dedica 10 horas diarias a su negocio.

Su mayor sueño es salir adelante con su negocio y desde este poder ofrecerles a su hijo una buena calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica, sabe que de la mano de Interactuar podrá lograrlo.
texts.en:
Jorge is a very hard-working person.  Thanks to his daily efforts, he has managed to get his children ahead, providing them with a good quality education.

Jorge lives with his life partner in a common-law marriage.  He started selling leather products a long time ago.  With great effort he has overcome many problems that have arisen.

Jorge currently has some very good orders from his customers.  Due to the fact that he does not have much capital, he is seeking a loan to buy leather products like steering wheels and bags.  He works at his business for ten hours a day.

His biggest dream is to get ahead with his business and from this to be able to provide his children with a good quality of life and better financial stability.  

He knows that with a hand from Interactuar, he will be able to do so.

loans.use: to buy leather products like steering wheels and bags.

loans.name: Florez Angelica

texts.es:
Doris una señora con 58 años de edad, con dos hijos de 27 y 30 años, se dedica a la preparación y venta de alimentos desde su casa, un negocio por el cual ella ha logrado salir adelante y progresar como familia.

Doris se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para realizar compra de alimentos como queso, leche, mantequilla entre otros.

El propósito principal que tiene este señora para trabajar es el de mejorar las condiciones de su casa, ya que debido a las fuertes lluvias esta se ha ido deteriorando.

Al igual que Doris, miles de empresarios están esperando tu ayuda, Anímate y haz un préstamo!
texts.en:
Doris is 58 years old. She has two children who are 27 and 30 years old. She prepares and sells food from her home. This is a business which allows her to move ahead and make progress with her family. 

Doris is requesting a loan to purchase cheese, milk, butter and other items. 

Her main reason for working  is to improve her home's condition since heavy rains have caused it to deteriorate. 

Like Doris, there are thousands of entrepreneurs waiting for your help. Go ahead and make a loan!

loans.use: purchase food like cheese, milk, butter and other items.

loans.name: Martha Lidia

texts.es:
Martha de 31 años de edad, no estudió muchos grados académicos, está acompañada y su pareja es albañil, tiene 3 hijos que asisten a la escuela.


Martha se dedica al negocio de venta de tamales de elote, ya tiene varios años en esta actividad, esto lo aprendió de su familia que se han dedicado a lo mismo, su esposo le ayuda económicamente y ella realiza la venta de tamales en la terminal de buses.


Ella solicita este crédito para comprar elotes para la elaboración de tamales.

Ella sueña con seguir adelante con su negocio, tener muchos clientes y darles educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Martha, age 31, did not attend school for very many years.  She is in a relationship, and her life partner is a bricklayer.  She has three children, and they go to school.

Martha has a business selling corn tamales.  She has been engaged in this business activity for several years.  She learned this from her family; they had worked doing the same thing.  Her husband helps her financially.  She sells tamales at the bus terminal.

She is requesting this loan to buy corn in order to make tamales.

She dreams of getting ahead with her business, having a lot of customers, and giving her children an education.

loans.use: to buy corn in order to make tamales.

loans.name: El Carmen Group

texts.es:
En Oaxaca existe una comunidad muy pintoresca y llena de tradiciones con raíces de la cultura mazateca. Está rodeada por cerros y desde sus cimas se pueden observar los cultivos de mangos, limones y caña de azúcar. Durante la primavera y el verano, los cultivos de mango movilizan la actividad de la industria refesquera que adquiere una gran cantidad de la producción del fruto para obtener su néctar.
   En dicha comunidad se formó un grupo que lleva por nombre El Carmen, los integrantes y sus actividades son: Judith quien se dedica a la venta de comida y pollos; Valentina, Cirila y Alicia, comida; Norma y Elida; Irma, pollo; María, Carmela y Elena, cosméticos. Por su parte Modesta maneja una panadería; Rosa, una carnicería y Margarito quien es agricultor. 
   El único hombre del grupo, Don Margarito, decidió integrarse para fortalecer su actividad y así generar mayores ingresos que beneficien a su familia. Mago, como todos lo conocen, tiene catorce años de experiencia como agricultor; hoy en día cultiva caña de azúcar, mango y maíz aprovechando todas las propiedades de la tierra. Él labora durante todo el año pues la caña se cosecha cada seis meses, el mango una vez al año y el maíz constantemente dado que siembra dos variedades distintas. De igual forma da empleo a veinte personas más durante la cosecha.
   Con las ganancias obtenidas ayudó a su esposa Reyna en la apertura de un negocio de verduras. “El trabajo en el campo es bonito y más si se cuenta con el apoyo de la familia, por ahora sólo vendemos verduras en casa pero no descartamos la idea de poner una tienda de abarrotes” comentó muy entusiasmado. Esta vez solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas de maíz y fertilizante para la próxima cosecha.
   El grupo entero agradece a cada una de las personas que hacen posible las oportunidades del préstamo.

*La fotografía fue tomada en casa de don Mago quien está en cuclillas. Detrás de él se aprecian las integrantes del grupo además de la mesa donde coloca la verdura.
texts.en:
In Oaxaca there is a very picturesque community which is full of traditions rooted in the Mazatec culture. It is surrounded by hills and from their summits the mango, lemon and sugar cane crops can be seen. During Spring and Summer the mango crops drive the activity of the soft drinks industry which buys a large amount of the mango harvest to produce its juice. 

In this community a group was set up which goes by the name El Carmen. The members and their businesses are: Judith who makes a living selling food and chickens; Valentina, Cirila and Alicia, who sell food; Norma, Elida and Irma who sell chicken; María, Carmela and Elena who sell cosmetics. Meanwhile Modesta runs a bakery and Rosa has a butcher's, and Margarito is a farmer. Margarito, the only man in the group, decided to join in order to strengthen his business and so generate a larger income which would benefit his family. 

Mago, as he is known by everyone, has 14 years' experience as a farmer. These days he grows sugar cane, mango and corn, making the most of all the characteristics of the land. He works all through the year since the sugar cane is harvested every six months, the mango once a year and the corn crops constantly since he plants two different varieties. Similarly he gives employment to twenty extra people during the harvest. With the profits he has made he has helped his wife Reyna to open a business selling vegetables. "Working in the countryside is nice and even more so if you have the family's support. For the time being we are just selling vegetables from the house but we haven't ruled out the idea of setting up a grocery business" he said very enthusiastically.

This time he is asking for the loan to buy corn seed and fertilizers for the next harvest. The whole group thanks each one of the people who make the opportunity of a loan possible.

The photo was taken in Mago's house. He is crouching and behind him you can see the members of the group and the table where he arranges the vegetables.

loans.use: to buy corn seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
Gladis es una mujer con todas las pilas puestas para enfrentar el mundo y tener una vida plena gracias a sus esfuerzos.

Tiene un negocio en el que vende productos de uso personal.
Inicio el negocio hace 4 años y a pesar de su poco tiempo en funcionamiento ha tenido buena acogida en el sector.

Ella desea ampliar su oferta de productos y mejorar sus ventas inyectándole capital a su empresa, es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para darse la oportunidad de ser mas prospera. 

El dinero será invertido en la compra de mercancía con la que actualmente no cuenta como cremas de manos y lociones, pues con esto terminara de surtir su inventario.

Tiene grandes esperanzas en su negocio y piensa que su futuro puede mejorar considerablemente gracias al apoyo de entidades como Interactuar que hacen lo posible para que las personas puedan soñar con una vida mejor y más estable.
texts.en:
Gladis is a woman who is ready to face the world and lead a fulfilling life thanks to her hard work. 

She has a business selling products for personal use, which she started four years ago. Despite only having been in business for a short period of time, she has had a good reception in the sector. 

She wants to increase her range of products and improve her sales by injecting capital into her business. This is why she is asking for a loan to give her business a better chance to prosper.  

She will invest the money in buying merchandise that she does not currently have, such as hand creams and lotions. With these items she will finish stocking up her inventory. 

Gladis has great hopes for her business and believes that her future could improve considerably thanks to the support of organisations such as Interactuar that make it possible for people to dream of having better, more stable lives.

loans.use: to buy merchandise that she doesn't currently have, such as hand creams and lotions, so that she can finish stocking up her inventory

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es:
Beatriz es una mujer emprendedora que trabajó durante años en diferentes empresas, pero hace un tiempo decidió iniciar un pequeño negocio en casa. 

Ella trabaja en la venta de productos de uso personal todos los días desde las 9:00 am hasta las 9:00 pm. 

Beatriz utilizará el crédito solicitado a la Corporación Interactuar para comprar al por mayor surtido de lociones, cremas, desodorantes, gel, entre otros.

El sueña con acreditar el negocio y con poder incrementar sus ingresos, que le permitan tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Beatriz is an enterprising woman, who worked for years at different companies.  However, a while ago she decided to start a small business at home.

She works selling personal use products every day from 9:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m.

Beatriz will use the loan requested from the Corporación Interactuar to buy in bulk a stock of lotions, creams, deodorants, and gels, among others.

She dreams of funding her business and being able to increase her earnings.  This will allow her to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy in bulk a stock of lotions, creams, deodorants, and gels, among others.

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es:
Cristian, a sus 19 años de edad, es un joven carismático, activo y servicial. Desde hace aproximadamente 3 años, comenzó a comercializar productos de uso personal de la marca Amway para todo tipo de clientes, lo que le permitió darse a conocer en el sector y lograr una buena trayectoria. 
Trabaja todos los días durante 5 horas.

Esto la impulsa a solicitar el apoyo del crédito para fortalecer sus inventarios, pues comprará de este tipo de productos al por mayor, así podrá satisfacer la demanda que está aumentando, esto le ayudará a mejorar los ingresos que percibe por su labor. 

Cristian manifiesta que su poca experiencia no le impide seguir haciendo lo que le gusta, por ello siempre se propone nuevas metas y entre ellas está el de convertirse en un gran distribuidor de productos.
texts.en:
Cristian, aged 19, is a charismatic, active and helpful young man. Approximately 3 years ago, he started to sell products for personal use by all types of customers from the brand Amway. This has allowed him to become known in his sector and to achieve a good scope. He works every day for 5 hours. 

This drives him to ask for help from a loan to boost his inventory so he can buy this type of product wholesale. This will allow him to meet the ever increasing demand which will help him to improve his income through work.

Cristian says that his lack of experience does not prevent him from doing what he enjoys. He is always coming up with new targets and through them he is becoming a great distributor of the products.

loans.use: to buy wholesale personal products to sell.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Adelaida works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish.  Adelaida is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Adelaida has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional fishing net

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
This is Rosalinda’s dressmaking shop located in Santa Barbara, Iloilo. It’s somewhat bare for now but she hopes to acquire another electric sewing machine soon. Her shop is spacious and would be able to accommodate two to three seamstresses in the near future. If that time comes, Rosalinda could hire her friends who have the skills to cut and sew clothes and together they can increase production with more sales and higher earnings to follow. But for now, Rosalinda wants to take the first step – to borrow PHP 20,000 to pay for an electric sewing machine, cloth and fabric, thread, and accessories like buttons, hooks, and zippers. This loan will generate additional income that can supplement her husband’s irregular income as a construction worker. She can help supply their everyday necessities and set aside some funds for the future. She aims to establish a successful business that can contribute to her community’s progress. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy another electric sewing machine, cloth and fabric, thread, and other sewing accessories

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is 37 years old, married to Susan and supports four children. He has been a farmer for the last six years and the business earns him KES 20,000 per month. 

Albert has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer for top dressing his crops for a better harvest for family use. He will sell the surplus to clients in the market.

He plans to use his profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and also to educate his children. 

His hope is to expand his agricultural business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer for top dressing his crops for a better harvest

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rosalina works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising livestock.  Rosalina is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell for her dried fish business.

Rosalina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy more clothing to sell for her business.

Rosa has been in this business for four years. Rosa earns additional income from fishing.

Rosa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like gasoline, wood, and bamboo for her fishing business.

She earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested this loan to further build her business. 

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like gasoline, wood, bamboo, etc

loans.name: Rosmila

texts.en:
Rosmila works hard to support her family. Rosmila is married and has a business selling dry goods in the Philippines.

Rosmila requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional dry goods like shoes, shorts, and pants to sell to her customers.

Rosmila has been in this business for 15 years now.

Rosmila would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional dry goods like shoes, shorts, and pants to sell to her customers

loans.name: Arsen

texts.en: Arsen hopes to have his second loan with Kiva to be as successful as his first transaction. Arsen is 41 years old and lives with his three sons in the frontier village of Khashtarak in the Tavush region. Arsen is divorced and is used to taking care of his sons very skillfully. Arsen is a farmer and he cares for his farm with pleasure. He raises pigs, goats and a lot of chickens. From his farm, Arsen sells goat milk, cheese made from goat milk, pork, poultry and eggs. His plot of land is rich with potatoes, beans, tomatoes and greens. Arsen also planted a lot of fruit trees and his orchard is full with apples, apricots, grapes and fig trees. Arsen sell his farm goods at the wholesale market mainly to re-sellers. This loan of 700.000 Armenian drams will go toward the purchase of pigs for his swine breeding business and tol buy fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to purchase pigs for his swine breeding business and tol buy fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Anil

texts.en: Anil is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a jeepney transport business in the Philippines. Anil has been in this business for five years. She earns additional income from selling ice. She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her jeepney. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her jeepney

loans.name: Julian

texts.en:
Internet cafés are beneficial to most Filipinos who cannot afford a monthly Internet subscription. They can pay for one hour of Internet rental for an average fee of PHP 15 and they can connect with their social network. Julian, 49, is aware of this need and started an Internet café beside his house in Santa Barbara, Iloilo. He can help those students who need to research school assignments, those families with members abroad who long to see each other through Skype, and also those bored individuals who want to play online games. 

But no matter how in demand Julian’s business is, he will also experience loss if he will not pay attention to computer maintenance. As of now, some of his computer central processing units (CPUs) are deteriorating and he has to replace them. He needs PHP 20,000 for this purpose. New CPUs will ensure a more efficient business operation, thus giving him steady income to support his family’s needs and children’s educational expenses. You can be assured of his faithful repayment because his wife, Marilou, is a businesswoman who gives him valuable advice and support. Julian desires to see his children finish their schooling and he wants to bestow a stable business to them. He is a compliant member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with his co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy new computer CPUs to replace old ones

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 63 years old and married with four children.  

Josephine is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Josephine has been farming sugarcane for 15 years now, and has borrowed 25 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Josephine would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 55 years old and married with 11 children.

Lilia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Lilia has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Lilia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en: Emilie is 18 years old and is the third of the three children in the family. Her mother, Valentina, is a member of Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation and supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines. Emilie is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Information Technology and is currently in the second year of this 4-year course. Valentina is borrowing 7900 PHP to pay for tuition fees for the first semester of the school year 2015-16. Emilie plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Natividad has been in this business for eight years. Natividad earns additional income from a general store.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested this loan to further build her business. 

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Judith works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and fishing. Judith is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to purchase more boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Judith has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 57 years old and married with five children.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

Erlinda has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

Erlinda aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Luis Gabriel

texts.es:
Desde el año 2012, Luis encontró la fórmula para sentirse útil y poder generar sus propios ingresos y lo logro gracias a la venta de ropa.

Luis es un responsable, trabajador y servicial hombre de 32 años de edad que se enorgullece de no tener que pedir dinero a nadie pues el mismo se consigue su propio sustento. 

Solicita un crédito para comprar zapatos, ropa y accesorios al por mayor y así poder aumentar sus ventas, este es un negocio poco común en su barrio y es por eso que le dedica 10 horas.

Con tu ayuda Luis podrá mejorar su capital y tener un mejor sustento, apoya hoy!
texts.en:
It was in 2012 that Luis found the secret to feeling useful and being able to generate his own income. He has achieved this by selling clothing. Luis is a responsible, hard-working and helpful 32-year-old who takes a pride in not having to ask for money from anyone, since he is able to support himself. 

He is asking for a loan to buy shoes, clothing and accessories wholesale so he can increase his sales. This business is not very common in his neighbourhood and this is why he works at it for 10 hours a day. 

With your help Luis will be able to improve his capital and have more to support himself with. Support him today!

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothing and accessories in order to be able to increase his sales.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Other people perceive the task of managing a “sari-sari” (variety) store as a simple “wait and sell” practice. It’s not that effortless. Marilou of Santa Barbara, Iloilo wakes up very early in the morning and sleeps late at night in order to meet the demands of customers. Sometimes a customer knocks at 4:30 a.m. to buy one sachet of shampoo worth PHP 5. At times, she has to stay until 12:00 midnight to take the orders of a group drinking beer in front of her store. Marilou needs to be patient, indeed, or else customers will brand her as unfriendly, and they will patronize other stores.

It’s a good thing that her husband, Errol Von, a construction worker, takes a turn in looking after the store when he’s not on duty. She can also rely on her two children to watch over the store during their vacant hours after school. They share the task because their usual everyday needs are supported by the income from the variety store. However, it cannot meet the educational expenses of Marilou’s children.

Now she’s determined to improve her business and increase her profit. She longs to obtain additional capital of PHP 18,000 that she will use to buy more dry goods, grocery items, and soft drinks to enhance her inventory. This additional capital can be a step towards her dream of a bigger store someday. She also hopes to see her children with a completed college education. She shares this aspiration with her co-fellowship* members who meet every week to strengthen each other through the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more dry goods, grocery items, and soft drinks to enhance her inventory.

loans.name: Merle

texts.en:
Merle lives in Iloilo, Philippines together with her husband Zaldy, a farmer, and their children. Merle wants to borrow 50,000 PHP to repair and improve the fence of her pig cage. As you can see in the photo, the fence is fastened only by a few wires so it has the tendency to fall any time. After several weeks, those medium-sized hogs will grow bigger, and they will jump across the fence. Therefore this financial assistance is urgent, and Merle will be very grateful for it. She plans to buy hollow blocks and cement to make a higher concrete fence. She will also buy feed, medicine, and vitamins to counter the common illnesses of pigs that bring losses to hog raisers during the rainy season. In due time, she aspires to have a big piggery that will provide enough profit for her family. This will ensure their daily sustenance and the children’s education. She dreams that all her children will finish their studies and become successful in their careers and lives.  Merle constantly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through sharing of experiences and Biblical reflections.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela works hard to support his family. Angela is married and has a business selling dry goods in the Philippines.

Angela requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more dry goods to sell.

Angela has been in this business for three years now.

Angela would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more dry goods to sell

loans.name: Lusya

texts.en: Lusya lives with her husband in the frontier village of Aghavnavank in the Tavush region. Lusya has a vocational education and she has a specialty of accountant. Now she simultaneously works as an accountant and as a farmer. Her husband helps her very much on the farm and they take care of cows, calves, pigs, a horse and chickens. Lusya sells her products right from her farm; including milk, macun (national dairy-product), cheese, meat and eggs. Lusya also has a hayfield and a nice orchard which she and her husband planted when they were young. From the orchard she has sweetest harvest of apricots, apples, mulberries and figs. Lusya has a new idea and needs financial support for its realization. She wants to start bee keeping and honey production. This loan will help her purchase several bee families and she also will use it to buy several piglets for her swine breeding operation.

loans.use: to purchase several bee families and also to buy several piglets for her swine breeding operation..

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel has owned and operated her variety store for eight years. She is happily married with one child. Her husband works as a bagger at a department store.

Maricel would like to purchase eggs, soft drinks, biscuits, detergent, and bath soap for her variety store, but she doesn't have enough capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000. She hopes that she can access this amount of loan to keep her variety store progressive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as soft drinks, canned goods, assorted biscuits, candies, eggs, detergent soap, and bath soap for her variety store.

loans.name: Alfonsa

texts.en:
Hog raising is a practical endeavor that alleviates food shortages in the community. Alfonsa is from Santa Barbara, Iloilo, and has been in this business for ten years. She’s convinced that it is a good enterprise that offers affordable food for the community. Her income from this business helps sustain her family’s daily needs.

But, if the common illnesses of pigs attack, Alfonsa has to start again. This rainy season, she wants to prepare early to avoid those illnesses. She will buy medicines, vitamins, additional feed, and additional piglets. She is appealing for a loan of PHP 20,000 to procure all these. She aims to distribute a bigger volume of affordable pork within the community, and this financial assistance will be very helpful. She’s looking forward to having a bigger piggery someday, not just to obtain higher income, but also to contribute to food production and distribution.

She shares her experiences and aspirations with her co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative. They regularly meet every week to share stories about their lives and businesses and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feed, medicines, and vitamins for her hog raising venture.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna has run her variety store for three years. Aside from selling grocery items, she also serves as a barangay health worker (BHW) and utility within her local community. Her husband works as a gasoline boy. The couple works hard to earn a living and to send their two children into a higher level of education.

Lorna plans to purchase stock of grocery items such as soft drinks, eggs, biscuits, canned goods, and seasonings, but she struggles from a shortage of capital. With regards to her situation, she is seeking a loan of 10,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP). She hopes to obtain said loan amount to keep her business profitable.

loans.use: to buy stock of grocery items such as soft drinks, eggs, biscuits, canned goods and seasonings for her variety store

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada is a 29-year-old married lady from Bethlehem. She is a mother for three sons. All of them are attending school. Nada works as an employee in a kids center in the city. She also works with her husband in their olive wood souvenir workshop. It is a very common business in Bethlehem. 

Nada took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more raw olive wood for the souvenir workshop. By taking this loan, Nada and her husband will be able to increase their productivity and sell more. 

Nada appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more raw olive wood for the souvenir workshop.

loans.name: Dora Libia

texts.es:
Dora desde muy temprana edad aprendió el oficio de confección de ropa gracias a su mamá que toda su vida fue confeccionista y fue así como poco a poco Dora empezó a entender y aplicar estos conocimientos.

Es una mujer emprendedora, amorosa y siempre dispuesta a atender a sus clientes de la mejor manera.

Se siente muy agradecida con todo lo que ha podido construir hasta ahora con la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar.

Madruga todos los días para trabajar en sus negocio durante 8 horas.
Ella pide un apoyo económico para comprar insumos de confección como tela, hilos y agujas.

Tiene muchas esperanzas en su negocio y conserva la ilusión de tener un taller mucho más grande en el que pueda ofrecer empleo y aumentar sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dora started learning how to sew at a very early age thanks to her mother, who worked as a seamstress her whole life. That was how little by little Dora started to understand and apply these skills.

She is an enterprising woman, always loving and willing to serve her customers as best she can. She gets up early every day to start her eight-hour workday.

Dora is requesting financial support to buy sewing supplies like fabric, thread, and needles. She is very grateful for everything she has been able to build with help from Interactuar. She has many hopes in her business and is looking forward to having a much bigger shop where she could offer employment opportunities and increase her customer base.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies like fabric, thread, and needles.

loans.name: Archelle

texts.en:
Archelle is 29 years old, married and has one child who is in school.

Archelle is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. Archelle has been in pig fattening for 2 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Archelle would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Bekmurat

texts.ru: Бегмурат 41 летный житель района Чиликул. Он семейный человек. У него есть 2 сыновья и одна дочка. Старший сын служит в армии. Младший учится в университете. Дочка учится в средней школе. Бегмурад счатливый и заботливый отец. Он помогает детям в учебе и он хочет, чтобы дети стали честным, умным, ответственном человеком. Бегмурат хорошо воспитывает своих детей. Он занимается животноводством у себя дома. Животноводческая деятельность является основной, потому что доход от этого бизнеса обеспечивает семью. Бегмурат обратился за кредитом, потому что у нее остался малое количество скотов, чтобы сохранить деятельность и увеличить поголовья скота Бегмурат необходимо определенная сумма денег. Он намерен на заемные средства приобрести скотов и сохранить бизнес.
texts.en:
Bekmurat is a 41-year-old resident of the Jilikul region. He is a family man. He has two sons and a daughter. The elder son is in the army. The younger is studying in a university. The daughter is in middle school. Bekmurat is a happy and caring father. He helps his kids with studies and wants them to become honest, smart and responsible people. Bekmurat is raising his children well. 

At home, Bekmurat breeds livestock which is his primary occupation since it generates the income to provide money for the whole family. Bekmurat requested a loan because he has only few animals left in his household, and he needs the money to maintain his activities and increase the livestock headcount. Bekmurat needs a certain sum of money. He will use the borrowed money to buy livestock and save his business.

loans.use: to increase livestock headcount and save the business

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline prays to God that her children will obtain a college degree and find a good job with the aid of her business. She and her husband, Roel, are fish vendors from Santa Barbara, Iloilo. They have been into this business for 17 long years, and they have already established four vending posts in four different towns in Iloilo. They have also employed five helper-vendors. They may have mastered the secrets of the trade or maybe it’s their husband-and-wife partnership that paves the way towards success of their business, but Evangeline doesn’t stop dreaming. She still aspires for expansion not only to boost their income and savings, but also to help her neighbors earn a living. She chooses to employ those who are hardworking but have no chance to land a stable job. 

To develop her business further, she is requesting additional capital worth 35,000 PHP. She plans to buy different varieties of fish in volume. This supplemental capital will be very important because fish gets more expensive during rainy days. She has to sustain her business and uphold the salaries of her helper-vendors. 

Evangeline is a dutiful member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy different varieties of fish in volume

loans.name: Jaime Leon

texts.es:
La venta de frutas y verduras, es la actividad en la cual se desempeña Jaime, un hombre con empuje y perseverancia para sacar adelante su propio negocio y a su familia.

El se dedica a esta actividad desde hace más de 15 años trabajando desde muy temprano en la mañana todos los días para ofrecer sus alimentos.
Trabaja sola todos los días durante 10 horas.

Decidió iniciar este proyecto al ver la necesidad de obtener más ingresos para su familia y ya que no tenía la educación suficiente para otro cargo, opto por la venta de frutas y verduras.

Es un hombre simpático y servicial, siempre dispuesto a atender las inquietudes y deseos de sus clientes.

El pide un auxilio económico con la Corporación Interactuar para comprar una un amplio surtido de verduras y de esta manera abastecerse y vender una mayor cantidad de alimentos.

Su sueño es tener un local en cual pueda vender tranquila y cómodamente sus alimentos.

Presta y aporta hoy, anímate!
texts.en:
Fruit and vegetable sales is the business which Jaime works in. He is a man with drive and perseverance to move his own business and his family forward. He has been making a living in this way for more than 15 years, working from very early in the morning every day to offer his produce. He works alone for 10 hours every day. He decided to start up this project when he saw a need to make more income for his family and, since he did not have enough of an education for any other role, he opted for fruit and vegetable sales.

He is a friendly and helpful man and is always ready to deal with any concerns and requests from his customers. 

He is asking for financial help from Corporación Interactuar to buy a wide selection of vegetables so he can stock up and sell a larger quantity of produce. His dream is to have premises where he can sell his produce quietly and comfortably.

Make a loan and contribute today. Go for it!

loans.use: to buy a wide selection of vegetables in order to stock up and sell and larger quantity of produce.

loans.name: El Buen Samaritano Group

texts.es: La. Sra. María tiene 55 años de edad, es separada con 2 hijos que ya no dependen de ella. Tiene el cargo de presidenta en el grupo “El Buen Samaritano” que está integrada por 6 socias muy responsables que vienen trabajando desde hace más de 5 años. María se dedica a vender productos de belleza y adicionalmente es cuidadora de bebes y ancianos, de esta forma Ella genera sus ingresos para poder cubrir sus propios gastos. El préstamo lo utilizara en la compra de más productos de belleza como perfumes, colonias, maquillajes, etc para poder abastecer los pedidos que tiene por sus clientes. Uno de los anhelos que Ella tiene es llegar a implementar su tienda donde pueda vender sus cosméticos y demás productos. En la foto del grupo María está sentada en medio de las demás señoras paradas.
texts.en:
María is 55 years old, is separated and has two children who no longer depend on her.  

She is has the position of president in the group "The Good Samaritan" which is made up of six very responsible members who have been working for more than five years.  

Maria sells beauty products and also cares for babies as well as the elderly.  In this way she earns income to cover her own expenses.  

She will use the loan to purchase more beauty products such as perfumes, colognes, make up etc. in order to fill her clients' orders.  

Her goal is to implement a store where she could sell her cosmetics and other products.  In the group photo, Maria is seated in the middle of the other ladies who are standing.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, brick, iron and metal sheets to build a septic tank that will provide more hygiene to her family.

loans.name: Tigran
