texts.en:
Tigran is 20 years old and already he is skilled farmer. As he says, he does each work about his farm properly and with pleasure. Tigran lives with his retired grandmother who is not able to help Tigran much in the farm work. But as Tigran says, her advices about farming is more precious and helpful. 

On the farm he has cows, a heifer, a calf, sheep, lambs and chickens. Tigran is also seriously engaged in potato cultivation and sales. He organizes at the city wholesale market. Tigran is also a student. He studies at the distance learning department; he is a student at Yerevan State University of Physical Education.  

Tigran manages everything both in his education and about in his farm, and he has more plans connected with his agricultural activities. If Kiva lenders support him with the loan amount, he wants to develop potato cultivation and he will buy potato seedlings, fertilizer and diesel fuel as well.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings, fertilizer and diesel fuel to develop potato cultivation

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan works hard to support eight children. She is married and has a general store in the Philippines.

Susan requested a PHP 5,800 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Susan is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, but she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Ineza

texts.en:
Ineza is 31 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and 4 children in Kobuleti district. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land, where they grow nut and mandarin trees. In addition, they have a cow and a calf. Ineza milks the cow every day and produces dairy products to sell with the harvested products. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan. With the received credit they will install chairs in the minibus and Ineza's husband will work on the minibus line and he will transport people. They will get stable income and Ineza will be able to improve the living conditions for her children.

loans.use: To install chairs in the minibus and use it for transporting people

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in equipment for a beauty salon

loans.name: Andrea Maribel

texts.es: Andrea tiene  22 años y es madre soltera, su hijo tiene 1 año,  Andrea vive con sus padres y  su hijo, Andrea tiene  desde hace 4 años atrás su negocio que es una tienda general, Andrea comenta que le va bien en su negocio ya que es la única tienda que hay por donde ella reside y esto hace que los clientes le visiten muy frecuente, Andrea solicita el dinero del crédito para comprar productos de tienda así como arroz, azúcar, pan, gaseosas y muchos más productos que ofrece a sus clientes,  Andrea desea mejorar su negocio, para que le vaya bien y así lograr mejorar la calidad de vida de su hijo.
texts.en:
Andrea is a 22 year old single mother with a 1 year old son and lives with her parents and her son.  She's had a general store for four yeas now which has been doing very well since it is the only store in the neighborhood and the clients visit frequently.  
Andrea is requesting a loan to buy products for her store like rice, sugar, bread, sodas, and many other products that she offers to her clients.  Andrea wants to improve her business so she can be successful and improve the quality of life of her child.

loans.use: to buy products for her store.

loans.name: Alonso

texts.es:
Alonso es un hombre con gran empuje y emprendimiento, desde hace un tiempo se determino a encontrar una actividad que le generar buenos ingresos y que le permitiera ser independiente, es así como desde hace 3 años inicio con un negocio de café bar en el municipio de Frontino.

Es un negocio muy ameno y con una buena calidad de servicio por parte de Alonso

Con tan poco este en el mercado ya tiene cierto nivel de reconocimiento gracias a la buena gestión de Alonso.

El solicita un préstamo para realizar la comprar surtido de bebidas, licores y frituras para aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Alonso is a man with great drive and entrepreneurship.  For some time he was determined to find an occupation that would generate good income and would allow him to be independent, so 3 years ago he began a business of a coffee bar in the municipality of Frontino.  

It is a very lively business with a good quality of service by Alonso.  With so few like this in the market, it already has some degree of recognition thanks to Alonso's good management.

He requests a loan to buy an assortment of drinks, liquor, and fried foods to increase his sales.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of drinks, liquor, and fried foods to increase his sales.

loans.name: Grupo Las Nahualeñas Group

texts.es:
Rosa (es la primera del lado izquierdo de la fotografía)es una humilde mujer que trabaja día con día para darle lo mejor a su pequeño hijo de 6 años,  ella tiene 24 años de edad y vive junto a su hijo en una comunidad del departamento de Sololá, Rosa para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica de su región, ella tiene tres años de realizar esta labor, para Rosa no hay nada más importante que su negocio pues  es donde provienen sus ingresos, es por ello que con el afán de seguir mejorando sus servicios a los clientes organizo a un grupo de señoras quienes también tiene el mismo fin con sus negocios para solicitar un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de diferentes tipos de güipiles, cortes, fajas  y poder satisfacer mejor las necesidades de los clientes.
El gran sueño de Rosa es poder contar con el préstamo para mejorar sus ingresos y construir una casa de block.
texts.en:
Rosa (the first to the left in the photo) is a simple woman who works day by day to provide the best for her 6 year old son. She is 24 years old and lives with her son in a community in the department of Sololá.

In order to make her income and get her family ahead Rosa works buying and selling traditional clothing from her area. She has been doing this for three years and for Rosa there is nothing more important to her than her business as that is where she gets her income.

So with the desire to continue to improve her services to her clients she organized a group of women who also have the same goal for their businesses to request a loan. She will invest it in buying different types of blouses. skirts and belts to be able to better satisfy the needs of her clients. Rosa's great dream is to get the loan to improve her income and build a cinder block house.

loans.use: to buy and sell traditional clothing.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios, is aged 36, married and blessed with two children. She has sold frozen foods in their village for almost one year and earns a net income of PHP 5,000 daily. Due to insufficient capital in her business, she would like to request a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase frozen foods to sell such as hot dogs, smoked sausage, frozen fish and pork. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more productive so that she can earn more profits for her family.

loans.use: To purchase frozen foods to sell such as hot dogs, smoked sausage, frozen fish and pork.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en: Elmira is happy for her nice partnership with Kiva and Nor Horizon and she hopes that this second deal will also be a profitable one. She is 43 years old and she lives with her sons in the village of Tsovagyugh in the Gegharkunik region. Still devoted to her farm and its care, it still remains the only source of income for her family. Here she has cows, a bull, a calf, sheep, lambs and chickens. Her plot of land gives her harvests of potatoes, cucumbers and greens, half of which she uses for her family’s needs. The other part of her land’s harvest and her farm products such as milk, a great range of dairy products, meat and eggs she sells right from her farm. Elmira is asking for a loan of 700,000 Armenian drams as she wants to buy a lot of potato seedlings and fertilizer and she will enlarge her farm with the purchase of one more calf and also fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy a lot of potato seedlings and fertilizer and to enlarge her farm with the purchase of one more calf and also fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa was born in 1978. He is single and lives with his family in a sector of Jordan called Southern Ghour.

Musa has been trying his best to support his family and to help his father in covering his sibling’s needs by running his project, a grocery store. Because of the high standard of living he needs to expand it more now by buying a larger quantity of food supplies, adding variety and improving his store, but he doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

He needs your support.

loans.use: to buy new food supplies, adding variety and improving his store.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 33-year-old married Palestinian refugee and a father of four children. In December 2014 he decided to start selling fruit and vegetables as a daily income business to make sure he can cover his family's daily needs. Ali used to sell fresh chicken, but he decided to turn to a more requested product, to make sure that he can acquire a daily income to his beloved family.

His business is going on just fine, but since it is limited to the Palestinian camp refugees where he lives and works, he needs an extra external financial support so that he can expand and increase his business income, through diversifying his products and increasing his sales. It is for this reason, that Ali is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase his business merchandise with special summer products that will attract customers' attention and increase his income.

He hopes that one day he will be capable of buying his current shop instead of paying rent expenses.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise with special summer products that will attract customers' attention and increase his income.

loans.name: Blesilda

texts.en:
Life may not be as easy as it seems, but when you have hope, nothing is impossible. That's what Blesilda believes and she is thankful that you let her borrow an amount that helped her a lot in her food stall business. Because of that, she was able to increase her profit in such a way that she was able to supply her family with their basic needs at home.

She would like to access another loan that she will use to buy additional raw ingredients for her recipes and other materials needed in cooking or selling. A PHP 25,000 loan is enough to supply these supplies. She really hopes that you'll entrust her again. The main reason why she perseveres in her business is to provide and invest in a better future for her family. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients for her recipes and other materials needed in cooking or selling

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María, de 44 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, debido a falta de interés de sus padres, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la pesca artesanal y a la siembra de granos básicos al igual que sus 2 hijos. 
María, se dedica a comercializar marisco desde hace 25 años, este producto lo sustraen sus hijos y su pareja de una laguna y luego ella lo lleva a vender al mercado central; pero además de eso, se dedica a la venta de helados en su vivienda. 

María, necesita el crédito para comprar una lancha con motor incorporado, esto con el objetivo de mejorar la actividad de pesca que realizan su pareja y sus hijos.

María, sueña con tener una vivienda que reúna las condiciones necesarias para darle mayor seguridad a su familia, así como también desea mejorar su negocio para ofrecer un servicio de calidad para sus clientes.
texts.en:
María, who is 44 years old, only studied as far as third grade on account of her parents' lack of interest. She has a partner and he makes a living from artisan fishing and sowing basic grains, as do her 2 sons. For 25 years María has made a living selling shellfish. Her sons and partner catch the shellfish in a lagoon and then she takes it to sell at the central market. As well as this, she also makes a living from selling ice creams in her home.

María needs the loan to buy a launch with an on-board motor. This is with the aim of improving the fishing activity carried out by her partner and sons.

María dreams of having a home which has everything necessary to give her family better security, and she also wants to improve her business to offer a quality service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy a launch with an on-board motor.

loans.name: Sayora

texts.en:
Sayora is a happy woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1975. She is married and has two children. Her husband is an entrepreneur and she is a tailor.

Sayora sews traditional and European style dresses for women. With 20 years of experience doing business sewing and selling dresses, she has regular client’s everyday. She appealed to IMON asking for financial support to buy textiles and thread for sewing. She hopes to be funded and awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to buy textiles and thread for sewing.

loans.name: Deliah

texts.en:
Deliah is a wife and mother of four. She lives in Salima, a district in the central region of Malawi. Deliah was born in a low income family and had to work extra hard to support herself through school. Her determination shows when she explains that her parents could not support her through school and she had to go back at a later stage when she was able to support herself. Today, Deliah is requesting a loan so that she can start running her own business. This will help her give her children a better life. She is determined to see all four of them through university.

Deliah is excited to start running her own business. She will set up her business in Salima and provide mobile money transfers to her community. This means that people will go to her to send and receive money as well as pay their bills. Zoona has done market research in Salima and established that the location where Deliah is going to set up is ideal for mobile money transfers, as a lot of people do not have bank accounts and use unsafe methods of moving their monies such as through bus services. With this loan, Deliah will be able to purchase a small trading kiosk where she will serve her customers and a basic web-enabled phone which she will use to serve people. The loan will also provide her with a working capital float: (float is money that is used to serve customers).

Deliah hopes to open more outlets and grow her business beyond Salima. She is happy that she'll finally be able to send her kids to school without worrying about how the fees are going to be paid.

loans.use: to purchase a small trading kiosk, a basic web-enabled phone, and to provide the money needed for her to serve people who need to access financial services in Salima

loans.name: Alinafe

texts.en:
Alinafe is 22 years old and she’s had to endure the hardship of being an orphan from the young age of 9. Although she has been helped by well-wishers, the income to meet her basic needs was always hard to come by. She is positive and believes that the opportunity to become a Zoona agent has ended her long status of being unemployed and will open more doors in her life as an entrepreneur. Alinafe has successfully completed training with Zoona to start running her own business in Lilongwe, Malawi.

Alinafe's business will provide mobile money services to people in Lilongwe. People will be able to go to Alinafe's kiosk to send and receive their monies as well as pay bills. She believes the money the community members will save from not traveling far distances to gain access to financial services can be channeled to something useful. With this loan, Alinafe will be able to set up her business by purchasing a trading kiosk and an internet-enabled phone, as well as having the funds to serve customers.  

Alinafe has two brothers and a sister. She is hopeful that once her business becomes profitable, she will open up more mobile money transfer outlets and employ her siblings. Alinafe thanks the Kiva lender for helping her change her life by empowering her to start her own business.

loans.use: to provide the start-up capital needed for her to start running her own business providing financial services to the unbanked

loans.name: Jesus Antonio

texts.es:
Jesus es un hombre muy trabajador y organizado, se gana la vida prestando el servicio de transporte de personas en su moto-taxi a través de las veredas del municipio de Cañasgordas posibilitando el desplazamiento de la comunidad hasta las distintitas áreas del municipio.

Es un hombre amable, servicial y muy emprendedor, es soltero y sostiene a su madre a la cual siempre ha procurado ofrecerle la mejor vida posible.

Solicita un préstamo para realizar el mantenimiento y reparación a su moto-taxi ya que es su único medio de trabajo.

Con este crédito podrá mejorar las condiciones de su vehículo y podrá continuar prestando su servicio con total seguridad y sin poner en riesgo su vida ni la de sus clientes.

Apoya a Jesus con un préstamo hoy!
texts.en:
Jesus is a hardworking and organized man; he makes a living by providing transport services to people in his motorcycle taxi through the roads in the town of Cañasgordas, helping the community to get around to the different areas of the town.
He is a friendly, helpful, and very enterprising man; he is single and supports his mother, whom he has always tried to offer the best life possible.
He is applying for a loan to perform maintenance and repair on his motorcycle taxi, as it is his only means of work.
With this loan he can improve the conditions of his vehicle and continue to provide his service safely and without endangering his life or the lives of his clients.
Support Jesus with a loan today!

loans.use: to perform maintenance and repair on his motorcycle taxi, as it is his only means of work.

loans.name: Shallom

texts.en:
Shallom is a hardworking man from Kasungu, Malawi. He is 22 years old and is the first born in a family of three children. Being the first born means that Shallom has to take responsibility for his younger siblings. He does not take this responsibility lightly and works hard to support them and lead by example.

Shallom has always wanted to run his own business so that he can provide for his family. He explains that jobs are very hard to find in Malawi and as a result, he chooses to be an employer. He has always had a keen interest in business but did not have the start-up capital to start running his own business. Today, Shallom is requesting a Kiva loan so that he can purchase a trading kiosk where he will be conducting his mobile money transfer business and a web-enabled phone which he will be using to serve customers. The loan will also provide the funds that Shallom will need to serve his customers who need to access financial services. Shallom will set up his business in his hometown of Kasungu in central Malawi.

Shallom believes his business will grow and that one day he will be able to employ other people. He dreams of advancing his education, enhancing his leadership and managerial skills, and helping his brothers through university.

loans.use: to buy a web-enabled phone and trading kiosk, and to provide the cash and electronic funds needed to serve customers

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan un padre responsable de su hijos de 16 años,  al cual ama y da la vida por el, se dedica a la venta de mercancía, una actividad que inicio por gusto al trabajo independiente que descubrió cuando era estudiante y vendía cosas a sus amigos, aprendió solo de esta labor.

Trabaja diariamente durante 12 horas y quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de surtido de ropa, elementos para el hogar, de aseo, accesorios, entre otros.
 
Su mayor objetivo en su vida se centra en su hijo y es poder darle una buena calidad de vida y pagar su educación.
texts.en:
Juan is the responsible parent of a 16 year old, whom he loves and would give his life for.

He makes a living by selling goods, an activity he started due to his appreciation for independent work and which he discovered as a student when he would sell things to his friends.  He learned this trade on his own.  

He works daily for 12 hours and wants to request a loan for the purchase of assorted clothing, household items, toiletries, accessories, among others.
 
His biggest goal in life is focused around his son, which is to be able to give him a good quality of life and pay for his education.

loans.use: to purchase assortment of clothing, household items, toiletries, accessories, among others.

loans.name: Meria

texts.en:
Meria is 22 years old. She was born in Kasungu and has always been at the top of her class. She is passionate about education and dreams of getting a master's degree in financial accounting.

Meria's challenge is that she recently relocated to Mzuzu and is dependent on her parents to send her money for her rentals and her upkeep. This makes her sad because her parents are farmers and they do not have enough money to support two households. It is for this reason that Meria has decided to start running her own business. Her business will deal in money transfers and bill payments. People in Mzuzu will go to her kiosk to access these financial services. Setting up her business will help serve the community, where the majority of the people are unbanked.

Meria has requested a loan from Kiva to be able to pay for her set-up costs. These include purchasing a mobile phone which she will use for transactions, purchasing a small trading kiosk where she will conduct her business, and providing the float needed to serve customers. Meria is hopeful that by setting up her own business, she will be able to support herself and be the one to send money back home to her parents in Kasungu, and at the same time help her achieve her dream of having a master’s degree in financial accounting.

loans.use: to pay for her set-up costs so that she can start running her own business

loans.name: Elysha

texts.en:
Elysha is 27 years old. She is from Lilongwe, Malawi where she lives with her parents. Elysha has grown up to look after her blind mother with the support of her father and her siblings. Having a blind mother necessitated that she assume the role of motherhood to her siblings and ensure that the family was held together. Elysha would like to start running her own business in Lilongwe and is requesting a loan in order to do this.

Elysha has successfully completed a training with Zoona to start running her own business as a Zoona agent. This means that she will offer financial services to people in her community and earn a profit for every transaction that she does. Elysha believes this business will expose her community to emerging technologies and help them ease the process of sending and receiving money from family, friends and colleagues.

The loan from Kiva will be used to pay for Elysha's set up costs such as buying a web-enabled mobile phone, a trading kiosk and the funds needed for her to serve customers. The loan will kick start Elysha's life to financial freedom. She is hopeful that by starting her own business, she will be able to take better care of her mother and siblings and be a role model to her siblings. She is determined to forge a bright future for herself and be financially independent.

loans.use: to pay for her set up costs such as buying a web-enabled mobile phone, a trading kiosk and the funds needed for her to serve customers

loans.name: Nancy Del Socorro

texts.es:
52 años de edad, una sonrisa simpática y mucho amor por sus hijos es lo que hoy en día proyecta la señora Nancy.

Se gana la vida con la preparación y venta de comidas en el municipio de Sincelejo. De este negocio saca para pagar los gastos de su hogar y para el sostenimiento del estudio de su familia. 

Su fuerza y motivación la saca del amor que profesa hacia su familia.
Pide un apoyo económico con la Corporación Interactuar para la compra de un mesón de acero, una estufa a gas, insumos, entre otros materiales.
Esto le permitirá consolidar y aumentar su negocio en gran medida.
texts.en: Fifty two years old, a nice smile and a lot of love for her children is what Nancy projects nowadays. She makes her living by preparing and selling food at the Sincelejo Municipality. From this business she gets the income to pay for household expenses and to support her family's education. Her strength and motivation come from the love she has towards her family. She is requesting financial support to Corporación Interactuar to buy an iron table, a gas stove, inputs, among other materials. This will allow her to significantly consolidate and increase her business.

loans.use: to buy an iron table, a gas stove, inputs, among other materials.

loans.name: Mable

texts.en:
Mable is 23 years old. She comes from a family of four siblings. Mable grew up in a normal household with working parents until 1999, when her father (who was the main breadwinner) had his job terminated. Her mother's meager salary failed to hold the family together in many aspects. The economic needs of the family became overwhelming and affected her outlook on life. However, she was determined to make it and thus began to take steps towards realizing her goals. 

Mable looks forward to becoming both an entrepreneur and a computer scientist. She currently holds a diploma in IT and has just completed training with Zoona to start running her own business in Lilongwe. Mable will run a business for mobile money transfers. She will provide her community with financial services and earn a profit every time she makes a transaction. She would like to grow the business and open more outlets. She intends to use the profits to go to university and improve her qualifications. She is hopeful that by becoming a successful entrepreneur, she will be able to help her family and change their lives for the better.

This loan will pay for Mable's set up costs such as the purchase of a branded trading kiosk and a web-enabled mobile phone. It will also provide a working capital float. Mable thanks the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to start her own business by paying for her set-up costs

loans.name: Brian

texts.en:
Brian, 23, is the second born in a family of six children. He has a secondary school certificate and lives in Lilongwe. Brian is requesting a loan from Kiva to start running his own business that will deal in mobile money transfers. He is re-locating from Lilongwe to Nkhotakota to set up his business.

Brian is excited to start running his own business. He sees this as a way for him to empower himself and his family. With this Kiva loan, Brian will be able to purchase a Zoona branded trading kiosk, in which he will be serving customers, a web-enabled phone, which he will use to make the transactions, and he will have the working capital needed for him to serve people who need to send and receive money. 

Brian's dream is to one day go back to school to study financial accounting. He is hopeful that the proceeds from his business will help him make his dream a reality. He believes that through hard work he will be a role model to people and assist his family and friends.

loans.use: to purchase a Zoona branded trading kiosk and a web-enabled cell phone and provides the cash and electronic funds needed for Brian to serve people who need to send and receive money

loans.name: Bonita

texts.en:
Bonita is 27 years old and the youngest of six children. She describes growing up as being difficult. She grew up with a single mother who was unemployed and struggled to send them to school. Bonita took challenging and odd jobs and finally completed high school. 

Bonita is grateful for the opportunity to be funded on Kiva. This is the first loan that she has ever received. She intends to use the loan to start running her own Zoona mobile money transfer business in the town of Nkhotakota. With the funds, Bonita will be able to purchase a trading kiosk and a web-enabled phone and have the cash at hand and electronic funds needed for her to serve people in Nkhotakota who need to access financial services.

Bonita's dream is to grow her business, start a family, and provide a better life for her mother. She thanks the Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to start running her own Zoona mobile money transfer business in the town of Nkhotakota

loans.name: Manuel David

texts.es:
Un pequeño puesto de venta de frutas fue lo que con mucho esfuerzo logro este emprendedor hombre de 35 años de edad llamado Manuel, que buscando una alternativa para generar ingresos tuvo la idea de montar su negocio. 

Hoy en día por el alto costo de sus insumos, su negocio está viéndose afectado, pues está pasando por un momento algo difícil.
 
Solicita una ayuda crediticia con la Corporación Interactuar para tener capital de trabajo para invertirlo sabiamente en esta época, comprando surtido de frutas, 2 sombrillas y una carreta nueva para cambiar la que tiene en mal estado.

Espera lograr superar esta crisis y gozar en un futuro al lado de su esposa y sus 3 hijos.
texts.en:
A small fruit sales cart was what this entrepreneur managed to achieve through his great effort.  He is 35 years old, and his name is Manuel.  He had been looking for a way to generate income when he had the idea to set up his business.

These days, due to the high cost of supplies, his business is being affected, so he is going through a bit of a hard time.

He is asking for the help of a loan with the Interactuar Corporation.  This is so that he has working capital to invest wisely during this period of time, stocking up on fruit and buying two shade umbrellas and a new cart in order to swap with the one he has, which is in bad shape.

He hopes to be able to get through this crisis and enjoy the future alongside his wife and three children.

loans.use: to wisely invest in the purchase of fruit, two shade umbrellas, and a new cart

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos es propietario de un puesto de comidas, tiene de 24 años de edad, vive con su esposo y 3 hijos menores de edad que dependen únicamente de este negocio para poder sobrevivir, comer, pagar sus deudas etc. 

Su negocio viene operando desde el 2010 y ahora quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra insumos como carne, pollo, queso, y de un horno para hacer pizzas.

Este crédito le permitirá continuar con la venta de comidas, podrá diversificar su oferta y seguir manteniéndose en el mercado, pues es quien genera los mayores ingresos en su hogar. 

Su sueño es poder pagar la educación de sus hijos y mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Carlos is the owner of a food stand.  He is 24 years old and lives with his wife and three children.  They are all depend financially on this business, exclusively, in order to survive, eat, pay their debts, etc.

His business has been in operation since 2010 and now he wants to ask for a loan to buy ingredients such as meat, chicken, and cheese, and to buy an oven for making pizzas.

This loan will allow him to continue selling meals.  He will be able to diversify what he offers and stay in the market, since he is the one who generates the most income in his household.

His dream is to be able to pay for the education of his children and improve the condition of his house.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, chicken, and cheese and to buy an oven to bake pizzas.

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es:
Mary es una mujer de 47 años, separada y madre de un hijo, su negocio es una papelería.

Ella es emprendedora, independiente, generosa, sensible, responsable y trabajadora. 
Su negocio lo desarrolla en el municipio de San Andres De Sotavento; un lugar donde la gente intenta buscar su sustento diario.

En su negocio ofrece productos como útiles escolares y en general productos de papelería y oficina.

Su sueño es incrementar sus ingresos económicos para abrir un gran almacén, ella desea realizar la compra de una fotocopiadora con el préstamo solicitado, para poder ofrecer el servicio de impresión y fotocopiado.
texts.en:
Mary is a 47-year-old woman.  She is separated and is the mother of one child.  Her business is a stationery store.

She is enterprising, independent, generous, sensitive, responsible, and hardworking.  She carries out her business in the town of San Andres De Sotavento, a place where people try to support themselves from day to day.

She sells products such as school supplies and paper or office supplies in her business.

Her dream is to increase her financial income in order to open a big department store.  She wants to buy a photocopy machine with the requested loan in order to be able to offer printing and photocopy services.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier in order to offer printing and photocopy services.

loans.name: Ariana

texts.en:
Ariana is 28 years old. She is the third born in a family of four children and lives in Lilongwe. Ariana had a hard time growing up and was not able to complete her diploma in "Hotel Management" due to financial challenges. Even her desire to start a business was hit with the difficulty of getting a loan. 

Today, Ariana is getting her first loan from Kiva to start running her own Zoona mobile money transfer business. Her business will provide financial services to people in her community. She will set up her business at one of the agricultural shops in Mitundu. People in Mitundu will be able to send and receive money from her kiosk. “Many people don’t like to travel to banks because it is expensive and the queues are long,” Ariana says. This business will give her the opportunity to make more income and provide for herself and her family. She will also be able to save and complete her education.

Ariana will use the loan to purchase a trading kiosk and a web-enabled phone. It will also provide her with the working capital float needed to serve the community in Mitundu with financial services.

loans.use: to purchase a trading kiosk, a web-enabled phone, and provide her with the working capital float needed to serve the community in Mitundu, Malawi

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is a 25-year-old secondary school certificate-holder, newlywed from Blantyre. At age 10, she lost her father. Living with her single mum with five other siblings made life very difficult growing up. With no money, no shoes and clothes, survival was very difficult. This did not discourage her from being focused, as her mother constantly encouraged her. Clara has the desire to want to grow and develop with every opportunity she gets.

Clara has successfully completed training with Zoona to start running her own business as a Zoona mobile money transfer agent in Kasungu. This means that Clara will offer the service of mobile money transfers in her community and earn a profit for every transaction that she makes. The prospect of running her own business excited Clara, and she believes that it will help her achieve and provide for her family and reduce the levels of poverty. She hopes the business will also make it easier for her community members to be able to send and receive money from far away.

Her dreams for the future are to have more Zoona business outlets and manage people. Hopefully one day, with this determination, she will have a diploma in business management, have her own land, and build a house.

When Clara receives the loan, she will be able to start her business by purchasing a small trading kiosk and a basic web-enabled phone, which she will use to make transactions, and to have the funds needed to serve the people in her community who need to access financial services.

loans.use: to start her business by purchasing a small trading kiosk and a basic web-enabled phone, and to have the funds needed to serve people in her community.

loans.name: Lovemore

texts.en:
Lovemore is 21 years old. He needs a loan to start running his own business. He is the firstborn in a family of three and lives with his mother in Namitete. Starting his own business is very important to Lovemore as it will help him earn profits to take care of his mother and two siblings.

In order to support his family, Lovemore started working as a shop attendant and uses the wages to provide for his family. He explains that he is not earning much as he works for a trader and stays at the shop to attend to customers. He has seen the opportunity to start running his own Zoona mobile money transfer business and is very excited about this prospect.

With the Zoona mobile money transfer business, Lovemore will be able provide financial services to people in the community by providing an easy way for them to move their monies. Lovemore’s loan will be used to provide the working capital he needs to get his Zoona business off the ground and start serving his community.

With this loan, he will pay for his setup costs. This loan will be used to buy a branded trading kiosk, framed fee posters, and some uniforms. He will also buy an Internet-enabled mobile phone. He will also use the funds as float to serve his customers. Once he starts earning a bit more money through his mobile money business, he will use the profits to go back to school.

loans.use: to set up his own Zoona mobile money transfer business by providing the funds needed to serve customers and to purchase the equipment needed for him to start transacting.

loans.name: Agness

texts.en:
Agness is a 22-year-old housewife living with her husband and their 3-year-old child in Blantyre. As a housewife, she finds it challenging supporting her husband in paying for house rental, feeding and meeting the basic daily needs of the family.

Agness would like to start running her own business as a Zoona mobile money transfer agent in Blantyre. She has seen an opportunity in her community for transferring money, as there are no banks. She wants to own a Zoona business, and she believes the business will give her the opportunity to make a difference in her community. She hopes to be a leader and a positive role model who will create jobs in her community.

“With the Kiva loan, everything will change. I will be able to achieve my goals,” she says enthusiastically.

With this Kiva loan, Agness will be able to buy a trading kiosk and a basic web-enabled phone and to have the money needed for her to start running her own business. She thanks the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy a trading kiosk and a basic web-enabled phone, and to have the money needed for her to start running her own business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a widow with five children and lives in a six-bedroom house in the northwest region of Cameroon. She has faced many challenges in life, such as the death of her husband, sickness, and family problems. She thinks her business will succeed because she has been in the business for a very long time, in addition to the training from GHAPE and advice from other agricultural organizations.

With this new loan requested from GHAPE, she intends to buy seedlings, piglets, and chicks and pay workers to work on the farm. 
This activity will actively help the community as people around her will not need to travel far distances to buy these products. It will also provide manure for the local community.

The profit realized from this activity will be used to increase the size of the farm, provide education for her children, and provide medication for the family in  case of ill health. 

Lucy prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the low interest rate and convenient repayment intervals, coupled with the fact that GHAPE offers non-financial services including training, social networking, and follow-up for proper utilization of the loan.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, piglets, chicks, and farm inputs, and to pay for tilling

loans.name: Kunthea's Group

texts.en:
Kunthea is a 42-year-old mother of two children; only one among them is in school. She is living in Mondulkiri province. The sources of her family’s income are from cassava farming and as a paid worker for about fifteen years. This earns her around 30,000 KHR per day.

Due to her crop not growing well last year, it caused her to face a difficult situation of lacking money to do farming for this season. To overcome this hardship, she is now leading a group to apply for a new Kiva loan via VisionFund. This is the second loan cycle for her, and the previous loan helped her to have a better living condition.

Now, she is willing to take her new loan portion to buy pesticides and other farming supplies. She hopes to earn more income and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Alinafe

texts.en:
Alinafe is 24 years old. She lives in a rented house with her mother, father, and her three siblings. Alinafe has completed training with Zoona to start running her own Zoona mobile money transfer business in her hometown of Kasungu in Malawi. Her business will provide the services of sending and receiving money to a lot of people in her community.

Alinafe is requesting a loan to help her start her business. This loan will help Alinafe pay for her set-up costs. She will be able to purchase a trading kiosk and a mobile phone to be used to serve her customers, and the loan will also provide Alinafe with the float needed for her to serve her customers.

Zoona has done market research in the area where Alinafe is going to set up and has determined that the location for this kiosk is ideal. Alinafe will be one of the main operators of Zoona mobile money transfers in Kasungu, and a large number of families will be using her service to send and receive their monies.

Alinafe’s dream is to be independent. Her goal is to stop depending on her parents, as it is difficult for her to buy basic necessities.

loans.use: to pay for her set-up costs such as float, a trading kiosk, and an Internet-enabled phone, and to have the funds needed for her to serve her customers.

loans.name: Khumbizeni

texts.en:
Khumbizeni very nearly didn't survive in 1995, when she was in grade 8. In that year she got very sick and had an unknown illness that caused her to lose her speech and mobility. The government hospitals could not help and her parents were unable to pay for her to go to a private hospital. The illness persisted and she was bedridden for eight years. When she got better, in the year 2004, Khumbizeni went back to school and was the oldest person in class. This did not stop her and she ended up completing her high school education and going to college to obtain a diploma in front office administration.

Today Khumbizeni has successfully completed training with Zoona to start running her own business as a Zoona mobile money transfer agent in Mchinji. Mchinji is a small border town in the central part of Malawi. Khumbizeni is excited to start running her own business; she sees this as an opportunity to grow herself and become financially independent. The business will also enable her community to have access to financial services close by. Although newer operators have begun to extend services in Malawi, the sector remains basic and highly limited; and by setting up mobile money outlets, more people will have access to financial services.

Khumbizeni is requesting a loan in order to pay for her set-up costs. The loan will be used to buy a trading kiosk, from which she will operate, and a basic mobile phone, which she will use to serve customers, and it will provide the working capital float needed for her to run her business successfully.

Khumbizeni says once she starts operating her business, her life will change as she will be able to earn some money and help her parents, who have always believed in her.

loans.use: to buy a small trading kiosk and a basic web-enabled mobile phone and to provide the working capital float needed for her to start serving customers

loans.name: Penjani

texts.en:
Penjani is 25 years old. She lost both her parents when she was young and has struggled to get through college and support herself with only the support of her aunt, who took her in.

Penjani would like to start running her own business. She requires a loan from Kiva to make this happen. This loan will help Penjani pay for her set-up costs. She will be able to purchase a trading kiosk and a mobile phone to be used to serve her customers, and the loan will also provide her with the float she needs for serving people who need to access financial services.

Zoona has done market research in Dedza, the area where Penjani is going to set up, and has determined that the location for this kiosk is ideal. Penjani will be one of the operators of Zoona mobile money transfers in Dedza, and a large number of families will be using her service to send and receive their monies.

This opportunity to run her own business means a lot to Penjani. She will have some income to cater for her basic needs as she is currently unemployed and struggles to meet ends meet. She is hopeful that she will become financially stable through this business, and she hopes to be able to sponsor herself to go back to school and get a Bachelor's degree in human resources.

loans.use: to purchase a kiosk and a mobile phone and to provide funds needed for her to run her business

loans.name: Luz Mery

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer muy emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar.
Desde hace 5 años se viene dedicando a la venta de calzado, estos productos los vende principalmente a amigos, vecinos y familiares que conocen a Luz y quieren que también progrese en su actividad.

Desde muy niña sintió gran afinidad con el comercio y las ventas, por lo que hoy en día tiene grandes habilidades en este campo gracias a su simpatía y excelente calidad de servicio.

Solicita un préstamo para comprar surtido de chanclas, botas, zapatillas, tenis, entre otros para aumentar su inventario y mejorar sus ventas, obteniendo así unos buenos ingresos para su hogar

Tiene la esperanza de poder salir adelante gracias al apoyo de las personas de buen corazón que apoyan este tipo de proyectos y al acompañamiento de la Corporación Interactuar.
texts.en:
Luz is a very enterprising woman and eager to succeed and improve. She has been selling shoes for five years. Luz mainly sells these products to friends, neighbors and relatives that know her and also want her to succeed in her business. 

Since she was a child she felt a great affinity to trade and sales which is why today she is very skilled in this area, thanks to her friendliness and excellent quality of service. 

She is requesting a loan to buy an assortment of sandals, boots, slippers, and sneakers among others to increase her inventory and improve her sales thereby generating a good income for her home. 

She hopes to succeed thanks to the support from the kind-hearted people that support these types of projects and the accompanying Corporación Interactuar.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of sandals, boots, slippers, sneakers, among others.

loans.name: Daniel Santos

texts.es:
Daniel es un padre de 50 años de edad, emprendedor y dinámico. 
Con el ánimo de generar ingresos para aportar a la economía familiar, decidió iniciar su propio negocio de venta de alimentos, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa que le colabora en las mañanas, así ha logrado solventar los gastos familiares y personales durante 25 años que lleva funcionando su negocio. 

El crédito que solicita estará destinado para la  abriendo paso para un mejoramiento en las ventas y por ende, en los ingresos que percibe. 

Daniel, con su espíritu de superación y su proyección hacia la consecución de sus objetivos, se traza la meta de ampliar su negocio, para tener la capacidad de atender a mayor cantidad de clientes, mejorando así la rentabilidad del negocio para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Daniel is an enterprising and dynamic 50 year old father. With the goal of generating income to support the family economy he decided to start his own business selling food. He has the support of his wife who works with him in the mornings. Doing this he has managed to pay the household expenses for the 25 years he has run the business.

The loan that he is requesting is designated to opening a path for improvement in his sales and in the end, the revenues he earns. Daniel with his spirit of excelling and his vision towards reaching his objectives in order to have the capacity to serve a greater quantity of clients, improving the profitability of his business to have a higher quality of living.

loans.use: to buy an electric mill which will allow him to continue with his work and offer his food in the best possible manner.

loans.name: Robinson Rafael

texts.es:
A sus 50 años, Robinson tiene mucha energía y empuje para trabajar en su negocio de parqueadero en el municipio de Sahagun.

Vive en una humilde casa con su compañera sentimental y tiene la increíble cantidad de 10 hijos a quienes enseña el valor del trabajo duro y el valor del cuidado a la familia.

Actualmente enfrenta problemas en su negocio como la competencia en el sector.

Esto intenta contrarrestarlo ofreciendo un espacio más cómodo para sus clientes, a quienes aspira ofrecerles un servicio de mucha calidad.

Solicita un préstamo para comprar los materiales y poder realizar una adecuación locativa en su parqueadero.
texts.en:
At 50 years old, Robinson has a lot of energy and drive to work in his parking business in the Sahagun municipality. He lives in a humble home with his partner and he has the incredible amount of 10 children. He teaches them the value of hard work and the value of taking care of the family.

Currently, he has problems with his business because of the competition in the area. He is trying to counteract this by offering a more comfortable space for his customers. He hopes to offer them quality service. He is requesting the loan to purchase materials to make some improvements to his parking lot.

loans.use: to purchase materials to be able to make some improvements to his parking lot business.

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is an emerging entrepreneur. He is 25 years old and comes from a family of two siblings. He lives in a rented house with his family.

Reuben has just completed training with Zoona to start running his own Zoona mobile money transfer business. He is very happy with this life-changing opportunity and promises to work hard to service his community of Kasungu in Malawi. Reuben has always wanted to run his own business and feels this is a wonderful opportunity to live his dream.

His business will provide financial services to people in his community. They will be able to send and receive money from his Zoona kiosk. He plans to open his kiosk seven days a week so that customers can have access to mobile money every day. 

Reuben has requested a Kiva loan so that he can pay for his set-up costs. This loan will be used to buy a branded trading kiosk and a basic web-enabled phone. The funds will also be used as float for him to serve his customers. Reuben's business will deal in the transferring of money from one place to another. 

Reuben is hopeful that the profits he will get from his business will help him to provide for his basic needs. He explains that one of the challenges he faces is that he does not have any source of income and has to constantly ask his father for help. He thanks Zoona and Kiva for helping him set up his business. Reuben's dream is to grow his business and own land one day.

loans.use: to buy a small trading kiosk and a phone and to provide the cash needed for him to serve customers

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is from Lilongwe, Malawi. She is a focused business owner who dropped out of school due to financial challenges but plans to go back in the future once her financial status improves. Alice is 34 years old and has successfully completed her training with Zoona to start running her own business in Mchinji, Malawi. Her business will provide financial services such as mobile money transfers and bill payments.

Alice is the first of four children. She dropped out of high school because her parents could not afford to pay for her school fees. As the eldest in the family, she had to drop out so that her siblings could get a chance to go to school. She then started her own business supplying cosmetics to people in her community. She is still running the business and is hopeful that by adding mobile money transfers to her line of business, she will become financially stable and be in a position to support her siblings so that they have a chance to finish their education. 

With this Kiva loan, Alice will be able to add mobile money transfers to her cosmetics business by buying a trading kiosk where she will serve her customers and buying a web-enabled phone that she will use to make her transactions. This loan will also help Alice have the funds needed for her to serve her customers. Alice says she plans on seizing the opportunity through Kiva to start and grow her Zoona business.

loans.use: to pay for her set-up costs such as purchasing a trading kiosk and a web-enabled mobile phone as well as to provide the funds needed for her to serve people who need to access financial services

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is married and has four children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has owned a food stall business, near neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café .

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Walberto Jose

texts.es:
Walberto se ha caracterizado entre sus clientes como un hombre amable y carismático, con 26 años de edad, se dedica a atender su propio negocio, pues tiene una venta de pescado que comenzó hace aproximadamente 3 años; allí tiene la ventaja de tener una muy buena ubicación, pues se encuentra en el parque principal del municipio donde reside. 

Su experiencia en ventas la obtuvo empíricamente, por lo que su conocimiento en el manejo de comercio es amplio. 

El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para comprar surtido al por mayor de pescado de diferentes especies, así tendrá más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes y satisfacer los diferentes gustos y necesidades; lo que le generará mejores ventas e ingresos para seguir luchando para cumplir su propósito a mediano plazo, que es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, en la que pueda compartir con su familia y que su negocio le genere mayor rentabilidad para dar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Walberto has been characterized among his customers as a friendly and charismatic man. He is 26 years old and looks after his own business selling fish, a business he began about three years ago. He has the advantage of having a very good location since he is in the main square of the town where he lives. He obtained his experience with sales empirically so his knowledge of handling trade is broad. 

The loan he is requesting is a support to buy wholesale an assortment of different species of fish. This will allow him to have more variety to offer his customers and meet their different tastes and needs. In turn, this will generate better sales and income to keep persevering to meet his goals for the near future which are to improve his housing conditions, which he can share with this family, and that his business generate more income to give his children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale an assortment of fish or different species.

loans.name: Emma

texts.es:
Emma de 27 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, actualmente es madre soltera y con ella vive su mamá.

Emma se dedica a la venta de alhajas o prendas de vestir, esta actividad la aprendió de una vecina; ella sale a vender los productos a lugares cercanos donde viven sus principales clientes.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar más prendas de acero.

Emma sueña con darle a su familia todo lo necesario para tener una vida digna, especialmente a su hija, ya que desea brindarle una buena educación y todo lo que ella necesite.
texts.en:
Emma is 27 years and a graduate from secondary school. She is a single mother and her mother lives with her. Emma works selling jewellery and clothing. She learned the business from a neighbor. She goes out to sell her products in places close to where her main clients live.

She needs a loan to buy more steel jewellery. Emma dreams of providing her family with all they need to have a dignified life, especially for her daughter. She wants to provide her a good education and all that she needs.

loans.use: to buy more steel jewellery.

loans.name: Kunthea's Group

texts.en:
Kunthea is 35 years old and a married mother of two children who are all in school, living in Pursat province. The sources of her family’s income are from growing rice and fishing for 17 years. Floods and insects destroying her crop are the main challenges for her to find income to support her family’s needs.  

Kunthea has been with VisionFund for one cycle already and fully paid back the loan. The previous loan helped her to have ability to send her children to school and buy enough household supplies to use. Due to lack of funds, she is now leading a group to take a new Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide for her farming. She hopes to earn more money and the ability for a new business of feeding pigs for sale, to earn additional income for her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide for her farming.

loans.name: Las Guerreras De Satipo Group

texts.es: Este grupo “Las Guerreras De Satipo”  está emprendiendo su segundo ciclo. La mayoría de los socios se conocen entre sí y son responsables. Este es el segundo crédito de Gloria de 36  años de edad, separada con tres pequeñas hijas que aun cursan estudio secundario y primario. Hace seis años ella se dedica de administrar su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes en un local alquilado como el ingreso no era suficiente ya que ella se hace cargo de los gastos de su familia decidió implementar un espacio para cabinas de internet. Con los ingresos de ambos negocios solventas los gastos de su hogar. Una de sus metas de Gloria es comprar una moto lineal para poder trasladarse con facilidad. Solicito el crédito para la compra de mercadería de abarrotes. Gloria es la persona que viste blusa de color negro. Se siente muy contenta y agradecida por la oportunidad que les brinda los inversionistas  Kiva.
texts.en:
The "Las Guerreras De Satipo" group is undertaking its second loan cycle. The majority of the members know each other and are responsible. 

This is Gloria's second loan. She is 36 years old and separated with three young daughters who are in primary and secondary school. For the past six years she has been running her own business selling groceries from a rented shop. When she became responsible for her family expenses, she found her income was not sufficient. So she decided to set up a space for public internet access. With the income from both businesses she is able to pay the household expenses. One of Gloria's goals is to buy a motorbike to travel more easily.     

She is asking for a loan to purchase grocery merchandise. In the photo, Gloria is wearing a black blouse. She really appreciates the opportunity afforded to her by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase grocery merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Mirtolina

texts.es: Doña Maria de 63 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella se dedica desde hace 20 años a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz, cuando ya está su cosecha la comercializa en los pueblos aledaños, ya tiene muchos clientes fijos, Maria está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria is 63 years old and lives in her own home with her son. For the last 20 years she has made a living in agriculture growing maize. After the harvest she sells her produce in the nearby towns and has many steady customers. 

Maria is asking for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides, herbicides, etc. to improve the land shown in the photo. As this is her only source of work, she wants to be able to continue growing her crops to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides, herbicides, etc to improve the land.

loans.name: Rosmira

texts.es:
Rosmira encuentra en su familia la fuerza y motivación para luchar cada día buscando obtener uno buenos ingresos para sostenerse y Salir adelante.

Tiene una pequeña chaza en la que vende comestibles y bebidas y desea darle un gran impulso a este negocio con un préstamo.

El dinero será invertido en la compra de snacks, golosinas, gaseosas, entre otros; alimentos que servirán para abastecer su negocio y hacer mas solido.
texts.en:
Rosmira comes from a strong family, so she is motivated each day to find ways of generating a good income in order to support them and allow them to get ahead. She has a small stall where she sells food and beverages. Rosmira wants to provide a great boost to her business with this loan.

The money will be invested in the purchase of snacks, sweets, sodas, and other items. She will be able to restock with these types of food products and her business will become more solid.

loans.use: to buy snacks, sweets, sodas, and other items.

loans.name: Jorge Arbey

texts.es:
Con su negocio de venta de frutas, Jorge trata de encontrar el sustento diario para su familia. Vive en el municipio de Medellín y con gran esfuerzo y dedicación ha podido tener una vida digna.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de frutas para abastecer su negocio, frutas como mangos, manzanas, bananos, peras, entre muchos otros.

Con este crédito podrá darle un impulso significativo a su actividad y tendrá la motivación suficiente para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Jorge tries to earn his family's daily bread with his fruit sales business. He lives in the municipality of Medellin, and through great effort and dedication, he has been able to live a decent life.

He is applying for a loan to buy a variety of fruits to stock his business -- fruits such as mangoes, apples, bananas, pears, and many others. With this loan, he will be able to give his business a significant boost, and he will have enough motivation to move forward.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruits to stock his business -- fruits such as mangoes, apples, bananas, pears, and many others.

loans.name: Cindy Fernanda

texts.es:
Cindy es una joven emprendedora, humilde y aplicada, desde hace 5 años comenzó con una legumbreria que hasta ahora le ha dado muy buenos resultados. Ella vive en el municipio de Medellín con su esposo al cual manifiesta que tiene mucho que agradecerle en la vida.

Ella trabaja de todos los días durante 8 horas atendiendo un número de cliente medianamente alto.

Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar productos a granel como granos, frutas y verduras, y de éste modo satisfacer los deseos de los clientes que le piden estos productos.

Esta ayuda le permitirá inyectar variedad a su negocio y le brindara la jugosa oportunidad de mejorar sus ventas y sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Cindy is a young, modest, and diligent entrepreneur. Five years ago, she started a vegetable stand, which has given her good results so far. She lives in the municipality of Medellín with her husband, who she says gives her a lot to be grateful for in life.

She works 8 hours a day, everyday, attending a mid-range number of customers. She is applying for a loan to buy bulk goods such as grains, fruits, and vegetables, in order to satisfy the wishes of her customers who request these products.

This assistance will allow her to introduce variety into her business and will give her the lucrative opportunity to improve her sales and her family's income.

loans.use: to buy bulk goods such as grains, fruits, and vegetables, in order to satisfy the wishes of her customers who request these products.

loans.name: Los Claveles Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS CLAVELES” iniciarán el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sandra es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de máquinas de coser, venta de faldas, venta de chalecos, venta de chamarras, venta de coca, venta de CD.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sandra es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la promoción de una asesora de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de máquinas de coser; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de  su papá hace seis años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de máquinas de coser por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto para posteriormente comercializarlo en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Las Claveles" ["The Carnations"] community bank will begin its first semester in Pro Mujer, as part of the Collpani Regional Hub. It is made up of eight members and is headed by a board whose president is Sandra.

The businesses of the community bank members are varied and include: sewing machine sales, skirt sales, vest sales, jacket sales, coca sales, and CD sales.

The loan they will take out will benefit microenterprises of which Sandra is a member. She says that this is the first time Pro Mujer is getting involved, through the facilitation of one of the organization's consultants.

Sandra currently has a business selling sewing machines. She says she learned this business from her father six years ago.

The loan she will take out now is to increase her working capital (purchasing sewing machines wholesale) that she will acquire from wholesalers in the city of El Alto in order to subsequently sell them in her sales area. This type of work will allow her to generate resources to support her family financially, since she lives in a common-law marriage and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Sandra says that she likes the health trainings that the organization offers.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines wholesale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 53 years old and married with two children, one of whom is still in school. For the past ten years she has run a sari-sari, or small general store in the Philippines.

Elizabeth has applied for a 20,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy more inventory for her store, such as cookies, coffee, candies, noodles, cereal, salt, etc. She is always working on building and expanding her store so as to give her family a secure future.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her sari-sari

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. for her general store business.

Marcelina has been in this business for 19 years. She also earns more income from buying and selling fish. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.  Marcelina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall for her buy-and-sell vegetables business.

Gina has been in this business for 15 years. She earns more income from food vending and a general store.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Fedson

texts.en:
Fedson is a 27-year-old man living in Dowa, Malawi, where he grew up and went to secondary school. Like many young men, he dreamed of going to college and getting a job, but despite his efforts, he has not been able to find permanent employment and did not complete his college education due to lack of financial support. Fedson has a four-year-old son who lives with his girlfriend's mother since Fedson currently does not have his own place. He is now determined to start running his own business, so that he can live with his son.

Fedson is excited to start running his own business; his business will deal in mobile money transfers. Fedson will set up his business in Dowa and have a trolley set up where he will be serving people in the community who need to access affordable financial services. The community will benefit from Fedson's business because they will have easy access to mobile money transfers and have a safe way to move their money. 

This loan will help Fedson to set up his business by providing the capital he needs to start operating the business. With the money, he will be able to buy a trolley, where he will be serving customers, and buy a phone. This loan will also provide Fedson with the money he needs to serve customers in his community. 

Fedson is grateful for the opportunity to be connected to Kiva. He says he is motivated to work hard and make his business a success, so that he can be in a position to start living on his own and bring his son to live with him.

loans.use: to set up his business by providing the capital he needs to start operating the business.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma is married and a hardworking woman with five children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She supplements this income by buying and selling rice.

Lerma took out and successfully repaid previous loans through Kiva's field partner NWTF and is now applying for one of 21,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lerma is working hard continuously to gradually build up her rice farm and give her family a secure future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies for her rice fields

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa, 48, is married and has six children, all of whom are in school. For the past four years she has sold fish to earn a living in the Philippines.

Felisa has applied for a 10,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers. Her goal is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles grew up watching traders all around him. His parents ran their own small business and so did some of his aunties and uncles. Malawi, with few large-scale retailers, is mainly dependent on small traders to move and supply goods. Growing up, Charles always wanted to run his own business and become successful so that he could help support his siblings. He explains that his parents struggle to pay for their school fees, as they do not earn a lot from their small business. Charles has three sisters and two brothers.

Charles faces a challenge accessing capital for him to start running his own business. He has a high school education and when he tried to access a loan through the bank, he was sent back as he does not have any collateral. Malawi's financial sector is basic and highly limited.

Charles is requesting a Kiva loan so that he can start running his own mobile money transfer business as an agent for Zoona, in Malawi. This means that Charles will set up a small trolley outside one of the popular agriculture shops in Kasungu, and offer mobile money and bill payment services to people in his community. He will earn an income for providing the service. This loan will be used for Charles to purchase a small trolley, a basic phone, which he will use to make transactions, and provide the funds needed for him to serve his community. Charles is happy to start his business. He hopes to be a good example and show the community that hard work pays off and give his fellow youths the same opportunity, once his business grows. He explains that employment in Malawi is very hard to find and by setting up his mobile money outlet, he can contribute positively to job creation.

Charles thanks the Kiva lenders for this life changing opportunity to start his own business.

loans.use: to purchase a small trolley, a basic phone and provide the cash needed to serve people in Kasungu, Malawi who need to access financial services

loans.name: Vy's Group

texts.en:
A 54-year-old, mother of three children, Vy is a rural villager living in Siem Reap province. Working as a construction worker has been the main source of her family’s income for one year. She can earn about 20,000 KHR per day. 

Because her house is now getting too old for staying and she does not enough funds, she is now leading a group to take a new loan via VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, to buy wood and cement to renovate her old house. This is the fifth loan cycle for Vy and the previous loans have helped her to have a better living condition. For this loan, she hopes to have a suitable house for her family and improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy wood and cement to renovate her old house.

location.town: Siem Reap district, Siem Reap province

loans.name: Nuswaiba

texts.en:
Nuswaiba is married and has two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has owned a food stall business for neighbors and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
A sus 24 años, Elizabeth luego de quedarse sin empleo, inicio a trabajar ofreciendo servicios de recreación para niños en el municipio de el Sincelejo, desde entonces viene trabajando básicamente con un trampolín, una gran diversión para chicos y jóvenes.

Desea un crédito para la compra de un castillo inflable, con el cual podrá ampliar su oferta de servicios que a su vez atraerá más clientes y aumentar sus ingresos.

Apoya con un préstamo a una joven con gran voluntad y ganas de progresar!
texts.en:
24 years old Elizabeth, after loosing her job, started offering recreation services for children of the Sincelejo municipality. Since then she has been working basically with a trampoline, a great entertainment for kids and teenagers.

She would like a loan to purchase an inflatable castle. With it she will be able to expand the services she offers and at the same time attract more customers and increase her revenue. Support a young woman, who has will power and  who wants to get ahead, with a loan!

loans.use: to purchase an inflatable castle to expand the services she offers and at the same time attract more customers and increase her revenue.

loans.name: Florence Bih

texts.en:
Florence is single with two children and lives in a two room house in the North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced a lot of challenges in life which are the death of her father and sister and the collapse of her kitchen with her children inside. 

With the new loan acquired she will buy second hand dresses, exercise books, pencils, pens, piglets and feed for the piglets. She is very certain that this business will succeed because she has been doing it for long; she always advertises the business when it slow and she has many customers.

This activity will help the local community in that they will not go long distances to buy dresses, the society will be neat and the manure from the pig farm will help farmers in their farms. 
With the profit from the activity carried out with the loan, she will be able to pay her children school fees, expand her business, improve on the family living standard and improve on the health condition of the family.  

She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the low increase rate, convenient repayment interval and the training they give before loan disbursement

loans.use: buy second hand dresses, exercise books, pens, pencils and to pay her children's school fees

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is 47 years old and lives in Irbid with her retired husband and her five kids.  They were living a simple and well off life until Rania`s father died.  She was very upset about his death but then she decided to be stronger, to be able to care for her sister who needs special care because she is sick.

Rania`s siblings refused to help their sick sister, therefore Rania took her sister to live with her and decided to start business to become able to provide a treatment for her and to increase her incomes to help her husband in the household expenses.

She is selling cosmetics and accessories at her home and now she is applying for a loan to help her buy more products to sell and to do good promotion for her business to raise her customers and her profits.

loans.use: to buy more products and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Phoeun

texts.en:
