Phoeun is from  Banteay Chmar, a village in the North-West of Cambodia. He is 54 years old. He lives in a wooden pile house with his wife (who is also a weaver) and his son, who is still studying. His 3 other children are already working and/or married. His family owns 1.5 hectares of cassava fields. 

In 2013 he was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of men and women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. Phoeun makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. He uses his weaving income to pay for his  family expenses, to buy diesel and fertilizer for his field and to develop his business;  Thanks to the loan, he will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support him so he can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar, 34, lives with his mother in the village of Gagarin within Armenia’s Gegharkunik region. He is an experienced farmer who is well-educated in fields other than farming.

On his farm Edgar has cows, a calf, sheep and chickens. His animals give him products to sell such as milk, macun (a paste used in a Turkish dessert), meat and eggs that his mother sells to their neighbors and regular customers. Edgar also grows potatoes, which he sells directly from his farm to resellers.

Edgar is applying for a 700,000 AMD loan through Kiva's field partner Nor Horizon to buy two more cows and fodder for his cattle.

loans.use: to buy two more cows and fodder for his cattle.

loans.name: Elham

texts.en:
Elham is an amazing mother who lives in Irbid. She has seven children. She is working hard to ensure a good life for them and to provide everything they need. 

Elham`s husband earns a low income at his job and is unable to cover all the needs of his big family. Elham wants to help him in any way she can. Because she is a very productive and ambitious woman, she decided to open her own business. Elham started selling food supplies from her home many years ago. Then she took a loan to expand her work by opening her independent grocery near her home.

Now Elham wants to expand her business more and buy what she needs to increase her profits. She applied for a loan to help her buy more food supplies and new kinds of products. She needs your support to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy more food supplies and new kinds of products

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en:
Kong is 47 years old and living in Siem province. She is a mother of six children and only two of them are in school. Raising pigs has been the source of her family’s income for 20 years.  Kong has been with VisionFund for three cycles already and has fully paid back the loans. The previous loans helped her to have a better house to stay in. 

Because her pigs are not growing well, it causes her to get a low income and not have enough funds to support her current business. Because of this case, she is now leading a group to take a new Kiva loan and she will take her entire loan portion to buy eight piglets and take the rest of money to buy more pig feed to support her business. She hopes to earn more money and the ability to keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy eight piglets and take the rest of the money to buy more pig feed to support her business.

location.town: Siem Reap district, Siem Reap province

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is married with six children. The family lives in a three-bedroom house in Bamenda in the North West Province of Cameroon. Illness has been a challenge in her life.

Julie feels confidence in her farm because she has farmed so long and has been trained in basic farming skills. She is applying for a 450,000 XAF loan through Kiva's field partner GHAPE to buy cocoa seedlings and pay for workers to clear her land and plant her crop.

Julie will use her profits to educate her children, build her family a house, improve her farm and buy more farmland. Her community will benefit from her loan in that she will provide employment for youths and food for the community.

Julie prefers taking a loan from GHAPE for several reasons: It offers low interest rates, does not ask for a collateral security and so alleviates stress on its clients. GHAPE also offers services such as training and social networking.

loans.use: to buy cocoa seedlings and pay for workers to clear her land and plant her crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
Andresa is a 50-year-old woman from Alegria, Cebu. She has been in the hog-raising and general store business for ten years now. This is her only source of income. She is supporting the needs of her children, ages 12 and 9.

Andresa is in need of additional capital for her business. She is asking for a loan worth PHP 8,000 to buy feed, biscuits, sugar, canned foods, seasoning, and toiletries. With this she will be able to expand her business and augment her income.

Andresa dreams of making her business a successful one. She believes that if she is provided with financial support such as this loan, she can finally realize her dream of making her business a productive one.

loans.use: to buy feed, biscuits, sugar, canned foods, seasoning and toiletries

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is married with four children.  She is a member of Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.  
 
Emelyn supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines.  She took out an educational loan for her daughter Joylyn, 19 years old, who is the first of four children in the family. 

Joylyn is studying for a bachelor of science in education, and is currently in the third year of this four year course.  Emelyn is borrowing PHP 14,700 to pay tuition of Joylyn for the first semester of the school year 2015-2016.

Joylyn plans when she graduates to help her parents earn an income to send her brother and sister to college.

loans.use: to to pay tuition.

loans.name: Angela Patricia

texts.es:
Angela es una bella mujer de 27 años de edad, madre de una hija de 2 años, criada con unas muy buenas costumbres, desde el colegio desarrollo una gran pasión y gusto por todo lo relacionado con la belleza.  

Inicio su etapa productiva realizando cursos y capacitaciones, hasta que un día se aventuró y decidió ir en busca de su propia clientela montando un negocio de salón de belleza en su hogar. 

Solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido pues también quiere vender productos para complementar sus servicios, como crema de manos, gel, productos capilares, tinturas para cabello, barnices, también realizará algunas mejoras locativas.

El crédito para ella será muy importante pues terminara de consolidar su empresa completándola con todos los insumos necesarios para operar y ofrecer cualquier servicio que lleguen a solicitarle.

Su sueño es que su empresa progrese de la mano de Interactuar y tenga muchos clientes.
texts.en:
Angela is a beautiful 27-year-old woman and the mother of a 2-year-old girl. She was raised with good traditions and, since she was in school, has developed a great passion for anything related to beauty.

She began by taking courses and going through training until one day, she took a chance and decided to look for her own clientele, starting a beauty salon in her home. 

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies. She also wants to sell products to supplement her services, such as hand lotion, gel, hair products, hair dye, and nail polish. She will also make improvements to her business. 

This loan is very important to her. She will strengthen her business by making all the payments on time in order to provide any service her customers might ask for. 

Her dream is for her business to grow with the help from Interactuar and by having many customers.

loans.use: to buy supplies. She also wants to sell products to supplement her services, such as hand lotion, gel, hair products, hair dye, and nail polish.

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani lives in Salt, she is 29 years old and married with four children.

Amani decided to open her business because of the high cost of living for her and her husband, they became unable to cover the household and educational expenses.  Because she believes that life is participation in all aspects, she started to sell household supplies in her home to help her husband.

Amani is running her project and the problem that she is facing is low liquidity, therefore she applied for a loan to buy more household supplies and products to sell. She hopes to expand the project to become a shop.

loans.use: to buy more household supplies and products to sell to support her family

loans.name: Reinaldo Manuel

texts.es:
Reinaldo de 62 años de edad, se ha ganado el cariño de todos sus vecinos por su amabilidad y buen sentido del humor. 

Ama su familia, la cual es el motor principal para luchar cada día y generar el sustento para sobrevivir. 

Aunque no contaba con recursos para iniciar su negocio, esto no fue impedimento para cumplir su sueño de convertirse en comerciante, con un pequeño capital, este hombre inició con un negocio de tienda de abarrotes.

Sus sueños no paran, por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de estanterías para ubicar sus productos y hacerlos más visibles y atractivos a sus clientes, además comprara surtido de productos de la canasta familiar para abastecer su negocio. 

Espera poder mejorar su condición económica, poder tener una vejez sin preocupaciones monetarias y garantizarle a su familia un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Reinaldo is 62 years old and has earned the affection of all his neighbours for his friendliness and sense of humour. 

He loves his family which is his driving force to fight every day and earn a living in order to survive.   

Although he had no resources to start his business, this wasn't an obstacle in achieving his dream of becoming a shop owner. So, with only a small amount of capital he started a grocery shop.

His dreams don't stop there and for this reason he is applying for a loan that he will invest in the purchase of shelving. This will allow him to display his products and make them more visible and appealing to his customers.  Also, he will buy a range of staple goods in order to stock his shop. 

He hopes to improve his money situation in order to be able to have an old age with no money worries and guarantee himself and his family a better life.

loans.use: to purchase shelving in order to display his products and make them more visible and appealing to his customers.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida, 64, is married and an energetic woman who is living with her spouse and six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband runs a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc. He derives his household necessities from his own store, and some of his relatives frequent his store as well.

Shahida’s husband’s store is well-known in town, and he has many customers. He speaks in an impressively monotonous tone that allows him to easily win the trust of others. Due to his excellent salesmanship he has built up very good relations with his customers.

Ironically, because of his success Shahida’s husband does not have sufficient inventory to cope with his customers’ demands. Therefore Shahida has requested a 100,000 PKR loan for her husband so that he can buy more stocks of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, cookies, etc.

Shahida hopes that her husband will use the loan in a strategic way that will help him to meet both his customers’ demands and the needs of her family. She gives thanks to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her husband's general store

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 39-year-old married women. She is a mother of five children. Her husband is a government employee. In addition to that, he has started a clothing business. He wants to support his family through this business as well. He purchases a variety of clothes from different areas and sells them at a profitable price in the main market.

Presently, her husband needs to purchase some clothes to sell. However, due to a lack of finances, he is facing a problem buying them. For that reason, she requested a loan from Kiva and its partner BRAC Pakistan. She is thankful to her Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy clothing for her husband to resell
